  role="guilabel"}                                                                            

  `Argentinean Electronic Invoicing`{.interpreted-text   [l10n_ar_edi]{.title-ref}            Includes all technical and functional requirements to generate electronic
  role="guilabel"}                                                                            invoices via web service, based on the AFIP regulations.

  `Argentinean eCommerce`{.interpreted-text              [l10n_ar_website_sale]{.title-ref}   (optional) Allows the user to see Identification Type and AFIP Responsibility in
  role="guilabel"}                                                                            the eCommerce checkout form in order to create electronic invoices.
  -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

### Configure your company

Once the localization modules are installed, the first step is to set up
the company\'s data. In addition to the basic information, a key field
to fill in is the `AFIP Responsibility
Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, which represents the fiscal
obligation and structure of the company.

![Select AFIP Responsibility Type.](argentina/select-responsibility-type.png){.align-center}

### Chart of account

In Accounting, there are three different
`Chart of Accounts`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} packages to
choose from. They are based on a company\'s AFIP responsibility type,
and consider the difference between companies that do not require as
many accounts as the companies that have more complex fiscal
requirements:

- Monotributista (227 accounts);
- IVA Exento (290 accounts);
- Responsable Inscripto (298 Accounts).

![Select Fiscal Localization Package.](argentina/select-fiscal-package.png){.align-center}

### Configure master data

#### Electronic Invoice Credentials

##### Environment

The AFIP infrastructure is replicated in two separate environments,
**testing** and **production**.

Testing is provided so that the companies can test their databases until
they are ready to move into the **Production** environment. As these two
environments are completely isolated from each other, the digital
certificates of one instance are not valid in the other one.

To select a database environment, go to
`Accounting --> Settings --> Argentinean
Localization`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"} and choose either
`Prueba (Testing)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or
`Produccion (Production)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

![Select AFIP database environment: Testing or Production.](argentina/select-environment.png){.align-center}

##### AFIP certificates

The electronic invoice and other AFIP services work with
`Web Services (WS)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} provided by the
AFIP.

In order to enable communication with the AFIP, the first step is to
request a `Digital
Certificate`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} if you do not have one
already.

1.  `Generate Certificate Sign Request (Odoo)`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}. When this option is selected, a file with
    extension [.csr]{.title-ref} (certificate signing request) is
    generated to be used in the AFIP portal to request the certificate.

    ![Request a certificate.](argentina/request-certificate.png)

2.  `Generate Certificate (AFIP)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
    Access the AFIP portal and follow the instructions described in
    [this
    document](https://drive.google.com/file/d/17OKX2lNWd1bjUt3NxfqcCKBkBh-Xlpo-/view)
    to get a certificate.

3.  `Upload Certificate and Private Key (Odoo)`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}. Once the certificate is generated, upload it to
    Odoo using the `Pencil`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} icon next
    to the field `Certificado`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
    select the corresponding file.

    ![Upload Certificate and Private Key.](argentina/upload-certificate-private-key.png)

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

In case you need to configure the Homologation Certificate, please refer
to the AFIP official documentation: [Homologation
Certificate](http://www.afip.gob.ar/ws/documentacion/certificados.asp).
Furthermore, Odoo allows the user to test electronic invoicing locally
without a Homologation Certificate. The following message will be in the
chatter when testing locally:

![Invoice validated locally because it is in a testing environment without testing
certificate/keys.](argentina/local-testing.png){.align-center}
::::

#### Partner

##### Identification type and VAT

As part of the Argentinean localization, document types defined by the
AFIP are now available in the **Partner form**. Information is essential
for most transactions. There are six
`Identification Types`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} available by
default, as well as 32 inactive types.

![A list of AR Localization document types in Odoo, as defined by AFIP.](argentina/identification-types.png){.align-center}

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The complete list of `Identification Types`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} defined by the AFIP is included in Odoo, but only the
common ones are active.
::::

##### AFIP responsibility type

In Argentina, the document type and corresponding transactions
associated with customers and vendors is defined by the AFIP
Responsibility type. This field should be defined in the **Partner
form**.

![Select AFIP Responsibility Type.](argentina/select-afip-responsibility-type.png){.align-center}

#### Taxes

As part of the localization module, the taxes are created automatically
with their related financial account and configuration, e.g., 73 taxes
for `Responsable Inscripto`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

![A list of AR Localization taxes with financial amount and configuration in Odoo.](argentina/automatic-tax-configuration.png){.align-center}

##### Taxes types

Argentina has several tax types, the most common ones are:

- `VAT`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: this is the regular VAT and
  can have various percentages;
- `Perception`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: advance payment of a
  tax that is applied on invoices;
- `Retention`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: advance payment of a
  tax that is applied on payments.

##### Special taxes

Some Argentinean taxes are not commonly used for all companies, and
those less common options are labeled as inactive in Odoo by default.
Before creating a new tax, be sure to check if that tax is not already
included as inactive.

![A list showing less common Argentinean tax options, which are labeled as inactive in Odoo
by default.](argentina/special-inactive-taxes.png){.align-center}

#### Document types

In some Latin American countries, like Argentina, some accounting
transactions such as invoices and vendor bills are classified by
document types defined by the governmental fiscal authorities. In
Argentina, the [AFIP](https://www.afip.gob.ar/) is the governmental
fiscal authority that defines such transactions.

The document type is an essential piece of information that needs to be
clearly displayed in printed reports, invoices, and journal entries that
list account moves.

Each document type can have a unique sequence per journal where it is
assigned. As part of the localization, the document type includes the
country in which the document is applicable (this data is created
automatically when the localization module is installed).

The information required for the `Document Types`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} is included by default so the user does not need to
fill anything on this view:

![A list of document types in Odoo.](argentina/default-document-type-info.png){.align-center}

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

There are several `Document Types`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
types that are inactive by default, but can be activated as needed.
::::

##### Letters

For Argentina, the `Document Types`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
include a letter that helps indicate the type of transaction or
operation. For example, when an invoice is related to a(n):

- `B2B transaction`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, a document type
  `A`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} must be used;
- `B2C transaction`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, a document type
  `B`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} must be used;
- `Exportation Transaction`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, a
  document type `E`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} must be used.

The documents included in the localization already have the proper
letter associated with each `Document Type`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, so there is no further configuration necessary.

![document types grouped by letters.](argentina/document-types-grouped-by-letters.png){.align-center}

##### Use on invoices

The `Document Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} on each
transaction will be determined by:

- The journal entry related to the invoice (if the journal uses
  documents);
- The onditions applied based on the type of issuer and receiver (e.g.,
  the type of fiscal regime of the buyer and the type of fiscal regime
  of the vendor).

### Journals

In the Argentinean localization, the journal can have a different
approach depending on its usage and internal type. To configure
journals, go to `Accounting --> Configuration -->
Journals`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}.

For sales and purchase journals, it\'s possible to activate the option
`Use Documents`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, which enables a list
of `Document Types`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} that can be
related to the invoices and vendor bills. For more detail on invoices,
please refer to the section `2.3 document types
<document-types>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}.

If the sales or purchase journals do not have the
`Use Documents`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} option activated,
they will not be able to generate fiscal invoices, meaning, their use
case will be mostly limited to monitoring account moves related to
internal control processes.

#### AFIP information (also known as AFIP Point of Sale)

The `AFIP POS System`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is a field only
visible for the **Sales** journals and defines the type of AFIP POS that
will be used to manage the transactions for which the journal is
created.

The AFIP POS defines the following:

1.  the sequences of document types related to the web service;
2.  the structure and data of the electronic invoice file.

![A AFIP POS System field which is available on Sales journals in Odoo.](argentina/sales-journal.png){.align-center}

##### Web services

**Web services** help generate invoices for different purposes. Below
are a few options to choose from:

- `wsfev1: Electronic Invoice`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: is
  the most common service, which is used to generate invoices for
  document types A, B, C, M with no detail per item;
- `wsbfev1: Electronic Fiscal Bond`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
  is for those who invoice capital goods and wish to access the benefit
  of the Electronic Tax Bonds granted by the Ministry of Economy. For
  more details go to: [Fiscal
  Bond](https://www.argentina.gob.ar/acceder-un-bono-por-fabricar-bienes-de-capital);
- `wsfexv1: Electronic Exportation Invoice`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}: is used to generate invoices for international
  customers and transactions that involve exportation processes, the
  document type related is type \"E\".

![Web Services.](argentina/web-services.png){.align-center}

Here are some useful fields to know when working with web services:

- `AFIP POS Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: is the number
  configured in the AFIP to identify the operations related to this AFIP
  POS;
- `AFIP POS Address`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: is the field
  related to the commercial address registered for the POS, which is
  usually the same address as the company. For example, if a company has
  multiple stores (fiscal locations) then the AFIP will require the
  company to have one AFIP POS per location. This location will be
  printed in the invoice report;
- `Unified Book`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: when the AFIP POS
  System is Preimpresa, then the document types (applicable to the
  journal) with the same letter will share the same sequence. For
  example:
  - Invoice: FA-A 0001-00000002;
  - Credit Note: NC-A 0001-00000003;
  - Debit Note: ND-A 0001-00000004.

#### Sequences

For the first invoice, Odoo synchronizes with the AFIP automatically and
displays the last sequence used.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

When creating `Purchase Journals`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
it\'s possible to define whether they are related to document types or
not. In the case where the option to use documents is selected, there
would be no need to manually associate the document type sequences,
since the document number is provided by the vendor.
::::

## Usage and testing

### Invoice

The information below applies to invoice creation once the partners and
journals are created and properly configured.

#### Document type assignation

When the partner is selected, the `Document Type`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} field will be filled in automatically based on the AFIP
document type:

- **Invoice for a customer IVA Responsable Inscripto, prefix A** is the
  type of document that shows all the taxes in detail along with the
  customer\'s information.

  ![Invoice for a customer IVA Responsable Inscripto, prefix A.](argentina/prefix-a-invoice-for-customer.png)

- **Invoice for an end customer, prefix B** is the type of document that
  does not detail the taxes, since the taxes are included in the total
  amount.

  ![Invoice for an end customer, prefix B.](argentina/prefix-b-invoice-for-end-customer.png)

- **Exportation Invoice, prefix E** is the type of document used when
  exporting goods that shows the incoterm.

  ![Exportation Invoice, prefix E](argentina/prefix-e-exporation-invoice.png)

Even though some invoices use the same journal, the prefix and sequence
are given by the `Document Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
field.

The most common `Document Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} will
be defined automatically for the different combinations of AFIP
responsibility type but it can be updated manually by the user before
confirming the invoice.

#### Electronic invoice elements

When using electronic invoices, if all the information is correct then
the invoice is posted in the standard way unless there is an error that
needs to be addressed. When error messages pop up, they indicate both
the issue that needs attention along with a proposed solution. If an
error persists, the invoice remains in draft until the issue is
resolved.

Once the invoice is posted, the information related to the AFIP
validation and status is displayed in the AFIP tab, including:

- `AFIP Autorisation`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: CAE number;
- `Expiration Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: deadline to
  deliver the invoice to the customers (normally 10 days after the CAE
  is generated);
- `Result:`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} indicates if the invoice
  has been `Aceptado en AFIP`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and/or
  `Aceptado con Observaciones`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

![AFIP Status.](argentina/afip-status.png){.align-center}

#### Invoice taxes

Based on the `AFIP Responsibility type`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, the VAT tax can apply differently on the PDF report:

- `A. Tax excluded`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: in this case the
  taxed amount needs to be clearly identified in the report. This
  condition applies when the customer has the following AFIP
  Responsibility type of **Responsable Inscripto**;

  ![Tax excluded.](argentina/tax-amount-excluded.png)

- `B. Tax amount included`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: this
  means that the taxed amount is included as part of the product price,
  subtotal, and totals. This condition applies when the customer has the
  following AFIP Responsibility types:

  - IVA Sujeto Exento;
  - Consumidor Final;
  - Responsable Monotributo;
  - IVA liberado.

  ![Tax amount included.](argentina/tax-amount-included.png){.align-center}

#### Special use cases

##### Invoices for services

For electronic invoices that include `Services`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, the AFIP requires to report the service starting and
ending date, this information can be filled in the tab
`Other Info`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

![Invoices for Services.](argentina/invoices-for-services.png){.align-center}

If the dates are not selected manually before the invoice is validated,
the values will be filled automatically with the first and last day of
the invoice\'s month.

![Service Dates.](argentina/service-dates.png){.align-center}

##### Exportation invoices

Invoices related to `Exportation Transactions`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} require that a journal uses the AFIP POS System **Expo
Voucher - Web Service** so that the proper document type(s) can be
associated.

![Exporation journal.](argentina/exporation-journal.png){.align-center}

When the customer selected in the invoice is configured with an AFIP
responsibility type `Cliente / Proveedor del Exterior`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} - `Ley NÂ° 19.640`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
Odoo automatically assigns the:

- Journal related to the exportation Web Service;
- Exportation document type;
- Fiscal position: Compras/Ventas al exterior;
- Concepto AFIP: Products / Definitive export of goods;
- Exempt Taxes.

![Export invoice fields autofilled in Odoo.](argentina/export-invoice.png){.align-center}

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The Exportation Documents require Incoterms to be enabled and
configured, which can be found in
`Other Info --> Accounting`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}.
::::

![Export invoice - Incoterm.](argentina/export-invoice-incoterm.png){.align-center}

##### Fiscal bond

The `Electronic Fiscal Bond`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is used
for those who invoice capital goods and wish to access the benefit of
the Electronic Tax Bonds granted by the Ministry of Economy.

For these transactions, it is important to consider the following
requirements:

- Currency (according to the parameter table) and invoice quotation;
- Taxes;
- Zone;
- Detail each item;
  - Code according to the Common Nomenclator of Mercosur (NCM);
  - Complete description;
  - Unit Net Price;
  - Quantity;
  - Unit of measurement;
  - Bonus;
  - VAT rate.

##### Electronic credit invoice MiPyme (FCE)

For SME invoices, there are several document types that are classified
as **MiPyME**, which are also known as **Electronic Credit Invoice** (or
**FCE** in Spanish). This classification develops a mechanism that
improves the financing conditions for small and medium-sized businesses,
and allows them to increase their productivity, through the early
collection of credits and receivables issued to their clients and/or
vendors.

For these transactions it\'s important to consider the following
requirements:

- specific document types (201, 202, 206, etc);
- the emitter should be eligible by the AFIP to MiPyME transactions;
- the amount should be bigger than 100,000 ARS;
- A bank account type CBU must be related to the emisor, otherwise the
  invoice cannot be validated, having an error message such as the
  following.

![Bank account relation error.](argentina/bank-account-relation-error.png){.align-center}

To set up the `Transmission Mode`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, go
to settings and select either `SDC`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
or `ADC`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

![Transmission Mode.](argentina/transmission-mode.png){.align-center}

To change the `Transmission Mode`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} for
a specific invoice, go to the `Other Info`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} tab and change it before confirming.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Changing the `Transmission Mode`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} will
not change the mode selected in `Settings`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}.
::::

![Transmission Mode on Invoice.](argentina/transmission-mode-on-invoice.png){.align-center}

When creating a `Credit/Debit`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} note
related to a FCE document:

- use the `Credit and Debit Note`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  buttons, so all the information from the invoice is transferred to the
  new `Credit and Debit Note`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"};
- the document letter should be the same as than the originator document
  (either A or B);
- the same currency as the source document must be used. When using a
  secondary currency there is an exchange difference if the currency
  rate is different between the emission day and the payment date. It is
  possible to create a credit/debit note to decrease/increase the amount
  to pay in ARS.

![Credit & debit notes buttons.](argentina/credit-debit-notes-button.png){.align-center}

When creating a `Credit Note`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} we can
have two scenarios:

1.  the FCE is rejected so the `Credit Note`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} should have the field `FCE, is
    Cancellation?`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} as *True*; or;
2.  the `Credit Note`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, is created to
    annulate the FCE document, in this case the field
    `FCE, is Cancellation?`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} must be
    *empty* (false).

![FCE: Es CancelaciÃ³n?](argentina/fce-es-cancelation.png){.align-center}

#### Invoice printed report

The `PDF Report`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} related to
electronic invoices that have been validated by the AFIP includes a
barcode at the bottom of the format which represents the CAE number. The
expiration date is also displayed as it is a legal requirement.

![Invoice printed report.](argentina/invoice-printed-report.png){.align-center}

#### Troubleshooting and auditing

For auditing and troubleshooting purposes, it is possible to obtain
detailed information of an invoice number that has been previously sent
to the AFIP. To retrieve this information, activate the
`developer mode <developer-mode>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}, then go
to the `Accounting`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"} menu and
click on the button `Consult Invoice`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
button in AFIP.

![Consult invoice in AFIP.](argentina/consult-invoice-in-afip.png){.align-center}

![Details of invoice consulted in AFIP.](argentina/consult-invoice-in-afip-details.png){.align-center}

It is also possible to retrieve the last number used in AFIP for a
specific document type and POS Number as a reference for any possible
issues on the sequence synchronization between Odoo and AFIP.

![Consult the last invoice number.](argentina/consult-last-invoice-number.png){.align-center}

### Vendor bills

Based on the purchase journal selected for the vendor bill, the
`Document Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is now a required
field. This value is auto-populated based on the AFIP Responsibility
type of Issuer and Customer, but the value can be changed if necessary.

![Changing journal and document type.](argentina/changing-journal-document-type.png){.align-center}

The `Document Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field needs to
be registered manually and the format will be validated automatically.
However, in case the format is invalid, a user error will be displayed
indicating the correct format that is expected.

![Vendor bill document number.](argentina/vendor-bill-document-number.png){.align-center}

The vendor bill number is structured in the same way as the customer
invoices, excepted that the document sequence is entered by the user
using the following format: *Document Prefix - Letter -Document Number*.

#### Validate vendor bill number in AFIP

As most companies have internal controls to verify that the vendor bill
is related to an AFIP valid document, an automatic validation can be set
in `Accounting --> Settings -->
Argentinean Localization --> Validate document in the AFIP`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, considering the following levels:

- `Not available:`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} the verification
  is not done (this is the default value);
- `Available:`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} the verification is
  done. In case the number is not valid, it only displays a warning but
  still allows the vendor bill to be posted;
- `Required:`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} the verification is
  done, and it does not allow the user to post the vendor bill if the
  document number is not valid.

![Verify Vendor Bills validity in AFIP.](argentina/verify-vendor-bills.png){.align-center}

##### Validate vendor bills in Odoo

With the vendor validation settings enabled, a new button shows up on
the vendor bills inside of Odoo, labeled
`Verify on AFIP`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, which is located
next to the `AFIP
Authorization code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field.

![Verify on AFIP.](argentina/verify-on-afip.png){.align-center}

In case the vendor bill cannot be validated in AFIP, a value of
`Rejected`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} will be displayed on the
dashboard and the details of the invalidation will be added to the
chatter.

![AFIP authorization Rejected.](argentina/afip-auth-rejected.png){.align-center}

#### Special use cases

##### Untaxed concepts

There are some transactions that include items that are not a part of
the VAT base amount, such as fuel and gasoline invoices.

The vendor bill will be registered using one item for each product that
is part of the VAT base amount, and an additional item to register the
amount of the exempt concept.

![VAT exempt.](argentina/vat-exempt.png){.align-center}

##### Perception taxes

The vendor bill will be registered using one item for each product that
is part of the VAT base amount, and the perception tax can be added in
any of the product lines. As a result, there will be one tax group for
the VAT and another for the perception. The perception default value is
always `0.10`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

To edit the VAT perception and set the correct amount, you should use
the `Pencil`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} icon that is the next to
the `Perception`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} amount. After the
VAT perception amount has been set, the invoice can then be validated.

![Enter the perception amount.](argentina/enter-perception-amount.png){.align-center}

### Check management

To install the *Third Party and Deferred/Electronic Checks Management*
module, go to `Apps`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"} and search
for the module by its technical name [l10n_latam_check]{.title-ref} and
click the `Activate`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button.

![l10n_latam_check module.](argentina/l10n-latam-check-module.png){.align-center}

This module enables the required configuration for journals and payments
to:

- Create, manage, and control your different types of checks
- Optimize the management of *own checks* and *third party checks*
- Have an easy and effective way to manage expiration dates from your
  own and third party checks

Once all the configurations are made for the Argentinian electronic
invoice flow, it is also needed to complete certain configurations for
the own checks and the third party checks flows.

#### Own checks

Configure the bank journal used to create your own checks by going to
`Accounting -->
Configuration --> Journals`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"},
selecting the bank journal, and opening the `Outgoing
Payments`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab.

- `Checks`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} should be available as a
  `Payment Method`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. If not, click
  `Add a line`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and type
  [Checks]{.title-ref} under `Payment Method`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} to add them
- Enable the `Use electronic and deferred checks`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} setting.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

This last configuration **disables** the printing ability but enables
to:

- Enter check numbers manually
- Adds a field to allocate the payment date of the check
::::

![Bank journal configurations.](argentina/bank-journal-conf.png){.align-center}

##### Management of own checks

Own checks can be created directly from the vendor bill. For this
process, click on the `Register Payment`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} button.

On the payment registration modal, select the bank journal from which
the payment is to be made and set the
`Check Cash-In Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and the
`Amount`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

![Payment pop-up window with own check options enabled.](argentina/payment-popup-vendorbill.png){.align-center}

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

To manage current checks, the `Check Cash-In Date`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} field must be left blank or filled in with the current
date. To manage deferred checks, the
`Check Cash-In Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} must be set in
the future.
::::

To manage your existing own checks, navigate to
`Accounting --> Vendors --> Own
Checks`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}. This window shows
critical information such as the dates when checks need to be paid, the
total quantity of checks, and the total amount paid in checks.

![Own checks menu location.](argentina/checks-menu-vendorbill.png){.align-center}

It is important to note that the list is pre-filtered by checks that are
still *not reconciled* with a bank statement - that were not yet debited
from the bank - which can be verified with the
`Is Matched with a Bank Statement`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
field. If you want to see all of your own checks, delete the
`No Bank Matching`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} filter by clicking
on the `X`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} symbol.

![Own checks menu organization and filtering.](argentina/check-menu-list-vendorbill.png){.align-center}

##### Cancel an own check

To cancel an own check created in Odoo, navigate to
`Accounting --> Vendors --> Own
Checks`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"} and select the check to
be canceled, then click on the `Void Check`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} button. This will break the reconciliation with the
vendor bills and the bank statements and leave the check in a
**canceled** state.

![Empty Check button to cancel Own Checks](argentina/empty-check-button.png){.align-center}

#### Third party checks

In order to register payments using third party checks, two specific
journals need to be configured. To do so, navigate to
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Journals`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} and create two new journals:

- [Third Party Checks]{.title-ref}
- [Rejected Third Party Checks]{.title-ref}

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

You can manually create more journals if you have multiple points of
sale and need journals for those.
::::

To create the *Third Party Checks* journal, click the
`New`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button and configure the
following:

- Type [Third Party Checks]{.title-ref} as the
  `Journal Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- Select `Cash`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} as
  `Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- In the `Journal Entries`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab, set
  `Cash Account`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: to [1.1.1.02.010
  Cheques de Terceros]{.title-ref}, input a
  `Short Code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} of your choice, and
  select a `Currency`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}

![Automatically created cash account.](argentina/auto-cash-account.png){.align-center}

The available payment methods are listed in the *payments* tabs:

- For new incoming third party checks, go to
  `Incoming Payments tab --> Add a line`{.interpreted-text
  role="menuselection"} and select
  `New Third Party Checks`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. This
  method is used to create *new* third party checks.
- For incoming and outgoing existing third party checks, go to
  `Incoming Payments tab
  --> Add a line`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"} and select
  `Existing Third Party Checks`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
  Repeat the same step for the `Outgoing Payments`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} tab. This method is used to receive and/or pay vendor
  bills using already *existing* checks, as well as for internal
  transfers.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

You can delete pre-existing payment methods appearing by default when
configuring the third party checks journals.
::::

![Payment methods automatically created.](argentina/auto-payment-methods.png){.align-center}

The *Rejected Third Party Checks* journal also needs to be created
and/or configured. This journal is used to manage rejected third party
checks and can be utilized to send checks rejected at the moment of
collection or when coming from vendors when rejected.

To create the *Rejected Third Party Checks* journal, click the
`New`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button and configure the
following:

- Type [Rejected Third Party Checks]{.title-ref} as the
  `Journal Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- Select `Cash`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} as
  `Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- In the `Journal Entries`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab, set
  `Cash Account`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: to [1.1.1.01.002
  Rejected Third Party Checks]{.title-ref}, input a
  `Short Code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} of your choice, and
  select a `Currency`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}

Use the same payment methods as the *Third Party Checks* journal.

##### New third party checks

To register a *new* third party check for a customer invoice, click the
`Register Payment`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button. In the
pop-up window, you must select `Third Party Checks`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} as journal for the payment registration.

Select `New Third Party Checks`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} as
`Payment Method`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and fill in the
`Check Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`Payment Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
`Check Bank`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Optionally, you can
manually add the `Check Issuer Vat`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
but this is automatically filled by the customer\'s VAT number related
to the invoice.

![Payment pop-up window with New Third Party Check options enabled.](argentina/third-party-payment-popup.png){.align-center}

##### Existing third party checks

To pay a vendor bill with an *existing* check, click the
`Register Payment`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button. In the
pop-up window, you must select `Third Party Checks`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} as journal for the payment registration.

Select `Existing Third Party Checks`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
as `Payment Method`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and select a
check from the `Check`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field. The
field shows all **available existing checks** to be used as payment for
vendor bills.

![Payment pop-up window with Existing Third Party Check options enabled.](argentina/existing-third-party-popup.png){.align-center}

When an **existing third party check** is used, you can review the
operations related to it. For example, you can see if a third party
check made to pay a customer invoice was later used as an existing third
party check to pay a vendor bill.

To do so, either go to
`Accounting --> Customers --> Third Party Checks`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} or
`Accounting --> Vendors --> Own Checks`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} depending on the case, and click on a check. In
the `Check Current Journal`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field,
click on `=> Check Operations`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to
bring up the check\'s history and movements.

![Check Operations menu.](argentina/check-operations-menulist.png){.align-center}

The menu also displays critical information related to these operations,
such as:

- The `Payment Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, allowing to
  classify whether it is a payment *sent* to a vendor or a payment
  *received* from a customer
- The `Journal`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in which the check is
  currently registered
- The **partner** associated with the operation (either customer or
  vendor).

## Reports

As part of the localization installation, financial reporting for
Argentina was added to the `Accounting`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} dashboard. Access these reports by navigating to
`Accounting
--> Reporting --> Argentinean Reports`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}

![Argentinean reports.](argentina/argentinian-reports.png){.align-center}

### VAT reports

#### Sales VAT book

In this report, all the sales are recorded, which are taken as the basis
for the accounting records to determine the VAT (Tax Debit).

The `Sales VAT`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} book report can be
exported in a [.zip]{.title-ref} file `VAT BOOK (ZIP)`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} button in the top left, which contains
[.txt]{.title-ref} files to upload in the AFIP portal.

![Sales VAT book.](argentina/sales-vat-book.png){.align-center}

#### Purchases VAT book

The `Purchases VAT`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} book report can
be exported in a [.zip]{.title-ref} file `VAT BOOK
(ZIP)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button in the top left, which
contains [.txt]{.title-ref} files to upload in the AFIP portal.

![Purchases VAT book.](argentina/purchases-vat-book.png){.align-center}

#### VAT summary

Pivot table designed to check the monthly VAT totals. This report is for
internal usage, it is not sent to the AFIP.

![VAT Summary.](argentina/vat-summary.png){.align-center}

### IIBB - Reports

#### IIBB - Sales by jurisdiction

Pivot table where you can validate the gross income in each
jurisdiction. Affidavit for the corresponding taxes to pay, therefore it
is not sent to the AFIP.

![IIBB Sales by jurisdiction.](argentina/iibb-sales-jurisdiction.png){.align-center}

#### IIBB - Purchases by jurisdiction

Pivot table where you can validate the gross purchases in each
jurisdiction. Affidavit for the corresponding taxes to pay, therefore it
is not sent to the AFIP.

![IIBB Purchases by jurisdiction.](argentina/iibb-purchases-jurisdiction.png){.align-center}




--- SOURCE: finance/fiscal_localizations/australia.md ---

# Australia

## Employment Hero Australian Payroll {#australia/employment-hero}

The Employment Hero module synchronizes payslip accounting entries
(e.g., expenses, social charges, liabilities, taxes) from Employment
Hero to Odoo automatically. Payroll administration is still done in
Employment Hero. We only record the journal entries in Odoo.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

KeyPay was rebranded as **Employment Hero** in March 2023.
::::

### Configuration

1.  `Activate <general/install>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} the
    `Employment Hero Australian Payroll`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} module (technical name:
    [l10n_au_keypay]{.title-ref}).

2.  Configure the **Employment Hero API** by going to
    `Accounting --> Configuration -->
    Settings`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}. More fields
    become visible after clicking on `Enable Employment Hero
    Integration`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

    ![Enabling Employment Hero Integration in Odoo Accounting displays new fields in the
    settings](australia/employment-hero-integration.png)

    - You can find the API Key in the `My Account`{.interpreted-text
      role="guilabel"} section of the Employment Hero platform.

      ![\"Account Details\" section on the Employment Hero dashboard](australia/employment-hero-myaccount.png)

    - The **Payroll URL** is pre-filled with
      [https://keypay.yourpayroll.com.au]{.title-ref}. *Please do not
      change it.*

    - You can find the **Business ID** in the Employment Hero URL.
      (i.e., [189241]{.title-ref})

      ![The Employment Hero \"Business ID\" number is in the URL](australia/employment-hero-business-id.png)

    - You can choose any Odoo journal to post the payslip entries.

### How does the API work?

The API syncs the journal entries from Employment Hero to Odoo and
leaves them in draft mode. The reference includes the Employment Hero
payslip entry ID in brackets for the user to easily retrieve the same
record in Employment Hero and Odoo.

![Example of a Employment Hero Journal Entry in Odoo Accounting (Australia)](australia/employment-hero-journal-entry.png)

By default, the synchronization happens once per week. You can fetch the
records manually by going to
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Settings`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} and, in the `Enable
Employment Hero Integration`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} option,
click on `Fetch Payruns Manually`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

Employment Hero payslip entries also work based on double-entry
bookkeeping.

The accounts used by Employment Hero are defined in the section
`Payroll settings`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

![Chart of Accounts menu in Employment Hero](australia/employment-hero-chart-of-accounts.png)

For the API to work, you need to create the same accounts as the default
accounts of your Employment Hero business (**same name and same code**)
in Odoo. You also need to choose the correct account types in Odoo to
generate accurate financial reports.




--- SOURCE: finance/fiscal_localizations/belgium.md ---

# Belgium

## Configuration {#belgium/configuration}

`Install <general/install>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} the following
modules to get all the features of the Belgian localization, following
the
`IFRS(International Financial Reporting Standards)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} rules.

  Name                                                                              Technical name                              Description
  --------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ------------------------------------------- ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  `Belgium - Accounting`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}                         [l10n_be]{.title-ref}                       Default `fiscal localization package <fiscal_localizations/packages>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}.
  `Belgium - Accounting Reports`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}                 [l10n_be_reports]{.title-ref}               Access to specific accounting reports for Belgium.
  `Belgium - Accounting Reports (post wizard)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}   [l10n_be_reports_post_wizard]{.title-ref}   Enables the VAT wizard when posting a tax return journal entry.
  `Belgium - Import Bank CODA Statements`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}        [l10n_be_coda]{.title-ref}                  Import CODA bank statements.
  `Belgium - Import SODA files`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}                  [l10n_be_soda]{.title-ref}                  Import SODA files.
  `Belgium - Disallowed Expenses Data`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}           [l10n_be_disallowed_expenses]{.title-ref}   Access to the use of disallowed expenses features.
  `Belgium - Payroll`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}                            [l10n_be_hr_payroll]{.title-ref}            Access to the basic payroll features for Belgium.
  `Belgium - Payroll with Accounting`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}            [l10n_be_hr_payroll_account]{.title-ref}    Integration of accounting data with payroll.
  `Belgium - Payroll - Dimona`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}                   [l10n_be_hr_payroll_dimona]{.title-ref}     Access to Dimona features for payroll.
  `Belgium - Payroll - Fleet`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}                    [l10n_be_hr_payroll_fleet]{.title-ref}      Fleet features for payroll.
  `Salary Configurator (Belgium)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}                [l10n_be_hr_contract_salary]{.title-ref}    Access to the salary configurator feature.

## Chart of accounts {#belgium/coa}

You can reach the `Chart of accounts`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
by going to `Accounting -->
Configuration --> Accounting: Chart of Accounts`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}.

The Belgian chart of accounts includes pre-configured accounts as
described in the `PCMN(Plan
Comptable Minimum NormalisÃ©)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}. To add a
new account, click `New`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. A new line
appears. Fill it in, click `Save`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
and then `Setup`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to configure it
further.

::: seealso
`../accounting/get_started/chart_of_accounts`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}
:::

## Taxes {#belgium/taxes}

Default Belgian taxes are created automatically when the
`Belgium - Accounting`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and the
`Belgium - Accounting Reports`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
modules are installed. Each tax impacts the Belgian
`Tax Report`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, available by going to
`Accounting --> Reporting -->
Statements Reports: Tax Report`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}.

In Belgium, the standard VAT rate is **21%**, but there are lower rates
for some categories of goods and services. An intermediate rate of
**12%** is applied on social housing and food served in restaurants,
while a reduced rate of **6%** applies to most basic goods, such as
food, water supply, books, and medicine. A **0%** rate applies to some
exceptional goods and services, such as some daily and weekly
publications, as well as recycled goods.

### Non-deductible taxes {#belgium/non-deductible}

In Belgium, some taxes are not fully deductible, such as taxes on the
maintenance of cars. This means a part of these taxes is considered as
an expense.

In Odoo, you can configure non-deductible taxes by creating tax rules
for these taxes and linking them to the corresponding accounts. This
way, the system automatically calculates the taxes and allocates them to
the appropriate accounts.

To configure a new non-deductible tax, go to
`Accounting --> Configuration -->
Accounting: Taxes`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}, and click
`New`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:

1.  `Add a line`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and select
    `Base`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in the
    `Based On`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} column;
2.  `Add a line`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, then select
    `on tax`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in the
    `Based on`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} column and enter the
    **non-deductible** percentage in the `%`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} column;
3.  On the `of tax`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} line, select the
    `Tax Grid(s)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} related to your
    tax;
4.  `Add a line`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} with the
    **deductible** percentage in the `%`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} column;
5.  Set `of tax`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in
    `Based On`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"};
6.  Select `411000 VAT recoverable`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
    as account, and select the related tax grid.

Once you have created a non-deductible tax, you can apply it to your
transactions by selecting the appropriate tax during the encoding of
bills and credit notes. The system automatically calculates the tax
amount and allocates it to the corresponding accounts based on the tax
rules configured.

::: example
With the Belgian localization, the **21% car** tax is created by default
(50% non-deductible).

![Example of not-fully deductible tax](belgium/deductible-tax.png)
:::

::: seealso
\- `Taxes <../accounting/taxes>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} -
`../accounting/reporting/tax_returns`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
:::

## Reports {#belgium/reports}

Here is the list of Belgian-specific reports available:

- Balance sheet;
- Profit & loss;
- Tax report;
- Partner VAT Listing;
- EC Sales List;
- Intrastat.

You can access Belgian-specific versions of reports by clicking on the
**book** icon when on a report and selecting its Belgian version:
**(BE)**.

![Belgian version of reports](belgium/belgian-reports.png)

::: seealso
`../accounting/reporting`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
:::

### Disallowed expenses report {#belgium/disallowed-expenses}

**Disallowed expenses** are expenses that can be deducted from your
accounting result but not from your fiscal result.

The **disallowed expenses report** is available by going to
`Accounting --> Reporting
--> Management: Disallowed Expenses`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. It allows financial results in real-time, and
periodic changes. This report is generated based on the **disallowed
expenses categories** that you can reach by going to
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Management: Disallowed Expenses
Categories`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}. Some categories
already exist by default but do not have any rates. Click on
`Set Rates`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to update a specific
category.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

\- You can add multiple rates for various dates. In that case, the rate
used to calculate the expense depends on the date at which it is
calculated, and the rate set for that date. - If you have the **Fleet**
app installed, tick the `Car Category`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} box when applicable. This makes the vehicle mandatory
while booking a vendor bill.
::::

To link a disallowed expenses category with a specific account, go to
`Accounting -->
Configuration --> Acounting: Chart of Accounts`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. Find the account you want, and click on
`Setup`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Add the
`Disallowed Expense category`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in the
`Disallowed
Expenses`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field. From now, when an
expense is created with this account, the disallowed expense is
calculated based on the rate mentioned in the
`Disallowed Expense category`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

Let\'s take an example reflecting **restaurant** and **car expenses**.

#### Restaurant expenses {#belgium/restaurant-expenses}

In Belgium, 31% of **restaurant** expenses are non-deductible. Create a
new **disallowed expenses category** and set both
`Related Account(s)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`Current Rate`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

![Disallowed expenses categories](belgium/restaurant-expenses.png)

#### Car expenses: vehicle split {#belgium/vehicle-split}

In Belgium, the deductible percentage varies from car to car and,
therefore, should be indicated for each vehicle. To do so, open
`Fleet`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"} and select a vehicle. In
the `Tax
info`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab, go to the
`Disallowed Expenses Rate`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section
and click on `Add a
line`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Add a
`Start Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and a
`%`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. The amounts go in the same
account for all car expenses.

When you create a bill for car expenses, you can link each expense to a
specific car by filling the `Vehicle`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
column, so the right percentage is applied.

![Disallowed expenses categories](belgium/car-bill.png)

The `vehicle split`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} option available
in the disallowed expenses report allows you to see the rate and
disallowed amount for each car.

![Disallowed expenses categories](belgium/vehicle-split.png)

## Fee form 281.50 and form 325 {#belgium/forms}

### Fee form 281.50 {#belgium/281.50}

Annually, a **281.50 fee form** must be reported to the fiscal
authorities. To do so, the tag [281.50]{.title-ref} must be added on the
**contact form** of the entities concerned by the **281.50** fee. To add
the tag, open `Contacts`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}, select
the person or company you want to create a **281.50 fee form** for, and
add the [281.50]{.title-ref} tag in the `Tags`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} field.

![add the tag 281.50 on a contact form](belgium/281-50.png)

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Make sure the **street, zip code, country**, and **VAT number** are also
informed on the **Contact form**.
::::

Then, depending on the nature of the expense, add the corresponding
[281.50]{.title-ref} tag on the impact accounts. To do so, go to
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Accounting: Chart of
Accounts`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}, and click on
`Setup`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to add the corresponding
[281.50]{.title-ref} tag on the impacted accounts, i.e.,
`281.50 - Commissions`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, depending on
the nature of the expense.

### Form 325 {#belgium/325}

You can create a **325 form** by going to
`Accounting --> Reporting --> Belgium:
Create 325 form`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}. A new page
pops up: select the right options and click `Generate 325
form`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. To open an already generated
**325 form**, go to `Accounting --> Reporting -->
Belgium: Open 325 forms`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}.

![Add the tag 281-50 on a contact form](belgium/325-form.png)

## CODA and SODA statements {#belgium/coda-soda}

### CODA {#belgium/coda}

**CODA** is an electronic XML format used to import Belgian bank
statements. You can download CODA files from your bank and import them
directly into Odoo by clicking `Import Statement`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} from your `Bank`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
journal on your dashboard.

![Import CODA files](belgium/coda-import.png)

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The `Belgium - Import Bank CODA Statements`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} module is installed by default when the
`Belgium - Accounting`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and the
`Belgium - Accounting Reports`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
modules are installed.
::::

::: seealso
`Import bank statements files <transactions/import>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}
:::

### SODA {#belgium/soda}

**SODA** is an electronic XML format used to import accounting entries
related to salaries. SODA files can be imported into the journal you use
to record salaries by going to your Accounting **dashboard** and
clicking `Upload`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in the related
journal card form.

Once your **SODA** files are imported, the entries are created
automatically in your \'salary\' journal.

![Import SODA files](belgium/soda-import.png)

## Electronic invoicing {#belgium/einvoicing}

Odoo supports the **E-FFF** and **Peppol BIS Billing 3.0 (UBL)**
electronic invoicing formats. To enable them, go to
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Journals --> Customer Invoices
--> Advanced Settings --> Electronic Invoicing`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, and tick `E-FFF (BE)`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} and `Peppol BIS Billing 3.0`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}.

::: seealso
`../accounting/customer_invoices/electronic_invoicing`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}
:::

## Cash discount {#belgium/cash-discount}

In Belgium, if an early payment discount is offered on an invoice, the
tax is calculated based on the discounted total amount, whether the
customer benefits from the discount or not.

To apply the right tax amount and report it correctly in your VAT
return, set the tax reduction as
`Always (upon invoice)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

::: seealso
`../accounting/customer_invoices/cash_discounts`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}
:::

## Fiscal certification: POS restaurant {#belgium/pos-restaurant-certification}

In Belgium, the owner of a cooking business such as a restaurant or food
truck is required by law to use a government-certified **Cash Register
System** for their receipts. This applies if their yearly earnings
(excluding VAT, drinks, and take-away food) exceed 25,000 euros.

This government-certified system entails the use of a
`certified POS system
<belgium/certified-pos>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}, along with a
device called a `Fiscal Data Module <belgium/fdm>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} (or **black box**) and a
`VAT Signing Card <belgium/vat>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

Do not forget to register as *foodservice industry manager* on the
[Federal Public Service Finance registration
form](https://www.systemedecaisseenregistreuse.be/fr/enregistrement).
::::

### Certified POS system {#belgium/certified-pos}

The Odoo POS system is certified for the major versions of databases
hosted on **Odoo Online**, **Odoo.sh**, and **On-Premise**. Please refer
to the following table to ensure that your POS system is certified.

              Odoo Online   Odoo.sh     On-Premise
  ----------- ------------- ----------- ------------
  Odoo 18.0   Certified     Certified   Certified
  Odoo 17.0   Certified     Certified   Certified
  Odoo 16.0   Certified     Certified   Certified
  Odoo 15.0   Certified     Certified   Certified
  Odoo 14.0   Certified     Certified   Certified

::: seealso
`/administration/supported_versions`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
:::

A [certified POS
system](https://www.systemedecaisseenregistreuse.be/systemes-certifies)
must adhere to rigorous government regulations, which means it operates
differently from a non-certified POS.

- On a certified POS, you cannot:
  - Set up and use the **global discounts** feature (the
    [pos_discount]{.title-ref} module is blacklisted and cannot be
    activated).
  - Set up and use the **loyalty programs** feature (the
    [pos_loyalty]{.title-ref} module is blacklisted and cannot be
    activated).
  - Reprint receipts (the [pos_reprint]{.title-ref} module is
    blacklisted and cannot be activated).
  - Modify prices in order lines.
  - Modify or delete order lines in POS orders.
  - Sell products without a valid VAT number.
  - Use a POS that is not connected to an IoT box.
- The
  `cash rounding <../../sales/point_of_sale/pricing/cash_rounding>`{.interpreted-text
  role="doc"} feature must be activated and set to a
  `Rounding Precision`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} of
  [0,05]{.title-ref} and a `Rounding Method`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} set as `Half-Up`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
- Taxes must be set as included in the price. To set it up, go to
  `Point of Sale -->
  Configuration --> Settings`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"},
  and from the `Accounting`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section,
  open the `Default Sales Tax`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} form
  by clicking the arrow next to the default sales tax field. There,
  click `Advanced Options`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and enable
  `Included in Price`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
- At the start of a POS session, users must click
  `Work in`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to clock in. Doing so
  allows the registration of POS orders. If users are not clocked in,
  they cannot make POS orders. Likewise, they must click
  `Work Out`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to clock out at the end
  of the session.

:::: warning
::: title
Warning
:::

If you configure a POS to work with a
`FDM (Fiscal Data Module)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}, you cannot
use it again without it.
::::

### Fiscal Data Module (FDM) {#belgium/fdm}

An FDM, or **black box**, is a government-certified device that works
together with the Point of Sale application and saves your POS orders
information. Concretely, a **hash** (`unique code`{.interpreted-text
role="dfn"}) is generated for each POS order and added to its receipt.
This allows the government to verify that all revenue is declared.

:::: warning
::: title
Warning
:::

Only the FDM from **BoÃ®tenoire.be** with the [FDM certificate number
BMC04](https://www.systemedecaisseenregistreuse.be/fr/systemes-certifies#FDM%20certifiÃ©s)
is supported by Odoo. [Contact the manufacturer (GCV
BMC)](https://www.boÃ®tenoire.be/contact) to order one.
::::

#### Configuration

Before setting up your database to work with an FDM, ensure you have the
following hardware:

- a **BoÃ®tenoire.be** (certificate number BMC04) FDM;
- an RS-232 serial null modem cable per FDM;
- an RS-232 serial-to-USB adapter per FDM;
- an `IoT Box <belgium/iotbox>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} (one IoT
  box per FDM); and
- a receipt printer.

##### Black box module {#belgium/blackbox}

As a pre-requisite, `activate <general/install>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} the [Belgian Registered Cash Register]{.title-ref} module
(technical name: [pos_blackbox_be]{.title-ref}).

![black box modules for belgian fiscal certification](belgium/be-modules.png)

Once the module is activated, add your VAT number to your company
information. To set it up, go to
`Settings --> Companies --> Update Info`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, and fill in the `VAT`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} field. Then, enter a national registration number for
every staff member who operates the POS system. To do so, go to the
`Employees`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} app and open an employee
form. There, go to `HR
settings tab --> Attendance/Point of Sale`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, and fill in the
`INSZ or BIS number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field.

![ISNZ or BIS number field on employee form](belgium/bis-number.png)

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

To input your information, click on your avatar, go to
`My Profile --> Preference
tab`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}, and enter your INSZ or BIS
number in the designated field.
::::

:::: warning
::: title
Warning
:::

You must configure the `FDM (Fiscal Data Module)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} directly in the production database. Utilizing it in a
testing environment may result in incorrect data being stored within the
FDM.
::::

##### IoT Box {#belgium/iotbox}

In order to use an `FDM (Fiscal Data Module)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}, you need a registered IoT Box. To register your IoT box,
you must contact us through our [support contact
form](https://www.odoo.com/help) and provide the following information:

- your VAT number;
- your company\'s name, address, and legal structure; and
- the Mac address of your IoT Box.

Once your IoT box is certified,
`connect <../../general/iot/config/connect>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} it to your database. To verify that the IoT Box recognizes
the FDM, go to the IoT homepage and scroll down the
`IOT Device`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section, which should
display the FDM.

![Hardware status page on a registered IoT Box](belgium/iot-devices.png)

Then, add the IoT to your POS. To do so, go to
`Point of Sale --> Configuration -->
Point of Sale`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}, select your POS,
scroll down to the `Connected Device`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
section, and enable `IoT Box`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
Lastly, add the FMD in the `Fiscal Data Module`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} field.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

To be able to use an FDM, you must at least connect one
`Receipt Printer`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
::::

### VAT signing card {#belgium/vat}

When you open a POS session and make your initial transaction, you are
prompted to enter the PIN provided with your
`VSC (VAT signing card)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}. The card is
delivered by the `FPS (Service
Public Federal Finances)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} upon
[registration](https://www.systemedecaisseenregistreuse.be/fr/enregistrement).




--- SOURCE: finance/fiscal_localizations/brazil.md ---

# Brazil

## Introduction

With the Brazilian localization you can automatically compute sales
taxes for goods using AvaTax (Avalara) through API calls, also configure
taxes for services.

For the goods tax computation part, you need to configure the
`contacts <brazil/contacts>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"},
`company <brazil/company>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"},
`products <brazil/products>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}, and
`create an account in
Avatax <brazil/avatax-account>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} from the
Odoo general settings.

For the services taxes, you can create and configure them from Odoo
directly without computing them with AvaTax.

The localization also includes taxes and a chart of accounts template
that can be modified if needed.

## Configuration

### Modules installation

`Install <general/install>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} the following
modules to get all the features of the Brazilian localization:

  -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  Name                                              Technical name                      Description
  ------------------------------------------------- ----------------------------------- ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  `Brazilian - Accounting`{.interpreted-text        [l10n_br]{.title-ref}               Default
  role="guilabel"}                                                                      `fiscal localization package <fiscal_localizations/packages>`{.interpreted-text
                                                                                        role="ref"} - adds accounting characteristics for the Brazilian localization,
                                                                                        which represent the minimum configuration required for a company to operate in
                                                                                        Brazil. The module\'s installation automatically loads: the chart of accounts,
                                                                                        taxes, and required fields to properly configure the contact.

  `Brazil - Accounting Reports`{.interpreted-text   [l10n_br_reports]{.title-ref}       Adds a simple tax report that helps check the tax amount per tax group in a given
  role="guilabel"}                                                                      period of time. Also adds the P&L and BS adapted for the Brazilian market.

  `Avatax Brazil`{.interpreted-text                 [l10n_br_avatax]{.title-ref}        Add Brazilian tax calculation via Avatax and all necessary fields needed to
  role="guilabel"}                                                                      configure Odoo in order to properly use Avatax and send the needed fiscal
                                                                                        information to retrieve the correct taxes.

  `Avatax for SOs in Brazil`{.interpreted-text      [l10n_br_avatax_sale]{.title-ref}   Same as the [l10n_br_avatax]{.title-ref} module with the extension to the sales
  role="guilabel"}                                                                      order module.
  -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

### Configure your company {#brazil/company}

To configure your company information, go to the
`Contacts`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"} app and search the
name given to your company.

1.  Select the `Company`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} option at
    the top of the page. Then, configure the following fields:

    - `Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
    - `Address`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} (add
      `City`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
      `State`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
      `Zip Code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
      `Country`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"})
    - Tax ID (`CNPJ`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"})
    - `IE`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} (State Registration)
    - `IM`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} (Municipal Registration)
    - `SUFRAMA code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} (Superintendence
      of the Manaus Free Trade Zone - add if applicable)
    - `Phone`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
    - `Email`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}

    ![Company configuration.](brazil/company-configuration.png)

2.  Configure the `Fiscal Information`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} within the `Sales and Purchase`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} tab:

    - Add the `Fiscal Position`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} for
      `Avatax Brazil <brazil/fiscal-positions>`{.interpreted-text
      role="ref"}.
    - `Tax Regime`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} (Federal Tax
      Regime)
    - `ICMS Taxpayer Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} (indicates
      ICMS regime, Exempt status, or Non-Taxpayer.)
    - `Main Activity Sector`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}

    ![Company fiscal configuration.](brazil/contact-fiscal-configuration.png)

3.  Finally, upload a company logo and save the contact.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

If you are a simplified regime, you need to configure the ICMS rate
under
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Settings --> Taxes --> Avatax Brazil`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}.
::::

### Configure AvaTax integration {#brazil/avatax-account}

Avalara AvaTax is a tax calculation provider that can be integrated in
Odoo to automatically compute taxes by taking into account the company,
contact (customer), product, and transaction information to retrieve the
correct tax to be used.

Odoo is a certified partner of Avalara Brazil, which means that Avalara
experts reviewed workflows covered within the scope of the integration.

Using this integration requires `In-App-Purchases (IAPs)
</applications/essentials/in_app_purchase>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} to compute taxes. Every time you compute taxes, an API call
is made, using credits from your
`IAP (In-app-purchase)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} credits balance.

#### Credential configuration

To activate AvaTax in Odoo, you need to create an account. To do so, go
to
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Settings --> Taxes`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, and, in the `AvaTax
Brazil`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section, add the email
address you want to use to log in to the AvaTax portal, and click on
`Create account`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. This email is used
as the administrator email address in AvaTax.

After you create the account from Odoo, you need to go to the Avalara
Portal to set up your password:

1.  Access the [Avalara
    portal](https://portal.avalarabrasil.com.br/Login)
2.  Click on `Meu primeiro acesso`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
3.  Add the email address you used in Odoo to create the Avalara/Avatax
    account, and then click `Solicitar Senha`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}
4.  You will receive an email with a token and a link to create your
    password. Click on this link and copy-paste the token to allocate
    your desired password.

:::: warning
::: title
Warning
:::

If you intend first to try the integration on a testing or sandbox
database, using an alternate email address is recommended, as you won\'t
be able to re-use the same email address on your production database.
::::

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

You can start using AvaTax in Odoo without creating a password and
accessing the Avalara Portal; for Odoo, the only requirement to start
using the Avalara Tax Computation Engine is to create an account from
the settings page.
::::

![Avatax account configuration.](brazil/avatax-account-configuration.png)

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

You can transfer API credentials. Use this only when you have already
created an account in another Odoo instance and wish to reuse it.
::::

### Configure master data

#### Chart of accounts

The
`chart of accounts </applications/finance/accounting/get_started/chart_of_accounts>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} is installed by default as part of the data set included in
the localization module. The accounts are mapped automatically in their
corresponding taxes, and the default account payable and account
receivable fields.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The chart of accounts for Brazil is based on the SPED CoA, which gives a
baseline of the accounts needed in Brazil.

You can add or delete accounts according to the company\'s needs.
::::

#### Taxes

Taxes are automatically created when installing the Brazilian
localization. Taxes are already configured, and some of them are used by
Avalara when computing taxes on the sales order or invoice.

Taxes can be edited, or more taxes can be added. For example, some taxes
used for services need to be manually added and configured, as the rate
may differ depending on the city where you are offering the service.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

Taxes attached to services are not computed by AvaTax. Only goods taxes
are computed.
::::

When configuring a tax used for a service that is included in the final
price (when the tax is not added or subtracted on top of the product
price), set the `Tax Computation`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to
`Percentage of Price Tax Included`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
and, on the `Advanced Options`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab,
check the `Included in Price`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} option.

For more information on configuring taxes to fit your needs better,
please go to the `taxes
functional documentation </applications/finance/accounting/taxes>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}.

![Tax configuration.](brazil/tax-configuration.png)

:::: warning
::: title
Warning
:::

Do not delete taxes, as they are used for the AvaTax tax computation. If
deleted, Odoo creates them again when used in an
`SO (Sales order)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} or invoice and
computing taxes with AvaTax, but the account used to register the tax
needs to be re-configured in the tax\'s `Definition`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} tab, under the
`Distribution for invoices`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`Distribution for refunds`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} sections.
::::

#### Products {#brazil/products}

To use the AvaTax integration on sale orders and invoices, first specify
the following information on the product:

- `CEST Code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} (Code for products
  subject to ICMS tax substitution)
- `Mercosul NCM Code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} (Mercosur
  Common Nomenclature Product Code)
- `Source of Origin`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} (Indicates the
  origin of the product, which can be foreign or domestic, among other
  possible options depending on the specific use case)
- `SPED Fiscal Product Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} (Fiscal
  product type according to SPED list table)
- `Purpose of Use`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} (Specify the
  intended purpose of use for this product)

![Product configuration.](brazil/product-configuration.png)

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Odoo automatically creates three products to be used for transportation
costs associated with sales. These are named [Freight]{.title-ref},
[Insurance]{.title-ref}, and [Other Costs]{.title-ref}. They are already
configured, if more need to be created, duplicate and use the same
configuration (configuration needed: `Product Type`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} [Service]{.title-ref},
`Transportation Cost Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
[Insurance]{.title-ref}, [Freight]{.title-ref}, or [Other
Costs]{.title-ref})
::::

#### Contacts {#brazil/contacts}

Before using the integration, specify the following information on the
contact:

1.  General information about the contact:

    - Select the `Company`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} option for
      a contact with a tax ID (CNPJ), or check
      `Individual`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} for a contact with
      a CPF.
    - `Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
    - `Address`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
      `Zip Code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is a required field
      to compute taxes properly.
    - `Tax ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or
      `CPF`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Use CPF for individuals
      and Tax ID (CNPJ) for companies
    - `IE`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: state tax identification
      number
    - `IM`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: municipa tax
      identification number
    - `SUFRAMA code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: SUFRAMA
      registration number
    - `Phone`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
    - `Email`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}

    ![Contact configuration.](brazil/contact-configuration.png)

    :::: note
    ::: title
    Note
    :::

    The `CPF`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, `IE`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}, `IM`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
    `SUFRAMA code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} fields are are
    hidden until the `Country`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is set
    to [Brazil]{.title-ref}.
    ::::

2.  Fiscal information about the contact under the
    `Sales & Purchase`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab:

    - `Fiscal Position`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: add the
      AvaTax fiscal position to automatically compute taxes on sale
      orders and invoices automatically.
    - `Tax Regime`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: federal tax
      regime
    - `ICMS Taxpayer Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: taxpayer
      type determines if the contact is within the ICMS regime, if it is
      exempt, or if it is a non-taxpayer.
    - `Main Activity Sector`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: list of
      main activity sectors of the contact

    ![Contact fiscal configuration.](brazil/contact-fiscal-configuration.png)

#### Fiscal positions {#brazil/fiscal-positions}

To compute taxes on sale orders and invoices, it is necessary to have a
`Fiscal Position`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} with the
`Detect Automatically`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and the
`Use AvaTax API`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} options enabled.

The `Fiscal Position`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} can be
configured on the contact or selected when creating a sales order or an
invoice.

![Fiscal position configuration](brazil/fiscal-position-configuration.png)

## Workflows

This section provides an overview of the actions that trigger API calls
for tax computation.

:::: warning
::: title
Warning
:::

Please note that each API call incurs a cost. Be mindful of the actions
that trigger these calls to manage costs effectively.
::::

### Tax calculations on quotation / sales orders

Trigger an API call to calculate taxes on a quotation or sales order
automatically with AvaTax in any of the following ways:

- 

  **Quotation confirmation**

  :   Confirm a quotation into a sales order.

- 

  **Manual trigger**

  :   Click on `Compute Taxes Using Avatax`{.interpreted-text
      role="guilabel"}.

- 

  **Preview**

  :   Click on the `Preview`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button.

- 

  **Email a quotation / sales order**

  :   Send a quotation or sales order to a customer via email.

-
