  **Online quotation access**

  :   When a customer accesses the quotation online (via the portal
      view), the API call is triggered.

### Tax calculations on invoices

Trigger an API call to calculate taxes on a customer invoice
automatically with AvaTax any of the following ways:

- 

  **Manual trigger**

  :   Click on `Compute Taxes Using AvaTax`{.interpreted-text
      role="guilabel"}.

- 

  **Preview**

  :   Click on the `Preview`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button.

- 

  **Online invoice access**

  :   When a customer accesses the invoice online (via the portal view),
      the API call is triggered.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The `Fiscal Position`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} must be set to
[Automatic Tax Mapping (Avalara Brazil)]{.title-ref} for any of these
actions to compute taxes automatically.
::::

::: seealso
`Fiscal positions (tax and account mapping)
</applications/finance/accounting/taxes/fiscal_positions>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}
:::




--- SOURCE: finance/fiscal_localizations/chile.md ---

# Chile

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

Watch the two webinar recordings below for a general presentation of the
localization, and search the playlist for tutorials to discover
practical workflows while using Odoo in Chile.

- [Webinar: intro and demo](https://youtu.be/BHnByZiyYcM).
- [Webinar: delivery guide](https://youtu.be/X7i4PftnEdU).
- [Playlist of
  tutorials](https://youtube.com/playlist?list=PL1-aSABtP6AB6UY7VUFnVgeYOaz33fb4P).
::::

::: seealso
\- [Chilean localization app
tour](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3qYkgbmBYHw) - [Chilean
localization smart
tutorial](https://www.odoo.com/slides/smart-tutorial-localizacion-de-chile-131)
:::

## Modules {#chile/configuration}

`Install <general/install>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} the following
modules to utilize all the features of the Chilean localization.

  Name                                                                         Technical name                      Description
  ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- ----------------------------------- ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  `Chile - Accounting`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}                      [l10n_cl]{.title-ref}               Adds the minimal accounting features required for a company to operate in Chile under the `SII (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} regulations and guidelines.
  `Chile - Accounting Reports`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}              [l10n_cl_reports]{.title-ref}       Adds the *Propuesta F29* and *Balance Tributario (8 columnas)* reports.
  `Chile - E-invoicing`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}                     [l10n_cl_edi]{.title-ref}           Includes all technical and functional requirements to generate and receive electronic invoices online based on the `SII (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} regulations.
  `Chile - Electronic Receipt`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}              [l10n_cl_boletas]{.title-ref}       Includes all technical and functional requirements to generate and receive electronic invoices digitally based on the `SII (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} regulations.
  `Electronic Exports of Goods for Chile`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}   [l10n_cl_edi_exports]{.title-ref}   Includes technical and functional requirements to generate electronic invoices for exporting goods based on the `SII (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} and customs regulations.
  `Chile - E-Invoicing Delivery Guide`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}      [l10n_cl_edi_stock]{.title-ref}     Includes all technical and functional requirements to generate delivery guides via web service based on the `SII (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} regulations.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

\- Odoo automatically installs the appropriate package for the company
according to the country selected at the creation of the database. - The
*Chile - E-Invoicing Delivery Guide* module depends on the *Inventory*
application.
::::

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

All features are only available if the company already completed the
[SII Sistema de FacturaciÃ³n de
Mercado](https://www.sii.cl/factura_electronica/factura_mercado/proceso_certificacion.htm)
certification process.
::::

## Company information

Navigate to `Settings --> Companies: Update Info`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} and ensure the following company information is
up-to-date and correctly filled in:

- `Company Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Address`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
  - `Street`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  - `City`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  - `State`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  - `ZIP`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  - `Country`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Tax ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: enter the identification
  number for the selected `Taxpayer Type
  <chile/fiscal-info>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}.
- `Activity Names`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: select up to four
  activity codes.
- `Company Activity Description`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
  enter a short description of the company\'s activity.

## Accounting settings

Next, navigate to `Accounting --> Configuration --> Settings --> Chilean
Localization`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"} and follow the
instructions to configure the:

- `Fiscal information <chile/fiscal-info>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
- `Electronic invoice data <chile/electronic-invoice>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}
- `DTE incoming email server <chile/dte-email>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}
- `Signature certificates <chile/certificate>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}

### Fiscal information {#chile/fiscal-info}

Configure the following `Tax payer information`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}:

- `Taxpayer Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} by selecting the
  taxpayer type that applies:
  - `VAT Affected (1st Category)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
    for invoices that charge taxes to customers
  - `Fees Receipt Issuer (2nd Category)`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}: for suppliers who issue fees receipt (Boleta)
  - `End consumer`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: only issues
    receipts
  - `Foreigner`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `SII Office`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: select your
  company\'s `SII (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text
  role="abbr"} regional office

### Electronic invoice data {#chile/electronic-invoice}

Select your `SII Web Services`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
environment:

- `SII - Test`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: for test databases
  using test `CAFs (Folio
  Authorization Code)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} obtained from the
  `SII (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}.
  In this mode, the direct connection flows can be tested, with the
  files being sent to the `SII (Servicio
  de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}.
- `SII - Production`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: for production
  databases.
- `SII - Demo Mode`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: files are
  created and accepted automatically in demo mode but are **not** sent
  to the `SII (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text
  role="abbr"}. For this reason, rejection errors or *Accepted with
  Objections* will not appear in this mode. Every internal validation
  can be tested in demo mode. Avoid selecting this option in a
  production database.

Then, enter the `Legal Electronic Invoicing Data`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}:

- `SII Resolution NÂ°`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `SII Resolution Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}

![Required information for electronic invoice.](chile/electronic-invoice-data.png){.align-center}

## DTE incoming email server {#chile/dte-email}

The `DTE (Documentos Tributarios ElectrÃ³nicos)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} `Email Box Electronic Invoicing`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} can be defined to receive your customers\' claim and
acceptance emails. Enabling this option from
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Settings --> Chilean Localization`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} is necessary if you want to use *Email Box
Electronic Invoicing* as the `DTE (Documentos Tributarios
ElectrÃ³nicos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} incoming email server.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

In order to receive your SII documents, it\'s necessary to set up your
own email server. More information on how to do this can be found in
this documentation:
`../../general/email_communication/email_servers`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}
::::

Begin by clicking `Configure DTE Incoming Email`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, then click `New`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to
add a server and fill in the following fields:

- `Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: give the server a name.
- `Server Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: select the server
  type used.
  - `IMAP Server`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  - `POP Server`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  - `Local Server`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: uses a local
    script to fetch emails and create new records. The script can be
    found in the `Configuration`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
    section with this option selected.
  - `Gmail OAuth Authentication`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
    requires your Gmail API credentials to be configured in the general
    settings. A direct link to the configuration can be found in the
    `Login
    Information`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section.
- `DTE Server`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: enable this option.
  By checking this option, this email account will be used to receive
  the electronic invoices from the suppliers, and communications from
  the `SII
  (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
  regarding the electronic invoices issued. In this case, this email
  should match both emails declared on the
  `SII (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
  site in the section: *ACTUALIZACION DE DATOS DEL CONTRIBUYENTE*, *Mail
  Contacto SII* and *Mail Contacto Empresas*.

In the `Server & Login`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab (for IMAP
and POP servers):

- `Server Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: enter the hostname
  or IP of the server.
- `Port`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: enter the server port.
- `SSL/TLS`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: enable this option if
  connections are encrypted using the SSL/TLS protocol.
- `Username`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: enter the server login
  username.
- `Password`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: enter the server login
  password.

![Incoming email server configuration for Chilean DTE.](chile/dte-incoming-email.png){.align-center}

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

Before going live, it is recommended to archive or remove all emails
related to vendor bills that are not required to be processed in Odoo
from your inbox.
::::

### Certificate {#chile/certificate}

A digital certificate in [.pfx]{.title-ref} format is required to
generate the electronic invoice signature. To add one, click
`Configure Signature Certificates`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
under the `Signature
Certificates`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section. Then, click
`New`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to configure the certificate:

- `Certificate Key`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: click
  `Upload your file`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and select the
  [.pfx]{.title-ref} file.
- `Certificate Passkey`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: enter the
  file\'s passphrase.
- `Subject Serial Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: depending
  on the certificate format, the field might not be automatically
  populated. In that case, enter the certificate\'s legal representative
  `RUT
  (Rol Ãšnico Tributario)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}.
- `Certificate Owner`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: select one if
  you need to restrict the certificate for a specific user. Leave the
  field empty to share it with all billing users.

![Digital certificate configuration.](chile/new-certificate.png){.align-center}

:::: warning
::: title
Warning
:::

If the `Certificate Owner`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field is
set to a specific user, and there are no certificates shared with users,
then the automatic sending of electronic documents and receipt
acknowledgments is **disabled**.
::::

## Multicurrency

The official currency rate is provided by [Chilean
mindicador.cl](https://mindicador.cl). Navigate to
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Settings --> Currencies: Automatic Currency
Rates`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"} to set an
`Interval`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} for when the rate is
automatically updated, or to select another `Service`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}.

## Partner information

Configuring partner contacts is also required to send
`SII (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
electronic invoices. Open the `Contacts`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} app to do so and fill in the following fields on a
new or existing contact form.

- `Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Email`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Identification Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Taxpayer Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Activity Description`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}

In the `Electronic Invoicing`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab:

- `DTE Email`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: enter the sender\'s
  email address for the partner.
- `Delivery Guide Price`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: select
  which price the delivery guide displays, if any.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The `DTE Email`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is the email used for
sending electronic documents and must be set in the contact that will be
part of an electronic document.
::::

![Chilean electronic invoice data for partners.](chile/dte-email-electronic-invoice.png){.align-center}

## Document types

Accounting documents are categorized by
`SII (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}-defined document types.

Document types are created automatically upon installation of the
localization module, and can be managed by navigating to
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Document Types`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}.

![Chilean fiscal document types list.](chile/chilean-document-types.png){.align-center}

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Several document types are inactive by default but can be activated by
toggling the `Active`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} option.
::::

### Use on invoices

The document type on each transaction is determined by:

- The journal related to the invoice, identifying if the journal uses
  documents.
- The condition applied based on the type of issuer and recipient (e.g.,
  the buyer or vendor\'s fiscal regime).

## Journals

*Sales journals* in Odoo usually represent a business unit or location.

::: example
\- Ventas Santiago. - Ventas Valparaiso.
:::

For retail stores it is common to have one journal per
`POS (Point of Sale)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}.

::: example
\- Cashier 1. - Cashier 2.
:::

The *purchase* transactions can be managed with a single journal, but
sometimes companies use more than one journal in order to handle some
accounting transactions that are not related to vendor bills. This
configuration can easily be set by using the following model.

::: example
\- Tax payments to the government. - Employees payments.
:::

### Create a sales journal

To create a sales journal, navigate to
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Journals`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. Then, click the `New`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} button, and fill in the following required information:

- `Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: select
  `Sale`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} from the drop-down menu for
  customer invoice journals.
- `Point of sale type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: if the sales
  journal will be used for electronic documents, the option
  `Online`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} must be selected.
  Otherwise, if the journal is used for invoices imported from a
  previous system or if you are using the `SII (Servicio de Impuestos
  Internos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} portal *FacturaciÃ³n MiPyme*,
  you can use the option `Manual`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
- `Use Documents`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: check this field
  if the journal will use document types. This field is only applicable
  to purchase and sales journals that can be related to the different
  sets of document types available in Chile. By default, all the sales
  journals created will use documents.

Next, from the `Jounal Entries`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab,
define the `Default Income Account`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
and `Dedicated Credit Note Squence`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
in the `Accounting Information`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
section. Configuring these fields is required for one of the debit notes
`use cases <chile/use-cases>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}.

## CAF {#chile/caf-documentation}

A *folio authorization code* (CAF) is required for each document type
that will be issued electronically. The
`CAF (Folio Authorization Code)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} is a
file the `SII (Servicio de
Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} provides to the
issuer with the folios/sequences authorized for the electronic invoice
documents.

Your company can request multiple folios and obtain several
`CAFs (Folio Authorization Codes)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} linked
to different folio ranges. These
`CAFs (Folio Authorization Code)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} are
shared within all journals, so you only need one active
`CAF (Folio Authorization Code)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} per
document type, and it will be applied to all journals.

Please refer to the [SII
documentation](https://palena.sii.cl/dte/mn_timbraje.html) to check the
details on how to acquire the
`CAF (Folio Authorization Code)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} files.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

The `CAFs (Folio Authorization Code)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
required by the `SII (Servicio de Impuestos
Internos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} are different from production
to test (certification mode). Make sure you have the correct
`CAF (Folio Authorization Code)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} set
depending on your environment.
::::

### Upload CAF files

Once the `CAF (Folio Authorization Code)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
files have been acquired from the `SII
(Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} portal,
they need to be uploaded in the database by navigating to
`Accounting --> Configuration: Chilean SII --> CAFs`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. Then, click the `New`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} begin the configuration. On the
`CAF (Folio Authorization Code)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} form,
upload your `CAF
(Folio Authorization Code)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} file by
clicking the `Upload your file`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
button and then click `Save`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

Once uploaded, the status changes to `In Use`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}. At this moment, when a transaction is used for this
document type, the invoice number takes the first folio in the sequence.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

The document types have to be active before uploading the
`CAF (Folio Authorization Code)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} files.
In case some folios have been used in the previous system, the next
valid folio has to be set when the first transaction is created.
::::

## Chart of accounts

The chart of accounts is installed by default as part of the data set
included in the localization module. The accounts are mapped
automatically in:

- Taxes
- Default Account Payable
- Default Account Receivable
- Transfer Accounts
- Conversion Rate

::: seealso
`../accounting/get_started/chart_of_accounts`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}
:::

## Taxes

As part of the localization module, taxes are created automatically with
their related financial account and configuration. These taxes can be
managed from `Accounting -->
Configuration --> Taxes`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}.

Chile has several tax types, the most common ones are:

- **VAT**: the regular VAT can have several rates.
- **ILA**: the tax for alcoholic drinks.

::: seealso
`../accounting/taxes`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
:::

## Usage and testing

### Electronic invoice workflow

In the Chilean localization, the electronic invoice workflow includes
customer invoice issuance and vendor bill reception. The following
diagram explains how information is shared to the `SII
(Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"},
customers, and vendors.

![Diagram with Electronic invoice transactions.](chile/electronic-invoice-workflow.png){.align-center}

### Customer invoice emission

After the partners and journals are created and configured, the invoices
are created in the standard way. For Chile, one of the differences is
the document type that is automatically selected based on the taxpayer.
The document type can be changed manually if needed on the invoice by
navigating to `Accounting --> Customers --> Invoices`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}.

![Customer invoice document type selection.](chile/customer-invoice-document-type.png){.align-center}

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

`Documents type 33`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} electronic
invoice must have at least one item with tax, otherwise the
`SII (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
rejects the document validation.
::::

#### Validation and DTE status {#chile/electronic-invoice-validation}

Once all invoice information is filled, either manually or automatically
when generated from a sales order, validate the invoice. After the
invoice is posted:

- The `DTE (Documentos Tributarios ElectrÃ³nicos)`{.interpreted-text
  role="abbr"} file is created automatically and recorded in the
  chatter.

- The `DTE (Documentos Tributarios ElectrÃ³nicos)`{.interpreted-text
  role="abbr"} `SII (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text
  role="abbr"} status is set as `Pending`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} to be sent.

  ![DTE XML File displayed in chatter.](chile/xml-creation.png){.align-center}

The `DTE (Documentos Tributarios ElectrÃ³nicos)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} status is updated automatically by Odoo with a scheduled
action that runs every day at night, if the response from the
`SII (Servicio de
Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} is needed
immediately, you can do it manually as well by following the
`DTE (Documentos Tributarios ElectrÃ³nicos)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} status workflow:

![Transition of DTE status flow.](chile/dte-status-flow.png){.align-center}

1.  The first step is to send the
    `DTE (Documentos Tributarios ElectrÃ³nicos)`{.interpreted-text
    role="abbr"} to the `SII
    (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}.
    This can be sent manually by clicking the `Enviar
    Ahora`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button. This generates a
    `SII Tack number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} for the
    invoice, which is used to check the details sent by the
    `SII (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text
    role="abbr"} via email. Then, the `DTE status`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} is updated to `Ask for Status`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}.

2.  Once the `SII (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text
    role="abbr"} response is received, Odoo updates the
    `DTE status`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. To do it manually,
    click on the button `Verify on SII`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}. The result can either be
    `Accepted`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
    `Accepted With Objection`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or
    `Rejected`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

    ![Identification transaction for invoice and Status update.](chile/dte-status-steps.png){.align-center}

    :::: important
    ::: title
    Important
    :::

    There are intermediate statuses in the
    `SII (Serviciqo de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text
    role="abbr"} before acceptance or rejection. It\'s recommended to
    **NOT** continuously click `Verify in
    SII`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} for smooth processing.

    ![Electronic invoice data statuses.](chile/chatter-internal-statuses.png){.align-center}
    ::::

3.  The final response from the
    `SII (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text
    role="abbr"} can take on one of these values:

    - `Accepted`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: indicates the
      invoice information is correct, our document is now fiscally valid
      and it\'s automatically sent to the customer.

    - `Accepted with objections`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
      indicates the invoice information is correct, but a minor issue
      was identified, nevertheless the document is now fiscally valid
      and it\'s automatically sent to the customer.

    - `Rejected`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: indicates the
      invoice information is incorrect and must be corrected. Details
      are sent to emails you registered in the
      `SII (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text
      role="abbr"}. If it is properly configured in Odoo, the details
      are also retrieved in the chatter once the email server is
      processed.

      If the invoice is rejected please follow these steps:

      1.  Change the document to `Draft`{.interpreted-text
          role="guilabel"}.
      2.  Make the required corrections based on the message received
          from the `SII (Servicio
          de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} in the
          chatter.
      3.  Post the invoice again.

      ![Message when an invoice is rejected.](chile/rejected-invoice.png){.align-center}

#### Crossed references

When the invoice is created, as a result of another fiscal document, the
information related to the originator document must be registered in the
`Cross-Reference`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab. This tab is
commonly used for credit or debit notes, however, in some cases it can
be used for customer invoices, as well. In the case of the credit and
debit notes, they are set automatically by Odoo.

![Crossed referenced document(s).](chile/cross-reference-tab-registration.png){.align-center}

#### Invoice PDF report {#chile/electronic-invoice-pdf-report}

Once the invoice is accepted and validated by the
`SII (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
and the PDF is printed, it includes the fiscal elements that indicate
that the document is fiscally valid.

![Fiscal elements and barcode printed in accepted invoices.](chile/accepted-invoice-fiscal-information.png)

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

If you are hosted in Odoo SH or On-Premise, you should manually install
the [pdf417gen](https://pypi.org/project/pdf417gen/) library. Use the
following command to install it:
`pip install pdf417gen`{.interpreted-text role="command"}.
::::

#### Commercial validation

Once the invoice has been sent to the customer:

1.  `DTE Partner Status`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} changes to
    `Sent`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
2.  The customer must send a reception confirmation email.
3.  Subsequently, if commercial terms and invoice data are correct, an
    acceptance confirmation is sent; otherwise, a claim is sent.
4.  The field `DTE Acceptance Status`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
    is updated automatically.

![Message with the commercial acceptance from the customer.](chile/partner-dte-status.png){.align-center}

#### Processed for claimed invoices

Once the invoice has been accepted by the
`SII (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"},
**it can not be cancelled in Odoo**. In case you get a claim for your
customer, the correct way to proceed is with a credit note to either
cancel the invoice or correct it. Please refer to the
`chile/credit-notes`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} section for more
details.

![Invoice Commercial status updated to claimed.](chile/accepted-invoice.png){.align-center}

#### Common errors

There are multiple reasons behind a rejection from the
`SII (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"},
but these are some of the common errors you might have and how to solve
them:

- | **Error:** [RECHAZO- DTE Sin Comuna Origen]{.title-ref}
  | **Hint:** make sure the company address is properly filled including
    the state and city.

- | **Error:** [en Monto - IVA debe declararse]{.title-ref}
  | **Hint:** the invoice lines should include one VAT tax, make sure
    you add one on each invoice line.

- | **Error:** [Rut No Autorizado a Firmar]{.title-ref}
  | **Hint:** the `RUT (Rol Ãšnico Tributario)`{.interpreted-text
    role="abbr"} entered is not allowed to invoice electronically, make
    sure the company `RUT (Rol Ãšnico Tributario)`{.interpreted-text
    role="abbr"} is correct and is valid in the
    `SII (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text
    role="abbr"} to invoice electronically.

- | **Error:** [Fecha/NÃºmero Resolucion Invalido RECHAZO- CAF Vencido :
    (Firma_DTE\[AAAA-MM-DD\] - CAF\[AAAA-MM-DD\]) &gt; 6
    meses]{.title-ref}
  | **Hint:** try to add a new CAF related to this document as the one
    you\'re using is expired.

- | **Error:** [Element \'{http://www.sii.cl/SiiDte%7DRutReceptor\':
    This element is not expected. Expected is (
    {http://www.sii.cl/SiiDte%7DRutEnvia ).]{.title-ref}
  | **Hint:** Make sure the field `Document Type`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} and `VAT`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} are
    set in the customer and in the main company.

- | **Error:** [Usuario sin permiso de envio.]{.title-ref}
  | **Hint:** this error indicates that most likely, your company has
    not passed the [Certification
    process](https://www.sii.cl/factura_electronica/factura_mercado/proceso_certificacion.htm)
    in the `SII (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text
    role="abbr"} - Sistema de FacturaciÃ³n de Mercado. If this is the
    case, please contact your Account Manager or Customer Support as
    this certification is not part of the Odoo services, but we can give
    you some alternatives. If you already passed the certification
    process, this error appears when a user different from the owner of
    the certificate is trying to send
    `DTE (Documentos Tributarios ElectrÃ³nicos)`{.interpreted-text
    role="abbr"} files to the
    `SII (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text
    role="abbr"}.

- | **Error:** [CARATULA]{.title-ref}
  | **Hint:** there are just five reasons why this error could show up
    and all of them are related to the *Caratula* section of the XML:

  > - The company\'s `RUT (Rol Ãšnico Tributario)`{.interpreted-text
  >   role="abbr"} number is incorrect or missing.
  > - The certificate owner
  >   `RUT (Rol Ãšnico Tributario)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} number
  >   is incorrect or missing.
  > - The `SII's (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text
  >   role="abbr"} `RUT (Rol Ãšnico Tributario)`{.interpreted-text
  >   role="abbr"} number (this should be correct by default) is
  >   incorrect or missing.
  > - The resolution date is incorrect or missing.
  > - The resolution number is incorrect or missing.

### Credit notes {#chile/credit-notes}

When a cancellation or correction is needed over a validated invoice, a
credit note must be generated. It is important to consider that a
`CAF (Folio Authorization Code)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} file is
required for the credit note, which is identified as
`Document Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
`61`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in the
`SII (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}.
Please refer to the `CAF section
<chile/caf-documentation>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} for more
information on the process to load the `CAF (Folio
Authorization Code)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} on each document
type.

![Creation of CAF for Credit notes.](chile/credit-note-document-type.png){.align-center}

#### Use cases

##### Cancel referenced document

In case you need to cancel or invalidate an invoice, navigate to
`Accounting -->
Customers --> Invoices`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"} and
select the desired invoice. Then, use the button `Add Credit
Note`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and select
`Full Refund`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, in this case the
`SII (Servicio de Impuestos
Internos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} reference code is
automatically set to `Anula Documento de referencia`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}.

![Credit note canceling the referenced document.](chile/credit-note-cancel-ref-doc.png){.align-center}

##### Correct referenced document

If a correction in the invoice information is required, for example the
street name on the original invoice is wrong, then use the button
`Add Credit Note`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, select
`Partial Refund`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and select the
option `Only Text Correction`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. In
this case the `SII Reference
Code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field is automatically set to
`Corrects Referenced Document Text`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

![Credit note correcting referenced document text.](chile/credit-note-correct-text.png){.align-center}

Odoo creates a credit note with the corrected text in an invoice and
`Price`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} [0.00]{.title-ref}.

![Credit note with the corrected value on the invoice lines.](chile/text-correction-label.png){.align-center}

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

Make sure to define the `Default Credit Account`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} in the sales journal specifically for this use case.
::::

##### Corrects referenced document amount

When a correction on the amounts is required, use the button
`Add Credit note`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and select
`Partial Refund`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. In this case the
`SII Reference Code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is automatically
set to `Corrige el monto del Documento de Referencia`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}.

![Credit note for partial refund to correct amounts, using the SII reference code 3.](chile/credit-note-correct-amount.png){.align-center}

### Debit notes

In Chilean localization, debit notes, in addition to credit notes, can
be created using the `Add Debit Note`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
button, with two main use cases.

#### Use cases {#chile/use-cases}

##### Add debt on invoices

The primary use case for debit notes is to increase the value of an
existing invoice. To do so, select option
`3. Corrige el monto del Documento de Referencia`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} for the `Reference Code SII`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} field.

![Debit note correcting referenced document amount.](chile/debit-note-correct-amount.png){.align-center}

In this case Odoo automatically includes the
`Source Invoice`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in the `Cross
Reference`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab.

![Automatic reference to invoice in a debit note.](chile/auto-ref-debit-note.png){.align-center}

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

You can only add debit notes to an invoice already accepted by the SII.
::::

##### Cancel credit notes

In Chile, debits notes are used to cancel a valid credit note. To do
this, click the `Add
Debit Note`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button and select the
`1: Anula Documentos de referencia`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
option for the `Reference Code SII`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
field.

![Debit note to cancel the referenced document (credit note).](chile/debit-note-cancel-ref-doc.png){.align-center}

### Vendor bills

As part of the Chilean localization, you can configure your incoming
email server to match the one you have registered in the
`SII (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} in
order to:

- Automatically receive the vendor bills
  `DTE (Documentos Tributarios ElectrÃ³nicos)`{.interpreted-text
  role="abbr"} and create the vendor bill based on this information.
- Automatically send the reception acknowledgement to your vendor.
- Accept or claim the document and send this status to your vendor.

#### Reception

As soon as the vendor email with the attached
`DTE (Documentos Tributarios ElectrÃ³nicos)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} is received:

1.  The vendor bill maps all the information included in the XML.
2.  An email is sent to the vendor with the reception acknowledgement.
3.  The `DTE Status`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is set as
    `Acuse de Recibido Enviado`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

#### Acceptation

If all the commercial information is correct on your vendor bill, then
you can accept the document using the
`Aceptar Documento`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button. Once this
is done, the `DTE Acceptation
Status`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} changes to
`Accepted`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and an email of acceptance
is sent to the vendor.

![Button for accepting vendor bills.](chile/accept-vendor-bill-btn.png){.align-center}

#### Claim

In case there is a commercial issue or the information is not correct on
your vendor bill, you can claim the document before validating it, using
the `Claim`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button. Once this is
done, the `DTE Acceptation Status`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
changes to `Claim`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and a rejection
email is sent to the vendor.

![Claim button in vendor bills to inform the vendor all the document is commercially
rejected.
:align: center](chile/claim-vendor-bill-btn.png)

If you claim a vendor bill, the status changes from
`Draft`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to `Cancel`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} automatically. Considering this as best practice, all
the claimed documents should be canceled as they won\'t be valid for
your accounting records.

### Electronic purchase invoice

The *electronic purchase invoice* is a feature included in the
[l10n_cl_edi]{.title-ref} module.

Once all configurations have been made for
`electronic invoices <chile/electronic-invoice>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} (e.g., uploading a valid company certificate, setting up
master data, etc.), the electronic purchase invoices need their own
`CAFs (Folio Authorization Code)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}. Please
refer to the
`CAF documentation <chile/caf-documentation>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} to check the details on how to acquire the
`CAFs (Folio Authorization Code)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} for
electronic purchase invoices.

Electronic purchase invoices are useful when vendors are not obligated
to expedite an electronic vendor bill for your purchase. Still, your
obligations require a document to be sent to the
`SII (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} as
proof of purchase.

#### Configuration

To generate an electronic purchase invoice from a vendor bill, the bill
must be created in a purchase journal with the *Use Documents* feature
enabled. It is possible to modify an existing purchase journal or create
a new one in the following process.

To modify the existing purchase journal, or create a new purchase
journal, navigate to
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Journals`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. Then, click the `New`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} button, and fill in the following required information:

- `Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: select
  `Purchase`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} from the drop-down menu
  for vendor bill journals.
- `Use Documents`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: check this field
  so the journal can generate electronic documents (in this case the
  electronic purchase invoice).

#### Generate an electronic purchase invoice

To generate this type of document, it is necessary to create a vendor
bill in Odoo. To do so, navigate to
`Accounting --> Vendors --> Bills`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, and click the `New`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} button.

When all of the electronic purchase invoice information is filled,
select the option `(46)
Electronic Purchase Invoice`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in the
`Document Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field:

After the vendor bill is posted:

- The `DTE (Documentos Tributarios ElectrÃ³nicos)`{.interpreted-text
  role="abbr"} file (Electronic Tax Document) is automatically created
  and added to the chatter.
- The `DTE SII Status`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is set as
  `Pending to be sent`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

Odoo automatically updates the *DTE Status* every night using a
scheduled action. To get a response from the
`SII (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
immediately, click the `Send now to
SII`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button.

### Delivery guide

To install the `Delivery Guide`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
module, go to `Apps`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"} and search
for [Chile (l10n_cl)]{.title-ref}. Then click
`Install`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} on the module
`Chile - E-Invoicing Delivery
Guide`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

`Chile - E-Invoicing Delivery Guide`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
has a dependency with `Chile -
FacturaciÃ³n ElectrÃ³nica`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Odoo will
install the dependency automatically when the
`Delivery Guide`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} module is installed.
::::

The *Delivery Guide* module includes the ability to send the
`DTE (Documentos Tributarios
ElectrÃ³nicos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} to
`SII (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
and the stamp in PDF reports for deliveries.

Once all configurations have been made for
`electronic invoices <chile/electronic-invoice>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} (e.g., uploading a valid company certificate, setting up
master data, etc.), delivery guides need their own
`CAFs (Folio Authorization Code)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}. Please
refer to the `CAF documentation
<chile/caf-documentation>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} to check the
details on how to acquire the `CAF (Folio
Authorization Code)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} for electronic
Delivery Guides.

Verify the following important information in the
`Price for the Delivery Guide`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
configuration:

- `From Sales Order`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: delivery guide
  takes the product price from the sales order and shows it on the
  document.
- `From Product Template`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Odoo takes
  the price configured in the product template and shows it on the
  document.
- `No show price`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: no price is shown
  in the delivery guide.

Electronic delivery guides are used to move stock from one place to
another and they can represent sales, sampling, consignment, internal
transfers, and basically any product move.

#### Delivery guide from a sales process

:::: warning
::: title
Warning
:::

A delivery guide should **not** be longer than one page or contain more
than 60 product lines.
::::

When a sales order is created and confirmed, a delivery order is
generated. After validating the delivery order, the option to create a
delivery guide is activated.

![Create Delivery Guide button on a sales process.](chile/delivery-guide-creation-btn.png){.align-center}

:::: warning
::: title
Warning
:::

When clicking on `Create Delivery Guide`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} for the first time, a warning message pops up, stating
the following:

[No se encontrÃ³ una secuencia para la guÃ­a de despacho. Por favor,
establezca el primer nÃºmero dentro del campo nÃºmero para la guÃ­a de
despacho]{.title-ref}

![First Delivery Guide number warning message.](chile/delivery-guide-number-warning.png){.align-center}
::::

This warning message means the user needs to indicate the next sequence
number Odoo has to take to generate the delivery guide (e.g. next
available `CAF (Folio Authorization Code)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} number), and only happens the first time a delivery guide
is created in Odoo. After the first document has been correctly
generated, Odoo takes the next available number in the
`CAF (Folio Authorization
Code)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} file to generate the following
delivery guide.

After the delivery guide is created:

- The `DTE (Documentos Tributarios ElectrÃ³nicos)`{.interpreted-text
  role="abbr"} file (Electronic Tax Document) is automatically created
  and added to the `chatter`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
- The `DTE SII Status`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is set as
  `Pending to be sent`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

![Chatter notes of Delivery Guide creation.](chile/chatter-delivery-guide.png){.align-center}

The `DTE Status`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is automatically
updated by Odoo with a scheduled action that runs every night. To get a
response from the
`SII (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
immediately, press the `Send now to SII`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} button.

Once the delivery guide is sent, it may then be printed by clicking on
the `Print Delivery
Guide`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button.

![Printing Delivery Guide PDF.](chile/print-delivery-guide-btn.png){.align-center}

Delivery guide will have fiscal elements that indicate that the document
is fiscally valid when printed (if hosted in *Odoo SH* or on
*On-premise* remember to manually add the `pdf417gen`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} library mentioned in the `Invoice PDF report section
<chile/electronic-invoice-pdf-report>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}).

### Electronic receipt

To install the `Electronic Receipt`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
module, go to `Apps`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"} and search
for [Chile (l10n_cl)]{.title-ref}. Then click
`Install`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} on the module
`Chile - Electronic
Receipt`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

`Chile - Electronic Receipt`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} has a
dependency with `Chile - FacturaciÃ³n
ElectrÃ³nica`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Odoo will install the
dependency automatically when the `E-invoicing
Delivery Guide`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} module is installed.
::::

Once all configurations have been made for
`electronic invoices <chile/electronic-invoice>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} (e.g., uploading a valid company certificate, setting up
master data, etc.), electronic receipts need their own
`CAFs (Folio Authorization Code)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}. Please
refer to the `CAF documentation
<chile/caf-documentation>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} to check the
details on how to acquire the `CAFs (Folio
Authorization Code)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} for electronic
receipts.

Electronic receipts are useful when clients do not need an electronic
invoice. By default, there is a partner in the database called
`Anonymous Final Consumer`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} with a
generic `RUT (Rol
Ãšnico Tributario)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
[66666666-6]{.title-ref} and taxpayer type of
`Final Consumer`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. This partner can be
used for electronic receipts or a new record may be created for the same
purpose.

![Electronic Receipt module.](chile/electronic-receipt-customer.png){.align-center}

Although electronic receipts should be used for final consumers with a
generic `RUT (Rol Ãšnico
Tributario)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}, it can also be used for
specific partners. After the partners and journals are created and
configured, the electronic receipts are created in the standard way as
electronic invoice, but the type of document
`(39) Electronic Receipt`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} should be
selected in the invoice form:

![Document type 39 for Electronic Receipts.](chile/document-type-39.png){.align-center}

#### Validation and DTE status

When all of the electronic receipt information is filled, manually (or
automatically) proceed to validate the receipt from the sales order. By
default, `Electronic Invoice`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is
selected as the `Document Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
however in order to validate the receipt correctly, make sure to edit
the `Document Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and change to
`Electronic Receipt`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

After the receipt is posted:

- The `DTE (Documentos Tributarios ElectrÃ³nicos)`{.interpreted-text
  role="abbr"} file (Electronic Tax Document) is created automatically
  and added to the `chatter`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
- The `DTE SII Status`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is set as
  `Pending to be sent`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

![Electronic Receipts STE creation status.](chile/electronic-receipt-ste-status.png){.align-center}

The `DTE Status`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is automatically
updated by Odoo with a scheduled action that runs every day at night. To
get a response from the
`SII (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
immediately, press the `Send now to SII`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} button.

Please refer to the
`DTE Workflow <chile/electronic-invoice-validation>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} for electronic invoices as the workflow for electronic
receipt follows the same process.

### Electronic export of goods

To install the `Electronic Exports of Goods`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} module, go to `Apps`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} and search for [Chile (l10n_cl)]{.title-ref}. Then
click `Install`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} on the module
`Electronic
Exports of Goods for Chile`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

`Chile - Electronic Exports of Goods for Chile`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} has a dependency with `Chile
- FacturaciÃ³n ElectrÃ³nica`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
::::

Once all configurations have been made for
`electronic invoices <chile/electronic-invoice>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} (e.g., uploading a valid company certificate, setting up
master data, etc.), electronic exports of goods need their own
`CAFs (Folio Authorization Code)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}. Please
refer to the `CAF
documentation <chile/caf-documentation>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
to check the details on how to acquire the `CAFs
(Folio Authorization Code)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} for
electronic receipts.

Electronic invoices for the export of goods are tax documents that are
used not only for the
`SII (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
but are also used with customs and contain the information required by
it.

#### Contact configurations

![Taxpayer Type needed for the Electronic Exports of Goods module.](chile/taxpayer-type-export-goods.png){.align-center}

#### Chilean customs

When creating an electronic exports of goods invoice, these new fields
in the `Other Info`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab are required
to comply with Chilean regulations.

![Chilean customs fields.](chile/chilean-custom-fields.png){.align-center}

#### PDF report

Once the invoice is accepted and validated by the
`SII (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
and the PDF is printed, it includes the fiscal elements that indicate
that the document is fiscally valid and a new section needed for
customs.

![PDF report section for the Electronic Exports of Goods PDF Report.](chile/pdf-report-section.png){.align-center}

## Financial reports

### Balance tributario de 8 columnas

This report presents the accounts in detail (with their respective
balances), classifying them according to their origin and determining
the level of profit or loss that the business had within the evaluated
period of time.

You can find this report in
`Accounting --> Reporting --> Balance Sheet`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} and selecting in the `Report`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} field the option `Chilean Fiscal Balance (8 Columns)
(CL)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

![Location of the Reporte Balance Tributario de 8 Columnas.](chile/locate-fiscal-balance-report.png){.align-center}

![Chilean Fiscal Balance (8 Columns).](chile/8-col-fiscal-balance-report.png){.align-center}

### Propuesta F29

The form *F29* is a new system that the
`SII (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
enabled to taxpayers, and that replaces the *Purchase and Sales Books*.
This report is integrated by Purchase Register (CR) and the Sales
Register (RV). Its purpose is to support the transactions related to
VAT, improving its control and declaration.

This record is supplied by the electronic tax documents (DTE\'s) that
have been received by the
`SII (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}.

You can find this report in
`Accounting --> Reporting --> Tax Reports`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} and selecting the `Report`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} option `Propuesta F29 (CL)`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}.

![Location of the Propuesta F29 (CL) Report.](chile/locate-propuesta-f29-report.png){.align-center}

It is possible to set the
`PPM (Provisional Monthly Payments rate)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
and the `Proportional Factor for the fiscal year`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} from the `Accounting -->
Configuration --> Settings`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}.

![Default PPM and Proportional Factor for the Propuesta F29 Report.](chile/f29-report.png){.align-center}

Or manually in the reports by clicking on the
`âœï¸ (pencil)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} icon.

![Manual PPM for the Propuesta F29 Report.](chile/manual-ppm-f29-report.png){.align-center}




--- SOURCE: finance/fiscal_localizations/colombia.md ---

# Colombia

Odoo\'s Colombian localization package provides accounting, fiscal, and
legal features for databases in Colombia -- such as chart of accounts,
taxes, and electronic invoicing.

In addition, a series of videos on the subject is also available. These
videos cover how to start from scratch, set up configurations, complete
common workflows, and provide in-depth looks at some specific use cases
as well.

::: seealso
[Smart Tutorial - Colombian
Localization](https://www.odoo.com/slides/smart-tutorial-localizacion-de-colombia-132).
:::

## Configuration {#colombia/configuration}

### Modules installation

`Install <general/install>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} the following
modules to get all the features of the Colombian localization:

  ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  Name                                                                  Technical name                  Description
  --------------------------------------------------------------------- ------------------------------- ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  `Colombia - Accounting`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}            [l10n_co]{.title-ref}           Default
                                                                                                        `fiscal localization package <fiscal_localizations/packages>`{.interpreted-text
                                                                                                        role="ref"}. This module adds the base accounting features for the Colombian
                                                                                                        localization: chart of accounts, taxes, withholdings, and identification document
                                                                                                        type.

  `Colombian - Accounting Reports`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}   [l10n_co_reports]{.title-ref}   Includes accounting reports for sending certifications to suppliers for
                                                                                                        withholdings applied.

  `Electronic invoicing for Colombia with Carvajal`{.interpreted-text   [l10n_co_edi]{.title-ref}       This module includes the features required for integration with Carvajal, and
  role="guilabel"}                                                                                      generates the electronic invoices and support documents related to the vendor
                                                                                                        bills, based on
                                                                                                        `DIAN (DirecciÃ³n de Impuestos y Aduanas Nacionales)`{.interpreted-text
                                                                                                        role="abbr"} regulations.

  `Colombian - Point of Sale`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}        [l10n_co_pos]{.title-ref}       Includes Point of Sale receipts for Colombian localization.
  ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

When [Colombia]{.title-ref} is selected for a company\'s
`Fiscal Localization`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, Odoo
automatically installs certain modules.
::::

### Company configuration

To configure your company information, go to the
`Contacts`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"} app, and search for
your company.

Alternatively, activate
`developer mode <developer-mode>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} and
navigate to
`General Setting --> Company --> Update Info --> Contact`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. Then, edit the contact form and configure the
following information:

- `Company Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
- `Address`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Including
  `City`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  `Department`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
  `ZIP`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} code.
- `Identification Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select the
  `Identification Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  ([NIT]{.title-ref}, [CÃ©dula de CiudadanÃ­a]{.title-ref}, [Registro
  Civil]{.title-ref}, etc.). When the
  `Identification Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is
  [NIT]{.title-ref}, the `Identification Number`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} **must** have the *verification digit* at the end of
  the ID prefixed by a hyphen ([-]{.title-ref}).

Next, configure the `Fiscal Information`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} in the `Sales & Purchase`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} tab:

- `Obligaciones y Responsabilidades`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
  Select the fiscal responsibility for the company ([O-13]{.title-ref}
  Gran Contribuyente, [O-15]{.title-ref} Autorretenedor,
  [O-23]{.title-ref} Agente de retenciÃ³n IVA, [O-47]{.title-ref} Regimen
  de tributaciÃ³n simple, [R-99-PN]{.title-ref} No Aplica).
- `Gran Contribuyente`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: If the
  company is *Gran Contribuyente* this option should be selected.
- `Fiscal Regimen`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select the
  Tribute Name for the company ([IVA]{.title-ref}, [INC]{.title-ref},
  [IVA e INC]{.title-ref}, or [No Aplica]{.title-ref})
- `Commercial Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: If the company
  uses a specific commercial name, and it needs to be displayed in the
  invoice.

### Carjaval credentials configuration

Once the modules are installed, the user credentials **must** be
configured, in order to connect with Carvajal Web Service. To do so,
navigate to `Accounting --> Configuration -->
Settings`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"} and scroll to the
`Colombian Electronic Invoicing`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
section. Then, fill in the required configuration information provided
by Carvajal:

- `Username`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
  `Password`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Username and password
  (provided by Carvajal) to the company.
- `Company Registry`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Company\'s NIT
  number *without* the verification code.
- `Account ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Company\'s NIT number
  followed by [\_01]{.title-ref}.
- `Colombia Template Code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select
  one of the two available templates ([CGEN03]{.title-ref} or
  [CGNE04]{.title-ref}) to be used in the PDF format of the electronic
  invoice.

Enable the `Test mode`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} checkbox to
connect with the Carvajal testing environment.

Once Odoo and Carvajal are fully configured and ready for production,
deactivate the `Test
mode`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} checkbox to use the production
database.

![Configure credentials for Carvajal web service in Odoo.](colombia/carvajal-configuration.png){.align-center}

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

`Test mode`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} must **only** be used on
duplicated databases, **not** the production environment.
::::

### Report data configuration

Report data can be defined for the fiscal section and bank information
of the PDF as part of the configurable information sent in the XML.

Navigate to
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Settings`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, and scroll to the
`Colombian Electronic Invoicing`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
section, in order to find the `Report
Configuration`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} fields. Here the
header information for each report type can be configured.

- `Gran Contribuyente`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Tipo de RÃ©gimen`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Retenedores de IVA`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Autorretenedores`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `ResoluciÃ³n Aplicable`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Actividad EconÃ³mica`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Bank Information`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}

### Master data configuration {#colombia/master-data}

#### Partner

Partner contacts can be created in the *Contacts* app. To do so,
navigate to `Contacts`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}, and
click the `Create`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button.

Then, name the contact, and using the radio buttons, select the contact
type, either `Individual`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or
`Company`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

Complete the full `Address`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
including the `City`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`State`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and `ZIP`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} code. Then, complete the identification and fiscal
information.

##### Identification information

Identification types, defined by the
`DIAN (DirecciÃ³n de Impuestos y Aduanas Nacionales)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}, are available on the partner form, as part of the
Colombian localization. Colombian partners **must** have their
`Identification Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} (VAT) and
`Document Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} set.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

When the `Document Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is
[NIT]{.title-ref}, the `Identification Number`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} needs to be configured in Odoo, including the
*verification digit at the end of the ID, prefixed by a hyphen (\`-\`)*.
::::

##### Fiscal information

The partner\'s responsibility codes (section 53 in the
`RUT (Registro Ãºnico tributario)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
document) are included as part of the electronic invoicing module, as it
is required by the
`DIAN (DirecciÃ³n de Impuestos y Aduanas Nacionales)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}.

The required fields can be found under
`Partner --> Sales & Purchase Tab --> Fiscal
Information section`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}:

- `Obligaciones y Responsabilidades`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
  Select the fiscal responsibility for the company ([O-13]{.title-ref}
  Gran Contribuyente, [O-15]{.title-ref} Autorretenedor,
  [O-23]{.title-ref} Agente de retenciÃ³n IVA, [O-47]{.title-ref} Regimen
  de tributaciÃ³n simple, or [R-99-PN]{.title-ref} No Aplica).
- `Gran Contribuyente`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: If the
  company is *Gran Contribuyente* this option should be selected.
- `Fiscal Regimen`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select the
  tribute name for the company ([IVA]{.title-ref}, [INC]{.title-ref},
  [IVA e INC]{.title-ref}, or [No Aplica]{.title-ref})
- `Commercial Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: If the company
  uses a specific commercial name, and it needs to be displayed in the
  invoice.

#### Products

To manage products, navigate to
`Accounting --> Customers --> Products`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, then click on a product.

When adding general information on the product form, it is required that
either the `UNSPSC Category`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
(`Accounting`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab), or
`Internal Reference`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
(`General Information`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab) field is
configured. Be sure to `Save`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} the
product once configured.

#### Taxes

To create or modify taxes, go to
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Taxes`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, and select the related tax.

If sales transactions include products with taxes, the
`Value Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field in the
`Advanced Options`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab needs to be
configured per tax. Retention tax types (`ICA`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, `IVA`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`Fuente`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}) are also included. This
configuration is used to display taxes correctly in the invoice PDF.

![The ICA, IVA and Fuente fields in the Advanced Options tab in Odoo.](colombia/retention-tax-types.png){.align-center}

#### Sales journals {#co-journals}

Once the
`DIAN (DirecciÃ³n de Impuestos y Aduanas Nacionales)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} has assigned the official sequence and prefix for the
electronic invoice resolution, the sales journals related to the invoice
documents **must** be updated in Odoo. To do so, navigate to
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Journals`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, and select an existing sales journal, or create a
new one with the `Create`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button.

On the sales journal form, input the `Journal Name`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, `Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and set a
unique `Short Code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in the
`Journals Entries`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab. Then,
configure the following data in the
`Advanced Settings`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab:

- `Electronic invoicing`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enable
  `UBL 2.1 (Colombia)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
- `Invoicing Resolution`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Resolution
  number issued by
  `DIAN (DirecciÃ³n de Impuestos y Aduanas Nacionales)`{.interpreted-text
  role="abbr"} to the company.
- `Resolution Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Initial
  effective date of the resolution.
- `Resolution end date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: End date of
  the resolution\'s validity.
- `Range of Numbering (minimum)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
  First authorized invoice number.
- `Range of Numbering (maximum)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
  Last authorized invoice number.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The sequence and resolution of the journal **must** match the one
configured in Carvajal and the
`DIAN (DirecciÃ³n de Impuestos y Aduanas Nacionales)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}.
::::

##### Invoice sequence

The invoice sequence and prefix **must** be correctly configured when
the first document is created.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Odoo automatically assigns a prefix and sequence to the following
invoices.
::::

##### Purchase journals

Once the
`DIAN (DirecciÃ³n de Impuestos y Aduanas Nacionales)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} has assigned the official sequence and prefix for the
*support document* related to vendor bills, the purchase journals
related to their supporting documents need to be updated in Odoo. The
process is similar to the configuration of the
`sales journals <co-journals>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}.

##### Chart of accounts

The
`chart of accounts </applications/finance/accounting/get_started/chart_of_accounts>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} is installed by default as part of the localization module,
the accounts are mapped automatically in taxes, default account payable,
and default account receivable. The chart of accounts for Colombia is
based on the PUC (Plan Unico de Cuentas).

## Main workflows {#colombia/workflows}

### Electronic invoices

The following is a breakdown of the main workflow for electronic
invoices with the Colombian localization:

1.  Sender creates an invoice.
2.  Electronic invoice provider generates the legal XML file.
3.  Electronic invoice provider creates the CUFE (Invoice Electronic
    Code) with the electronic signature.
4.  Electronic invoice provider sends a notification to
    `DIAN (DirecciÃ³n de Impuestos y Aduanas Nacionales)`{.interpreted-text
    role="abbr"}.
5.  `DIAN (DirecciÃ³n de Impuestos y Aduanas Nacionales)`{.interpreted-text
    role="abbr"} validates the invoice.
6.  `DIAN (DirecciÃ³n de Impuestos y Aduanas Nacionales)`{.interpreted-text
    role="abbr"} accepts or rejects the invoice.
7.  Electronic invoice provider generates the PDF invoice with a QR
    code.
8.  Electronic invoice provider sends invoice to the acquirer.
9.  Acquirer sends a receipt of acknowledgement, and accepts or rejects
    the invoice.
10. Sender downloads a `.zip`{.interpreted-text role="file"} file with
    the PDF and XML.

![Electronic invoice workflow for Colombian localization.](colombia/workflow-electronic-invoice.png){.align-center}

#### Invoice creation {#colombia/invoice-creation}

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The functional workflow taking place before an invoice validation does
**not** alter the main changes introduced with the electronic invoice.
::::

Electronic invoices are generated and sent to both the
`DIAN (DirecciÃ³n de Impuestos y Aduanas Nacionales)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} and customer through Carvajal\'s web service integration.
These documents can be created from your sales order or manually
generated. To create a new invoice, go to
`Accounting --> Customers --> Invoices`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, and select `Create`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}. On the invoice form configure the following fields:

- `Customer`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Customer\'s
  information.
- `Journal`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Journal used for
  electronic invoices.
- `Electronic Invoice Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select
  the type of document. By default, `Factura
  de Venta`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is selected.
- `Invoice Lines`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Specify the
  products with the correct taxes.

When done, click `Confirm`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

#### Invoice validation {#colombia/invoice-validation}

After the invoice confirmation, an XML file is created and sent
automatically to Carvajal. The invoice is then processed asynchronously
by the E-invoicing service UBL 2.1 (Colombia). The file is also
displayed in the chatter.

![Carvajal XML invoice file in Odoo chatter.](colombia/invoice-sent.png){.align-center}

The `Electronic Invoice Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field
is now displayed in the `EDI Documents`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} tab, with the name of the XML file. Additionally, the
`Electronic Invoice Status`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field is
displayed with the initial value `To Send`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}. To process the invoice manually, click on the
`Process Now`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button.

#### Reception of legal XML and PDF {#colombia/invoice-xml}

The electronic invoice vendor (Carvajal) receives the XML file, and
proceeds to validate its structure and information.

After validating the electronic invoice, proceed to generate a legal XML
which includes a digital signature and a unique code (CUFE), a PDF
invoice that includes a QR code and the CUFE is also generated. If
everything is correct the `Electronic Invoicing`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} field value changes to `Sent`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}.

A `.zip`{.interpreted-text role="file"} containing the legal electronic
invoice (in XML format) and the invoice in (PDF format) is downloaded
and displayed in the invoice chatter:

![ZIP file displayed in the invoice chatter in Odoo.](colombia/invoice-zip.png){.align-center}

The electronic invoice status changes to `Accepted`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}.

### Credit notes

The process for credit notes is the same as for invoices. To create a
credit note with reference to an invoice, go to
`Accounting --> Customers --> Invoices`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. On the invoice, click
`Add Credit Note`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and complete the
following information:

- `Credit Method`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select the type of
  credit method.
  - `Partial Refund`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Use this option
    when it is a partial amount.
  - `Full Refund`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Use this option if
    the credit note is for the full amount.
  - `Full refund and new draft invoice`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}: Use this option if the credit note is
    auto-validated and reconciled with the invoice. The original invoice
    is duplicated as a new draft.
- `Reason`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter the reason for the
  credit note.
- `Reversal Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select if you want
  a specific date for the credit note or if it is the journal entry
  date.
- `Use Specific Journal`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select the
  journal for your credit note or leave it empty if you want to use the
  same journal as the original invoice.
- `Refund Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: If you chose a
  specific date, select the date for the refund.

Once reviewed, click the `Reverse`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
button.

### Debit notes

The process for debit notes is similar to credit notes. To create a
debit note with reference to an invoice, go to
`Accounting --> Customers --> Invoices`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. On the invoice, click the
`Add Debit Note`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button, and enter
the following information:

- `Reason`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Type the reason for the
  debit note.
- `Debit note date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select the
  specific options.
- `Copy lines`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select this option if
  you need to register a debit note with the same lines of invoice.
- `Use Specific Journal`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select the
  printer point for your debit note, or leave it empty if you want to
  use the same journal as the original invoice.

When done, click `Create Debit Note`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

### Support document for vendor bills

With master data, credentials, and the purchase journal configured for
support documents related to vendor bills, you can start using *support
documents*.

Support documents for vendor bills can be created from your purchase
order or manually. Go to
`Accounting --> Vendors --> Bills`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} and fill in the following data:

- `Vendor`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter the vendor\'s
  information.
- `Bill Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select the date of the
  bill.
- `Journal`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select the journal for
  support documents related to the vendor bills.
- `Invoiced Lines`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Specify the
  products with the correct taxes.

Once reviewed, click the `Confirm`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
button. Upon confirmation, an XML file is created and automatically sent
to Carvajal.

### Common errors {#colombia/common-errors}

During the XML validation, the most common errors are related to missing
master data (*Contact Tax ID*, *Address*, *Products*, *Taxes*). In such
cases, error messages are shown in the chatter after updating the
electronic invoice status.

After the master data is corrected, it\'s possible to reprocess the XML
with the new data and send the updated version, using the
`Retry`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button.

![XML validation errors shown in the invoice chatter in Odoo.](colombia/xml-validation-error.png)

## Financial reports {#colombia/reports}

### Certificado de RetenciÃ³n en ICA

This report is a certification to vendors for withholdings made for the
Colombian Industry and Commerce (ICA) tax. The report can be found under
`Accounting --> Reporting -->
Colombian Statements --> Certificado de RetenciÃ³n en ICA`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}.

![Certificado de RetenciÃ³n en ICA report in Odoo Accounting.](colombia/ica-report.png){.align-center}

### Certificado de RetenciÃ³n en IVA

This report issues a certificate on the amount withheld from vendors for
VAT withholding. The report can be found under
`Accounting --> Reporting --> Colombian Statements --> Certificado
de RetenciÃ³n en IVA`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}.

![Certificado de RetenciÃ³n en IVA report in Odoo Accounting.](colombia/iva-report.png){.align-center}

### Certificado de RetenciÃ³n en la Fuente

This certificate is issued to partners for the withholding tax that they
have made. The report can be found under
`Accounting --> Reporting --> Colombian Statements --> Certificado de
RetenciÃ³n en Fuente`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}.

![Certificado de RetenciÃ³n en Fuente report in Odoo Accounting.](colombia/fuente-report.png){.align-center}
