# Ecuador

## Introduction

With the Ecuadorian localization you can generate electronic documents
with its XML, Fiscal folio, with electronic signature and direct
connection to tax authority SRI.

The supported documents are Invoices, Credit Notes, Debit Notes,
Purchase Liquidations and Withholds.

The localization also Includes automations to easily predict the
withholding tax to be applied to each purchase invoice.

::: seealso
\- [App Tour - LocalizaciÃ³n de
Ecuador](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BQOXVSDeeK8) - [Smart
Tutorial - LocalizaciÃ³n de
Ecuador](https://www.odoo.com/slides/smart-tutorial-localizacion-de-ecuador-170)
:::

### Glossary

Here are some terms that are essential on the Ecuadorian localization:

- **SRI**: meaning *Servicio de Rentas Internas*, the government
  organization that enforces pay of taxes in Ecuador.
- **EDI**: stands for *Electronic Data Interchange*, which refers to the
  sending of Electronics Documents.
- **RIMPE**: stands for *Regimen Simplificado para Emprendedores y
  Negocios*, the type of taxpayer qualified for SRI.

## Configuration

### Modules installation

`Install <general/install>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} the following
modules to get all the features of the Ecuadorian localization:

  -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  Name                                            Technical name              Description
  ----------------------------------------------- --------------------------- ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  `Ecuadorian - Accounting`{.interpreted-text     [l10n_ec]{.title-ref}       The default
  role="guilabel"}                                                            `fiscal localization package <../fiscal_localizations>`{.interpreted-text
                                                                              role="doc"}, adds accounting characteristics for the Ecuadorian
                                                                              localization, which represent the minimum configuration required for a
                                                                              company to operate in Ecuador according to the guidelines set by the
                                                                              `SRI (servicio de rentas internas)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}. The
                                                                              module\'s installation automatically loads: Chart of Accounts, taxes,
                                                                              documents types, tax support types. Additionally, the generation of forms
                                                                              103 and 104 are automatic.

  `Ecuadorian Accounting EDI`{.interpreted-text   [l10n_ec_edi]{.title-ref}   Includes all the technical and functional requirements to generate and
  role="guilabel"}                                                            validate `Electronics Documents
                                                                              <../accounting/customer_invoices/electronic_invoicing>`{.interpreted-text
                                                                              role="doc"}, based on the Technical documentation published by the SRI. The
                                                                              authorized documents are: Invoices, Credit Notes, Debit Notes, Withholdings
                                                                              and Purchase liquidations.
  -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

When you install a database from scratch selecting [Ecuador]{.title-ref}
as the country, Odoo automatically installs the base module
`Ecuadorian - Accounting`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
::::

### Configure your company {#l10n_ec/configure-your-company}

To configure your company information, go to the
`Contacts`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} app and search the name
given to your company or activate
`developer mode <developer-mode>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} and go
to `Company
--> Contact`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"} and then edit the
contact to configure the following information:

1.  Check the `Company`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} option on top
    - `Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
    - `Address`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
    - `Identification Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
    - `Taxpayer Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
    - `Phone`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
    - `Email`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
2.  Upload company logo and save

![Populate company data for Ecuador in Odoo Contacts.](ecuador/ecuador-company.png){.align-center}

### Electronic documents

To upload your information for electronic documents go to
`Accounting -->
Configuration --> Settings`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"} and
search for `Ecuadorian Localization`{.interpreted-text role="command"}.

Configure the next information:

- `Company legal name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Use production servers`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: check the
  checkbox if your company is going to do electronic documents in the
  production environment. If you want to use the testing environment for
  electronic documents then keep the checkbox unchecked.
- `Regime`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: select if your company is
  in General Regular or is qualified as RIMPE.
- `Forced to keep accounting books`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
  check the checkbox if your company has this condition.
- `Default taxes for withholdings`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Issue withholds`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: check the
  checkbox if your company is going to do electronic withholds.
- `Withhold consumibles`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: put the
  code of the withholding for when you buy goods.
- `Withhold services`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: put the code
  of the withholding for when you buy services.
- `Withhold credit card`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: put the
  code of the withholding for when you buy with credit card
- `Withhold agent number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: put the
  company withholding agent resolution number, if applicable for your
  company.
- `Electronic Certificate File`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
  upload electronic certificate and password, then save it.
- `Special tax contributor number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
  if your company is qualified as a special taxpayer, fill out this
  field with it\'s corresponding tax contributor number.

![Electronic signature for Ecuador.](ecuador/electronic-signature.png){.align-center}

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

When configuring the withholdings in the configuration menu, these
suggested withholdings are only for domestic suppliers when no
withholdings are setup on their *Taxpayer Type*. Moreover, the Credit
Card withholding set up is always used when a Credit or Debit Card SRI
Payment Metho is used.
::::

### VAT withholding

This configuration only applies if you are qualified as a *Withholding
Agent* by the SRI, otherwise skip this step. To configure your VAT
withholding, go to `Accounting --> Accounting
--> Configuration --> Ecuadorian SRI: Taxpayer Type SRI`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}.

You must configure the withholding percentage that applies for each type
of taxpayer, specify the `Goods VAT Withholding`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} and the `Services VAT Withholding`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}.

![Taxpayer Type configuration for Ecuador.](ecuador/contributor-type.png){.align-center}

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

In the case that the `Taxpayer Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
is [RIMPE]{.title-ref}, also configure the `Profit
Withholding`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} percentage.
::::

### Printer points

To configure your printer points, go to
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Accounting:
Journals`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}.

Printer points need to be configured for each type of electronic
document that you need. For example: Customer Invoice, Credit Notes, and
Debit Notes

For each printer point, you need to configure the following information:

- `Journal Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: in this format
  [\[Emission Entity\]-\[Emission Point\] \[Document
  Type\]]{.title-ref}, for example: [001-001 Sales
  Documents]{.title-ref}.
- `Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: refers to the type of
  journal, select [Sales]{.title-ref}.
- `Use Documents?`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: this checkbox is
  automatically checked, leave it checked.
- `Emission Entity`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: configure the
  establishment number.
- `Emission Point`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: configure the
  printer point.
- `Emission address`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: configure the
  address of the establishment.
- `Default income account`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: configure
  the default income account.
- `Dedicated Credit Note Sequence`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
  check the checkbox if *Credit Notes* are to be generated from this
  printer point - journal.
- `Short Code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: This is the unique
  code for the sequence of accounting entries, enter a unique 5-digit
  code, for example: [VT001]{.title-ref}

Customer Invoice, Credit Notes and Debit Notes need to use the same
journal as the `Emission Point`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
the `Entity Point`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} should be unique
per journal.

![Configuring a printer point for Ecuador electronic document type of Customer Invoices.](ecuador/printer-point.png){.align-center}

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

In the `Advanced Settings`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab, check
the `Electronic Invoicing`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} checkbox
to enable it for Ecuador.
::::

::: seealso
`../accounting/customer_invoices/electronic_invoicing`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}
:::

### Withholding

A Withholding Journal must be defined, go to go to
`Accounting --> Configuration -->
Accounting:  Journals`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"} where you
need to configure the following information:

- `Journal Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: in this format
  [\[Emission Entity\]-\[Emission Point\] \[Document
  Type\]]{.title-ref}, for example: [001-001 Withholding]{.title-ref}.
- `Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: refers to the type of
  journal, select [Miscellaneous]{.title-ref}.
- `Withhold Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Configure Purchase
  Withholding.
- `Use Documents?`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: this checkbox is
  automatically checked, leave it checked.
- `Emission Entity`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: configure the
  establishment number.
- `Emission Point`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: configure the
  printer point.
- `Emission address`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: configure the
  address of the establishment.
- `Default account`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: configure the
  default income account.
- `Short Code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: This is the unique
  code for the sequence of accounting entries, enter a unique 5-digit
  code, for example: [RT001]{.title-ref}

![Configuring withholding for Ecuador electronic document type of Withholding.](ecuador/withhold.png){.align-center}

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

In the `Advanced Settings`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab, check
the `Electronic Invoicing`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} checkbox
to enable the sending of electronic invoicing for the withholding.
::::

### Purchase Liquidations

When using Purchase Liquidations, a specific journal must be created, go
to
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Accounting:  Journals`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} and configure the following information:

- `Journal Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: in this format
  [\[Emission Entity\]-\[Emission Point\] \[Document
  Type\]]{.title-ref}, for example: [001-001 Withhold]{.title-ref}.
- `Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: refers to the type of
  journal, select [Miscellaneous]{.title-ref}.
- `Purchase Liquidations`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: check the
  checkbox to enable purchase liquidations.
- `Use Documents?`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: this checkbox is
  automatically checked, leave it checked.
- `Emission Entity`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: configure the
  establishment number.
- `Emission Point`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: configure the
  printer point.
- `Emission address`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: configure the
  address of the establishment.
- `Short Code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: This is the unique
  code for the sequence of accounting entries, enter a unique 5-digit
  code, for example: [RT001]{.title-ref}

![Configuring purchase liquidations for Ecuador electronic document type of Withholding.](ecuador/purchase-liqudations.png){.align-center}

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

In the `Advanced Settings`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab, check
the `Electronic Invoicing`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} checkbox
to enable the sending of electronic invoicing for the withholding.
::::

### Configure master data

#### Chart of accounts

The
`chart of accounts <../accounting/get_started/chart_of_accounts>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} is installed by default as part of the set of data included
in the localization module, the accounts are mapped automatically in
Taxes, Default Account Payable, Default Account Receivable.

The chart of accounts for Ecuador is based on the most updated version
of Superintendency of Companies, which is grouped in several categories
and is compatible with NIIF accounting.

You can add or delete accounts according to the company\'s needs.

#### Products

In addition to the basic information in your products, you must add the
configuration of the withholding code (tax) that applies.

Go to `Accounting --> Vendors:  Products`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} under the tab \"Purchase\"

![Product for Ecuador.](ecuador/products.png){.align-center}

#### Contacts

Configure the next information when you create a contact:

- Check the `Company`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} option on top
  if it is a contact with RUC, or check `Individual`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} if it is a contact with cedula or passport.
- `Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Address`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
  `Street`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is a required field to
  confirm the Electronic Invoice.
- `Identification Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: select an
  identification type [RUC]{.title-ref}, [Cedula]{.title-ref}, or
  [Passport]{.title-ref}.
- `Taxpayer Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: select the
  contact\'s SRI Taxpayer Type.
- `Phone`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Email`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}

![Contacts for Ecuador.](ecuador/contacts.png){.align-center}

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The `SRI Taxpayer Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} has inside
the configuration of which VAT and Profit withholding will apply when
you use this contact on Vendor Bill, and then create a withholding from
there.
::::

#### Review your taxes

As part of the localization module, taxes are automatically created with
its configuration and related financial accounts.

![Taxes for Ecuador.](ecuador/taxes.png){.align-center}

The following options have been automatically configured:

- `Tax Support`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: to be configured
  only in the IVA tax, this option is useful when you register purchase
  withholdings.
- `Code ATS`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: to be configured only
  for income tax withholding codes, it is important when you register
  the withholding.
- `Tax Grids`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: configure the codes of
  104 form if it is a IVA tax and configure the codes of 103 form if it
  is a income tax withholding code.
- `Tax Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
  - For IVA tax, format the name as: [IVA \[percent\] (104, \[form
    code\] \[tax support code\] \[tax support short name\])]{.title-ref}
  - For income tax withholding code, format the name as: [Code ATS
    \[Percent of withhold\] \[withhold name\]]{.title-ref}

Once the Ecuador module is installed, the most common taxes are
automatically configured. If you need to create an additional one, you
can do so, for which you must base yourself on the configuration of the
existing taxes.

![Taxes with tax support for Ecuador.](ecuador/taxes-with-tax-support.png){.align-center}

#### Review your Document Types

Some accounting transactions like *Customer Invoices* and *Vendor Bills*
are classified by document types. These are defined by the government
fiscal authorities, in this case by the SRI.

Each document type can have a unique sequence per journal where it is
assigned. As part of the localization, the document type includes the
country on which the document is applicable; also the data is created
automatically when the localization module is installed.

The information required for the document types is included by default
so the user does not need to fill anything there.

![Document types for Ecuador.](ecuador/document-types.png){.align-center}

## Workflows

Once you have configured your database, you can register your documents.

### Sales documents

#### Customer invoices

`Customer invoices`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} are electronic
documents that, when validated, are sent to SRI. These documents can be
created from your sales order or manually. They must contain the
following data:

- `Customer`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: type the customer\'s
  information.
- `Journal`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: select the option that
  matches the printer point for the customer invoice.
- `Document Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: type document type
  in this format [(01) Invoice]{.title-ref}.
- `Payment Method (SRI)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: select how
  the invoice is going to be paid.
- `Products`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: specify the product
  with the correct taxes.

![Customer invoice for Ecuador.](ecuador/customer-invoice.png){.align-center}

#### Customer credit note

The
`Customer credit note <../accounting/customer_invoices/credit_notes>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} is an electronic document that, when validated, is sent to
SRI. It is necessary to have a validated (posted) invoice in order to
register a credit note. On the invoice there is a button named
`Credit note`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, click on this button
to be directed to the `Create credit note`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} form, then complete the following information:

- `Credit Method`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: select the type of
  credit method.
  - `Partial Refund`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: use this option
    when you need to type the first number of documents and if it is a
    partial credit note.
  - `Full Refund`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: use this option if
    the credit note is for the total invoice and you need the credit
    note to be auto-validated and reconciled with the invoice.
  - `Full refund and new draft invoice`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}: use this option if the credit note is for the
    total invoice and you need the credit note to be auto-validated and
    reconciled with the invoice, and auto-create a new draft invoice.
- `Reason`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: type the reason for the
  credit note.
- `Rollback Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: select the
  `specific`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} options.
- `Reversal Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: type the date.
- `Use Specific Journal`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: select the
  printer point for your credit note, or leave it empty if you want to
  use the same journal as the original invoice.

Once reviewed, you can click on the `Reverse`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} button.

![Add Customer Credit Note for Ecuador.](ecuador/add-customer-credit-note.png){.align-center}

When the `Partial Refund`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} option is
used, you can change the amount of the credit note and then validate it.
Before validating the credit note, review the following information:

- `Customer`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: type the customer\'s
  information.
- `Journal`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: select the printer point
  for the customer Credit Note.
- `Document Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: this is the
  document type [(04) Credit Note]{.title-ref}.
- `Products`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: It must specify the
  product with the correct taxes.

![Customer Credit Note for Ecuador.](ecuador/customer-credit-note.png){.align-center}

#### Customer debit note

The `Customer debit note`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is an
electronic document that, when validated, is sent to SRI. It is
necessary to have a validated (posted) invoice in order to register a
debit note. On the invoice there is a button named
`Debit Note`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, click on this button to
be directed to the `Create debit note`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} form, then complete the following information:

- `Reason`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: type the reason for the
  debit note.
- `Debit note date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: select the
  `specific`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} options.
- `Copy lines`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: select this option if
  you need to register a debit note with the same lines of invoice.
- `Use Specific Journal`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: select the
  printer point for your credit note, or leave it empty if you want to
  use the same journal as the original invoice.

Once reviewed you can click on the `Create Debit Note`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} button.

![Add Customer Debit Note for Ecuador.](ecuador/add-customer-debit-note.png){.align-center}

You can change the debit note amount, and then validate it. Before
validating the debit note, review the following information:

- `Customer`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: type the customer\'s
  information.
- `Journal`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: select the printer point
  for the customer Credit Note.
- `Document Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: this is the
  document type [(05) Debit Note]{.title-ref}.
- `Products`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: It must specify the
  product with the correct taxes.

![Customer Debit Note for Ecuador.](ecuador/customer-debit-note.png){.align-center}

#### Customer withholding

The `Customer withholding`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is a
non-electronic document for your company, this document is issued by the
client in order to apply a withholding to the sale.

It is necessary to have a validated (posted) invoice in order to
register a customer withholding. On the invoice there is a button named
`Add Withhold`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, click on this button
to be directed to the `Customer withholding`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} form, then complete the following information:

- `Document Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: type the
  withholding number.
- `Withhold Lines`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: select the taxes
  that the customer is withholding.

Before validating the withholding, review that the amounts for each tax
are the same as the original document.

![Customer withhold for Ecuador.](ecuador/customer-withhold.png){.align-center}

### Purchase Documents

#### Vendor bill

The `Vendor bill`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is a non-electronic
document for your company, this document is issued by your vendor when
your company generates a purchase.

The bills can be created from the purchase order or manually, it must
contain the following information:

- `Vendor`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: type the vendor\'s
  information.
- `Bill Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: select the date of
  invoice.
- `Journal`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: it is the journal for
  vendor bills.
- `Document Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: this is the
  document type [(01) Invoice]{.title-ref}
- `Document number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: type the
  document number.
- `Payment Method (SRI)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: select how
  the invoice is going to be paid.
- `Products`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: specify the product
  with the correct taxes.

![Purchases for Ecuador.](ecuador/purchase-invoice.png){.align-center}

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

When creating the purchase withholding, verify that the bases (base
amounts) are correct. If you need to edit the amount of the tax in the
`Vendor bill`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, click the
`Edit`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button. Otherwise, from the
`Journal Items`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab click the
`Edit`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button and set the adjustment
to go where you want.
::::

#### Purchase liquidation

The `Purchase liquidation`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is an
electronic document that, when validated, is sent to SRI.

Companies issue this type of electronic document when they purchase, and
the vendor does not issue an invoice due to one or more of the following
cases:

- Services were provided by non-residents of Ecuador.
- Services provided by foreign companies without residency or
  establishment in Ecuador.
- Purchase of goods or services from natural persons not registered with
  a RUC, who due to their cultural level or hardiness are not able to
  issue sales receipts or customer invoices.
- Reimbursement for the purchase of goods or services to employees in a
  dependency relationship (full-time employee).
- Services provided by members of collegiate bodies for the exercise of
  their function.

These types of electronic documents can be created from the
`Purchase Order`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or manually from the
`Vendor Bills`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} form view. It must
contain the following data:

- `Vendor`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: type the vendor\'s
  information.
- `Journal`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: select the journal for
  the `Purchase Liquidation`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} with the
  correct printer point.
- `Document Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: this is the
  document type [(03) Purchase Liquidation]{.title-ref}
- `Document number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: type the
  document number (sequence), you will only have to do this once, then
  the sequence will be automatically assigned for the next documents.
- `Payment Method (SRI)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: select how
  the invoice is going to be paid.
- `Products`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: specify the product
  with the correct taxes.

Once you review the information you can validate the
`Purchase Liquidation`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

![Purchase liquidation for Ecuador.](ecuador/purchase-liquidation.png){.align-center}

#### Purchase withholding

The `Purchase withholding`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is an
electronic document that, when validated, is sent to SRI.

It is necessary to have an invoice in a validated state in order to
register a `Purchase
withholding`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. On the invoice, there
is a button named `Add Withhold`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
click on this button to be directed to the
`Withholding`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} form, then complete the
following information:

- `Document number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: type the
  document number (sequence), you will only have to do this once, then
  the sequence will be automatically assigned for the next documents.
- `Withhold lines`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: The taxes appear
  automatically according to the configuration of products and vendors,
  you should review if the taxes and tax support are correct, and, if it
  is not correct, you can edit and select the correct taxes and tax
  support.

Once you review the information you can validate the
`Withholding`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

![Purchase withhold for Ecuador.](ecuador/purchase-withhold.png){.align-center}

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

You can\'t change the tax support for one that was not included in the
configuration of the taxes used on the `Vendor Bill`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}. To do so, go to the tax applied on the `Vendor
Bill`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and change the
`Tax Support`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} there.
::::

A withholding tax can be divided into two or more lines, this will
depend on whether two or more withholdings percentages apply.

::: example
The system suggests a VAT withholding of 30% with tax support 01, you
can add your VAT withholding of 70% in a new line with the same tax
support, the system will allow you as long as the total of the bases
matches the total from the `Vendor Bill`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}.
:::

## Financial Reports

In Ecuador, there are fiscal reports that the company presents to SRI.
In Odoo, we have two of the main financial reports used by companies.
These are the reports 103 and 104.

To get these reports go to the `Accounting`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} app and select `Reporting -->
Statements Reports --> Tax Report`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} and then filter by [Tax Report 103]{.title-ref} or
[Tax Report 104]{.title-ref}.

### Report 103

This report contains information of income tax withholdings in a given
period, this can be reported monthly or semi-annually.

You can see the information needed to report, which includes base and
tax amounts, which also includes the tax code within the parenthesis in
order to report it to the SRI.

![Report 103 form for Ecuador.](ecuador/103-form.png){.align-center}

### Report 104

This report contains information on VAT tax and VAT withholding for a
given period, this can be monthly or semi-annually.

You can see the information needed to report, which includes base and
tax amounts, which also includes the tax code within the parenthesis in
order to report it to the SRI.

![Report 104 form for Ecuador.](ecuador/104-form.png){.align-center}

### ATS report

`Install <general/install>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} the *ATS
Report* ([l10n_ec_reports_ats]{.title-ref}) module to enable downloading
the ATS report in XML format.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The Ecuadorian *ATS Report* module is dependent on the previous
installation of the *Accounting* app and the *Ecuadorian EDI module*.
::::

#### Configuration

To issue electronic documents, ensure your company is configured as
explained in the
`electronic invoice <l10n_ec/configure-your-company>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} section.

In the `ATS (Anexo Transaccional Simplificado)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}, every document generated in Odoo (invoices, vendor bills,
sales and purchases withholdings, credit notes, and debit notes) will be
included.

##### Vendor bills

When generating a vendor bill, it is necessary to register the
authorization number from the invoice that the vendor generated for the
purchase. To do so, go to `Accounting
--> Vendors --> Bills`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"} and
select the bill. Then, enter the number from the vendor\'s invoice in
the `Authorization Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field.

##### Credit and debit notes

When generating a credit note or debit note manually or through
importation, it is necessary to link this note to the sales invoice that
is being modified by it.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Remember to add all required information to the documents before
downloading the `ATS
(Anexo Transaccional Simplificado)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} file.
For example, add the *Authorization Number* and the *SRI Payment Method*
on documents, when needed.
::::

#### XML generation

To generate the
`ATS (Anexo Transaccional Simplificado)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
report, go to `Accounting --> Reports --> Tax Report`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} and choose a time period for the desired
`ATS (Anexo Transaccional Simplificado)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
report, then click `ATS`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

The downloaded XML file is ready to be uploaded to *DIMM Formularios*.

![ATS report download for Ecuador in Odoo Accounting.](ecuador/ats-report.png){.align-center}

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

When downloading the
`ATS (Anexo Transaccional Simplificado)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
report, Odoo generates a warning pop-up alerting the user if a
document(s) has missing or incorrect data. Nevertheless, the user can
still download the XML file.
::::




--- SOURCE: finance/fiscal_localizations/egypt.md ---

# Egypt

## Installation {#egypt/installation}

`Install <general/install>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} the following
modules to get all the features of the Egyptian localization:

  Name                                                                  Technical name      Description
  --------------------------------------------------------------------- ------------------- ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  `Egypt - Accounting`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}               `l10n_eg`           Default `fiscal localization package <fiscal_localizations/packages>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
  `Egyptian E-invoice Integration`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}   `l10n_eg_edi_eta`   `Egyptian Tax Authority (ETA) e-invoicing integration <egypt/e-invoicing>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}

## Egyptian e-invoicing {#egypt/e-invoicing}

Odoo is compliant with the **Egyptian Tax Authority (ETA) e-invoicing**
requirements.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

Egyptian e-invoicing is available from Odoo 15.0. If needed, `upgrade
</administration/upgrade>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} your database.
::::

::: seealso
\- [Video: Egypt
E-invoicing](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NXuBPLR4pVw) -
`/administration/upgrade`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
:::

### Register Odoo on your ETA portal {#egypt/e-invoicing-eta-portal}

You must register your Odoo ERP system on your ETA portal to get your
API credentials. You need these codes to
`configure your Odoo Accounting app <egypt/e-invoicing-configuration>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}.

Access your company profile on the ETA portal by clicking on
`View Taxpayer Profile`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

![Clicking on \"View Taxpayer Profile\" on an ETA invoicing portal](egypt/taxpayer-profile.png){.align-center}

Next, go to the `Representatives`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
section and then click on `Register ERP`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}. Fill out the `ERP Name`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} (e.g., `Odoo`) and leave the other fields empty.

![Filling out of the form to register an ERP system on the ETA portal.](egypt/add-erp-system.png){.align-center}

Once successfully registered, the website displays your API credentials:

- Client ID
- Client Secret 1
- Client Secret 2

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

\- ETA should give you a username and a password to access their online
portal. - Ask ETA to provide you with preproduction portal access as
well. - These codes are confidential and should be stored safely.
::::

### Configuration on Odoo {#egypt/e-invoicing-configuration}

To connect your Odoo database to your ETA portal account, go to
`Accounting -->
Configuration --> Settings --> ETA E-Invoicing Settings`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, and set the `ETA Client ID`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} and `ETA Secret`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
that you retrieved when you `registered Odoo on your ETA portal
<egypt/e-invoicing-eta-portal>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}. Set an
invoicing threshold if needed.

![Configuration of the ETA E-Invoicing credentials in Odoo Accounting](egypt/eta-api-integration.png){.align-center}

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

\- **Test on your preproduction portal** before starting to issue real
invoices on the production ETA portal. - **Credentials** for
preproduction and production environments are different. Make sure to
update them on Odoo when you move from one environment to another. - If
not done yet, fill out your company details with your company\'s full
address, country, and Tax ID.
::::

#### ETA codes {#egypt/e-invoicing-eta-codes}

E-invoicing works with a set of codes provided by the ETA. You can use
the [ETA documentation](https://sdk.preprod.invoicing.eta.gov.eg/codes/)
to code your business attributes.

Most of these codes are handled automatically by Odoo, provided that
your `branches
<egypt/e-invoicing-branches>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"},
`customers <egypt/e-invoicing-customers>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"},
and `products
<egypt/e-invoicing-products>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} are
correctly configured.

- Company Information:
  - Company Tax ID

  - | Branch ID
    | If you have only one branch, use `0` as the branch code.

  - Activity type Code
- Other Information:
  - | Product Codes
    | Your company\'s products should be coded and matched with their
      **GS1** or **EGS** codes.

  - | Tax Codes
    | Most of the taxes codes are already configured on Odoo in the
      `ETA Code (Egypt)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field. We
      advise you to make sure these codes match your company\'s taxes.

::: seealso
\- [Egyptian eInvoicing & eReceipt SDK - Code
Tables](https://sdk.preprod.invoicing.eta.gov.eg/codes/) -
`../accounting/taxes`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
:::

#### Branches {#egypt/e-invoicing-branches}

Create a contact and a journal for each branch of your company and
configure its ETA settings.

To do so, go to
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Journals`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, then click on `Create`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}.

Name the journal according to your company\'s branch and set the
`Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} as `Sales`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}. Next, open the `Advanced Settings`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} tab and fill out the
`Egyptian ETA settings`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section:

- In the `Branch`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field, select the
  branch\'s contact or create it.
- Set the `ETA Activity Code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
- Set the `ETA Branch ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} (use `0` if
  you have one branch only).

![Sales journal configuration of an Egyptian company\'s branch](egypt/branch-journal.png){.align-center}

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

The contact selected in the `Branch`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
field must be set as a `Company`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
(**not** as an `Individual`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}), and the
`Address`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`Tax ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} fields must be filled out.
::::

#### Customers {#egypt/e-invoicing-customers}

Make sure your customers\' contact forms are correctly filled out so
your e-invoices are valid:

- contact type: `Individual`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: or
  `Company`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
- `Country`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
- `Tax ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Tax ID or Company
  registry for companies. National ID for individuals.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

You can edit your customers\' contact forms by going to
`Accounting --> Customers
--> Customers`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}.
::::

#### Products {#egypt/e-invoicing-products}

Make sure your products are correctly configured so your e-invoices are
valid:

- `Product Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: storable products,
  consumables, or services.
- `Unit of Measure`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: if you also use
  Odoo Inventory and have enabled `Units of
  Measure <../../inventory_and_mrp/inventory/product_management/configure/uom>`{.interpreted-text
  role="doc"}.
- `Barcode`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: **GS1** or **EGS**
  barcode
- `ETA Item code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} (under the
  `Accounting`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"} tab): if the
  barcode doesn\'t match your ETA item code.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

You can edit your products by going to
`Accounting --> Customers --> Products`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}.
::::

### USB authentication {#egypt/e-invoicing-usb-authentication}

Each person who needs to electronically sign invoices needs a specific
USB key to authenticate and send invoices to the ETA portal through an
ERP.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

You can contact the `ETA (Egyptian Tax Authority)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} or [Egypt Trust](https://www.egypttrust.com/) to get these
USB keys.
::::

#### Install Odoo as a local proxy on your computer {#egypt/e-invoicing-local-proxy}

An Odoo local server works as a bridge between your computer and your
Odoo database hosted online.

Download the Odoo Community installer from the page
<https://www.odoo.com/page/download> and start the installation on your
computer.

Select `Odoo IoT`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} as the type of
install.

![Selection of \"Odoo IoT\" during the installation of Odoo Community.](egypt/install-odoo-local-proxy.png){.align-center}

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

This installation of Odoo only works as a server and does not install
any Odoo apps on your computer.
::::

Once the installation is complete, the installer displays your **access
token** for the Odoo Local Proxy. Copy the token and save it in a safe
place for later use.

::: seealso
\- [Odoo: Download Odoo](https://www.odoo.com/page/download) -
`../../../administration/on_premise`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
:::

#### Configure the USB key {#egypt/e-invoicing-usb-configuration}

Once the local proxy server is installed on your computer, you can link
it with your Odoo database.

1.  Go to
    `Accounting --> Configurations --> Thumb Drive`{.interpreted-text
    role="menuselection"} and click on `Create`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}.
2.  Input a `Company`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} name, the
    `ETA USB Pin`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} given to you by
    your USB key provider, and the `Access Token`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} provided at the end of the `local proxy
    installation <egypt/e-invoicing-local-proxy>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"}, then click on `Save`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}.
3.  Click on `Get certificate`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

![Creating a new thumb drive for the e-invoicing of an egyptian company.](egypt/thumb-drive.png){.align-center}




--- SOURCE: finance/fiscal_localizations/france.md ---

# France

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

You must `install <../../general/apps_modules>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} the **France - Adding Mandatory Invoice Mentions (Decree no.
2022-1299)** ([l10n_fr_invoice_addr]{.title-ref}) module to comply with
the [local
legislation](https://www.legifrance.gouv.fr/jorf/id/JORFTEXT000046383394).
::::

## FEC - Fichier des Ã‰critures Comptables {#france/fec}

An FEC `Fichier des Ã‰critures Comptables`{.interpreted-text role="dfn"}
audit file contains all the accounting data and entries recorded in all
the accounting journals for a financial year. The entries in the file
must be arranged in chronological order.

Since January 1st, 2014, every French company is required to produce and
transmit this file upon request by the tax authorities for audit
purposes.

### FEC Import

To make the onboarding of new users easier, Odoo Enterprise\'s French
`fiscal localization
package <fiscal_localizations/packages>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
includes the **FEC Import** feature (module name: `l10n_fr_fec_import`),
which enables the import of existing FEC files from older software.

To enable this feature, go to
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Settings -->
Accounting Import`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}, enable **FEC
Import**, and *Save*.

Next, go to
`Accounting --> Configuration --> FEC Import`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, upload your FEC file, and click on *Import*.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

| Importing FEC files from different year takes no particular action or
  computation.
| Should multiple files contain any \"Reports Ã  Nouveaux\" (RAN) with
  the starting balance of the year, you might need to cancel those
  entries in the User Interface. Odoo makes those entries (RAN) useless.
::::

#### File formats

FEC files can only be in CSV format, as the XML format is not supported.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The FEC CSV file has a plain text format representing a data table, with
the first line being a header and defining the list of fields for each
entry, and each following line representing one accounting entry, in no
predetermined order.
::::

Our module expects the files to meet the following technical
specifications:

- **Encoding**: UTF-8, UTF-8-SIG and iso8859_15.
- **Separator**: any of these: [;]{.title-ref} or [\|]{.title-ref} or
  [,]{.title-ref} or [TAB]{.title-ref}.
- **Line terminators**: both CR+LF ([rn]{.title-ref}) and LF
  ([n]{.title-ref}) character groups are supported.
- **Date format**: [%Y%m%d]{.title-ref}

#### Fields description and use

+------+---------------+-----------------------+---------------------------------------------+--------------+
| > \# | Field name    | Description           | Use                                         | Format       |
+======+===============+=======================+=============================================+==============+
| 01   | JournalCode   | Journal Code          | [journal.code]{.title-ref} and              | Alphanumeric |
|      |               |                       | [journal.name]{.title-ref} if               |              |
|      |               |                       | [JournalLib]{.title-ref} is not provided    |              |
+------+---------------+-----------------------+---------------------------------------------+--------------+
| 02   | JournalLib    | Journal Label         | [journal.name]{.title-ref}                  | Alphanumeric |
+------+---------------+-----------------------+---------------------------------------------+--------------+
| 03   | EcritureNum   | Numbering specific to | [move.name]{.title-ref}                     | Alphanumeric |
|      |               | each journal sequence |                                             |              |
|      |               | number of the entry   |                                             |              |
+------+---------------+-----------------------+---------------------------------------------+--------------+
| 04   | EcritureDate  | Accounting entry Date | [move.date]{.title-ref}                     | Date         |
|      |               |                       |                                             | (yyyyMMdd)   |
+------+---------------+-----------------------+---------------------------------------------+--------------+
| 05   | CompteNum     | Account Number        | [account.code]{.title-ref}                  | Alphanumeric |
+------+---------------+-----------------------+---------------------------------------------+--------------+
| 06   | CompteLib     | Account Label         | [account.name]{.title-ref}                  | Alphanumeric |
+------+---------------+-----------------------+---------------------------------------------+--------------+
| 07   | CompAuxNum    | Secondary account     | [partner.ref]{.title-ref}                   | Alphanumeric |
|      |               | Number (accepts null) |                                             |              |
+------+---------------+-----------------------+---------------------------------------------+--------------+
| 08   | CompAuxLib    | Secondary account     | [partner.name]{.title-ref}                  | Alphanumeric |
|      |               | Label (accepts null)  |                                             |              |
+------+---------------+-----------------------+---------------------------------------------+--------------+
| 09   | PieceRef      | Document Reference    | [move.ref]{.title-ref} and                  | Alphanumeric |
|      |               |                       | [move.name]{.title-ref} if                  |              |
|      |               |                       | [EcritureNum]{.title-ref} is not provided   |              |
+------+---------------+-----------------------+---------------------------------------------+--------------+
| 10   | PieceDate     | Document Date         | [move.date]{.title-ref}                     | Date         |
|      |               |                       |                                             | (yyyyMMdd)   |
+------+---------------+-----------------------+---------------------------------------------+--------------+
| 11   | EcritureLib   | Account entry Label   | [move_line.name]{.title-ref}                | Alphanumeric |
+------+---------------+-----------------------+---------------------------------------------+--------------+
| 12   | Debit         | Debit amount          | [move_line.debit]{.title-ref}               | Float        |
+------+---------------+-----------------------+---------------------------------------------+--------------+
| 13   | Credit        | Credit amount (Field  | [move_line.credit]{.title-ref}              | Float        |
|      |               | name \"CrÃ©dit\" is    |                                             |              |
|      |               | not allowed)          |                                             |              |
+------+---------------+-----------------------+---------------------------------------------+--------------+
| 14   | EcritureLet   | Accounting entry      | [move_line.fec_matching_number]{.title-ref} | Alphanumeric |
|      |               | cross reference       |                                             |              |
|      |               | (accepts null)        |                                             |              |
+------+---------------+-----------------------+---------------------------------------------+--------------+
| 15   | DateLet       | Accounting entry date | unused                                      | Date         |
|      |               | (accepts null)        |                                             | (yyyyMMdd)   |
+------+---------------+-----------------------+---------------------------------------------+--------------+
| 16   | ValidDate     | Accounting entry      | unused                                      | Date         |
|      |               | validation date       |                                             | (yyyyMMdd)   |
+------+---------------+-----------------------+---------------------------------------------+--------------+
| 17   | Montantdevise | Currency amount       | [move_line.amount_currency]{.title-ref}     | Float        |
|      |               | (accepts null)        |                                             |              |
+------+---------------+-----------------------+---------------------------------------------+--------------+
| 18   | Idevise       | Currency identifier   | [currency.name]{.title-ref}                 | Alphanumeric |
|      |               | (accepts null)        |                                             |              |
+------+---------------+-----------------------+---------------------------------------------+--------------+

These two fields can be found in place of the others in the sence above.

  ---- --------- ----------------------- -------------------------------- ----------
  12   Montant   Amount                  [move_line.debit]{.title-ref} or Float
                                         [move_line.credit]{.title-ref}   

  13   Sens      Can be \"C\" for Credit determines                       Char
                 or \"D\" for Debit      [move_line.debit]{.title-ref} or 
                                         [move_line.credit]{.title-ref}   
  ---- --------- ----------------------- -------------------------------- ----------

#### Implementation details

The following accounting entities are imported from the FEC files:
**Accounts, Journals, Partners**, and **Moves**.

Our module determines the encoding, the line-terminator character, and
the separator that are used in the file.

A check is then performed to see if every line has the correct number of
fields corresponding to the header.

If the check passes, then the file is read in full, kept in memory, and
scanned. Accounting entities are imported one type at a time, in the
following order.

##### Accounts

Every accounting entry is related to an account, which should be
determined by the field [CompteNum]{.title-ref}.

##### Code matching

Should a similar account code already be present in the system, the
existing one is used instead of creating a new one.

Accounts in Odoo generally have a number of digits that are default for
the fiscal localization. As the FEC module is related to the French
localization, the default number of relevant digits is 6.

This means that the account codes the trailing zeroes are right-trimmed,
and that the comparison between the account codes in the FEC file and
the ones already existing in Odoo is performed only on the first six
digits of the codes.

::: example
The account code [65800000]{.title-ref} in the file is matched against
an existing [658000]{.title-ref} account in Odoo, and that account is
used instead of creating a new one.
:::

##### Reconcilable flag

An account is technically flagged as *reconcilable* if the first line in
which it appears has the [EcritureLet]{.title-ref} field filled out, as
this flag means that the accounting entry is going to be reconciled with
another one.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

In case the line somehow has this field not filled out, but the entry
still has to be reconciled with a payment that hasn\'t yet been
recorded, this isn\'t a problem anyway; the account is flagged as
reconcilable as soon as the import of the move lines requires it.
::::

##### Account type and Templates matching

As the **type** of the account is not specified in the FEC format,
**new** accounts are created with the default type *Current Assets* and
then, at the end of the import process, they are matched against the
installed Chart of Account templates. Also, the *reconcile* flag is also
computed this way.

The match is done with the left-most digits, starting by using all
digits, then 3, then 2.

::: example
  -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  Name         Code                     Full comparison          3-digits comparison 2-digits
                                                                                     comparison
  ------------ ------------------------ ------------------------ ------------------- ------------------
  Template     [400000]{.title-ref}     [400000]{.title-ref}     [400]{.title-ref}   [40]{.title-ref}

  CompteNum    [40100000]{.title-ref}   [40100000]{.title-ref}   [401]{.title-ref}   [40]{.title-ref}

  **Result**                                                                         Match **found**
  -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
:::

The type of the account is then flagged as *payable* and *reconcilable*
as per the account template.

##### Journals

Journals are also checked against those already existing in Odoo to
avoid duplicates, also in the case of multiple FEC files imports.

Should a similar journal code already be present in the system, the
existing one is used instead of creating a new one.

New journals have their name prefixed by the string `FEC-`.

::: example
[ACHATS]{.title-ref} -\> [FEC-ACHATS]{.title-ref}
:::

The journals are *not* archived, the user is entitled to handle them as
he wishes.

##### Journal type determination

The journal type is also not specified in the format (as per the
accounts) and therefore it is at first created with the default type
[general]{.title-ref}.

At the end of the import process, the type is determined as per these
rules regarding related moves and accounts:

- | \`bank\`: Moves in these journals always have a line (debit or
    credit) impacting a liquidity account.
  | [cash]{.title-ref} / [bank]{.title-ref} can be interchanged, so
    [bank]{.title-ref} is set everywhere when this condition is met.

- | \`sale\`: Moves in these journals mostly have debit lines on
    receivable accounts and credit lines on tax income accounts.
  | Sale refund journal items are debit/credit inverted.

- | \`purchase\`: Moves in these journals mostly have credit lines on
    payable accounts and debit lines on expense accounts.
  | Purchase refund journal items are debit/credit inverted.

- | \`general\`: for everything else.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

- A minimum of three moves is necessary for journal type identification.
- A threshold of 70% of moves must correspond to a criteria for a
  journal type to be determined.
::::

::: example
Suppose we are analyzing the moves that share a certain
[journal_id]{.title-ref}.

  -------------------------------------------------------------------------
  Moves                                                Count   Percentage
  ---------------------------------------------------- ------- ------------
  that have a sale account line and no purchase        0       0
  account line                                                 

  that have a purchase account line and no sale        1       25%
  account line                                                 

  that have a liquidity account line                   3       **75%**

  **Total**                                            4       100%
  -------------------------------------------------------------------------

The journal [type]{.title-ref} would be [bank]{.title-ref}, because the
bank moves percentage (75%) exceeds the threshold (70%).
:::

##### Partners

Each partner keeps its [Reference]{.title-ref} from the field
[CompAuxNum]{.title-ref}.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

These fields are searchable, in line with former FEC imports on the
accounting expert\'s side for fiscal/audit purposes.
::::

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

Users can merge partners with the Data Cleaning App, where Vendors and
Customers or similar partner entries may be merged by the user, with
assistance from the system that groups them by similar entries.
::::

##### Moves

Entries are immediately posted and reconciled after submission, using
the [EcritureLet]{.title-ref} field to do the matching between the
entries themselves.

The [EcritureNum]{.title-ref} field represents the name of the moves. We
noticed that sometimes it may not be filled out. In this case, the field
[PieceRef]{.title-ref} is used.

##### Rounding issues

There is a rounding tolerance with a currency-related precision on debit
and credit (i.e., 0.01 for EUR). Under this tolerance, a new line is
added to the move, named *Import rounding difference*, targeting the
accounts:

- [658000]{.title-ref} Charges diverses de gestion courante, for added
  debits
- [758000]{.title-ref} Produits divers de gestion courante, for added
  credits

##### Missing move name

Should the [EcritureNum]{.title-ref} not be filled out, it may also
happen that the [PieceRef]{.title-ref} field is also not suited to
determine the move name (it may be used as an accounting move line
reference) leaving no way to actually find which lines are to be grouped
in a single move, and effectively impeding the creation of balanced
moves.

One last attempt is made, grouping all lines from the same journal and
date ([JournalLib]{.title-ref}, [EcritureDate]{.title-ref}). Should this
grouping generate balanced moves (sum(credit) - sum(debit) = 0), then
each different combination of journal and date creates a new move.

::: example
[ACH]{.title-ref} + [2021/05/01]{.title-ref} \--\> new move on journal
[ACH]{.title-ref} with name [20210501]{.title-ref}.
:::

Should this attempt fail, the user is prompted an error message with all
the move lines that are supposedly unbalanced.

##### Partner information

If a line has the partner information specified, the information is
copied to the accounting move itself if the targeted Journal is of type
*payable* or *receivable*.

### Export

If you have installed the French
`fiscal localization package <fiscal_localizations/packages>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}, you should be able to download the FEC. To do so, go to
`Accounting --> Reporting -->
France --> FEC`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

If you do not see the submenu **FEC**, go to `Apps`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, remove the *Apps* filter, then search for the
module named **France-FEC** and make sure it is installed.
::::

::: seealso
- [Official Technical Specification
  (fr)](https://www.legifrance.gouv.fr/codes/article_lc/LEGIARTI000027804775)
- [Test-Compta-Demat (Official FEC Testing
  tool)](https://github.com/DGFiP/Test-Compta-Demat)
:::

## French Accounting Reports

If you have installed the French Accounting, you will have access to
some accounting reports specific to France:

- Bilan comptable
- Compte de rÃ©sultats
- Plan de Taxes France

## Get the VAT anti-fraud certification with Odoo

As of January 1st 2018, a new anti-fraud legislation comes into effect
in France and DOM-TOM. This new legislation stipulates certain criteria
concerning the inalterability, security, storage and archiving of sales
data. These legal requirements are implemented in Odoo, version 9
onward, through a module and a certificate of conformity to download.

### Is my company required to use anti-fraud software?

Your company is required to use an anti-fraud cash register software
like Odoo (CGI art. 286, I. 3Â° bis) if:

- You are taxable (not VAT exempt) in France or any DOM-TOM,
- Some of your customers are private individuals (B2C).

This rule applies to any company size. Auto-entrepreneurs are exempted
from VAT and therefore are not affected.

### Get certified with Odoo

Getting compliant with Odoo is very easy.

Your company is requested by the tax administration to deliver a
certificate of conformity testifying that your software complies with
the anti-fraud legislation. This certificate is granted by Odoo SA to
Odoo Enterprise users
[here](https://www.odoo.com/my/contract/french-certification/). If you
use Odoo Community, you should `upgrade to Odoo Enterprise
</administration/on_premise/community_to_enterprise>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} or contact your Odoo service provider.

In case of non-conformity, your company risks a fine of â‚¬7,500.

To get the certification, just follow the following steps:

- If you use **Odoo Point of Sale**,
  `install <general/install>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} the
  **France - VAT Anti-Fraud Certification for Point of Sale (CGI 286 I-3
  bis)** module by going to `Apps`{.interpreted-text
  role="menuselection"}, removing the *Apps* filter, then searching for
  *l10n_fr_pos_cert*, and installing the module.
- Make sure a country is set on your company, otherwise your entries
  won't be encrypted for the inalterability check. To edit your
  company's data, go to
  `Settings --> Users & Companies --> Companies`{.interpreted-text
  role="menuselection"}. Select a country from the list; Do not create a
  new country.
- Download the mandatory certificate of conformity delivered by Odoo SA
  [here](https://www.odoo.com/my/contract/french-certification/).

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

- To install the module in any system created before December 18th 2017,
  you should update the modules list. To do so, activate the
  `developer mode <developer-mode>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}. Then
  go to the *Apps* menu and press *Update Modules List* in the top-menu.
- In case you run Odoo on-premise, you need to update your installation
  and restart your server beforehand.
- If you have installed the initial version of the anti-fraud module
  (prior to December 18th 2017), you need to update it. The module\'s
  name was *France - Accounting - Certified CGI 286 I-3 bis*. After an
  update of the modules list, search for the updated module in *Apps*,
  select it and click *Upgrade*. Finally, make sure the following module
  *l10n_fr_sale_closing* is installed.
::::

### Anti-fraud features

The anti-fraud module introduces the following features:

- **Inalterability**: deactivation of all the ways to cancel or modify
  key data of POS orders, invoices and journal entries;
- **Security**: chaining algorithm to verify the inalterability;
- **Storage**: automatic sales closings with computation of both period
  and cumulative totals (daily, monthly, annually).

#### Inalterability

All the possible ways to cancel and modify key data of paid POS orders,
confirmed invoices and journal entries are deactivated, if the company
is located in France or in any DOM-TOM.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

If you run a multi-companies environment, only the documents of such
companies are impacted.
::::

#### Security

To ensure inalterability, every order or journal entry is encrypted upon
validation. This number (or hash) is calculated from the key data of the
document as well as from the hash of the precedent documents.

The module introduces an interface to test the data inalterability. If
any information is modified on a document after its validation, the test
will fail. The algorithm recomputes all the hashes and compares them
against the initial ones. In case of failure, the system points out the
first corrupted document recorded in the system.

Users with *Manager* access rights can launch the inalterability check.
For POS orders, go to
`Point of Sales --> Reporting --> French Statements`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. For invoices or journal entries, go to
`Invoicing/Accounting --> Reporting --> French Statements`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}.

#### Storage

The system also processes automatic sales closings on a daily, monthly
and annual basis. Such closings distinctly compute the sales total of
the period as well as the cumulative grand totals from the very first
sales entry recorded in the system.

Closings can be found in the *French Statements* menu of Point of Sale,
Invoicing and Accounting apps.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

- Closings compute the totals for journal entries of sales journals
  (Journal Type = Sales).
- For multi-companies environments, such closings are performed by
  company.
- POS orders are posted as journal entries at the closing of the POS
  session. Closing a POS session can be done anytime. To prompt users to
  do it on a daily basis, the module prevents from resuming a session
  opened more than 24 hours ago. Such a session must be closed before
  selling again.
- A period's total is computed from all the journal entries posted after
  the previous closing of the same type, regardless of their posting
  date. If you record a new sales transaction for a period already
  closed, it will be counted in the very next closing.
::::

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

- For test & audit purposes such closings can be manually generated in
  the `developer mode <developer-mode>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}.
- Then go to
  `Settings --> Technical --> Automation --> Scheduled Actions`{.interpreted-text
  role="menuselection"}.
::::

### Responsibilities

Do not uninstall the module! If you do so, the hashes will be reset and
none of your past data will be longer guaranteed as being inalterable.

Users remain responsible for their Odoo instance and must use it with
due diligence. It is not permitted to modify the source code which
guarantees the inalterability of data.

Odoo absolves itself of all and any responsibility in case of changes in
the module's functions caused by 3rd party applications not certified by
Odoo.

### More Information

You can find more information about this legislation in the following
official documents.

::: seealso
- [Frequently Asked
  Questions](https://www.economie.gouv.fr/files/files/directions_services/dgfip/controle_fiscal/actualites_reponses/logiciels_de_caisse.pdf)
- [Official
  Statement](http://bofip.impots.gouv.fr/bofip/10691-PGP.html?identifiant=BOI-TVA-DECLA-30-10-30-20160803)
- [Item 88 of Finance Law
  2016](https://www.legifrance.gouv.fr/affichTexteArticle.do?idArticle=JORFARTI000031732968&categorieLien=id&cidTexte=JORFTEXT000031732865)
:::
