# Germany

## German Chart of Accounts

The chart of accounts SKR03 and SKR04 are both supported in Odoo. You
can choose the one you want by going in
`Accounting --> Configuration`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}
then choose the package you want in the Fiscal Localization section.

Be careful, you can only change the accounting package as long as you
have not created any accounting entry.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

When you create a new Odoo Online database, the SKR03 is installed by
default.
::::

## German Accounting Reports

Here is the list of German-specific reports available on Odoo
Enterprise:

- Balance Sheet
- Profit & Loss
- Tax Report (Umsatzsteuervoranmeldung)
- Partner VAT Intra

## Export from Odoo to Datev

It is possible to export your accounting entries from Odoo to Datev. To
be able to use this feature, the german accounting localization needs to
be installed on your Odoo Enterprise database. Then you can go in
`Accounting --> Reporting --> General Ledger`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} then click on the **Export Datev (csv)** button.

## Point of Sale in Germany: Technical Security System {#germany/pos}

The **Kassensicherungsverordnung** (The Act on Protection against
Manipulation of Digital Records) requires that electronic record-keeping
systems - including the `point of sale
</applications/sales/point_of_sale>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
systems - must be equipped with a **Technical Security System** (also
called **TSS** or **TSE**).

Odoo offers a service that is compliant with the help of
[fiskaly](https://fiskaly.com), a *cloud-based solution*.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

Since this solution is cloud-based, a working internet connection is
required.
::::

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The only VAT rates allowed are given by fiskaly. You can check these
rates by consulting: [fiskaly DSFinV-K API: VAT
Definition](https://developer.fiskaly.com/api/dsfinvk/v0/#tag/VAT-Definition).
::::

### Configuration

#### Modules installation

1.  If your database was created before June 2021,
    `upgrade <general/upgrade>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} your
    **Point of Sale** app ([point_of_sale]{.title-ref}) and the
    **Restaurant** module ([pos_restaurant]{.title-ref}).

2.  `Install <general/install>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} the
    **Germany - Certification for Point of Sale**
    ([l10n_de_pos_cert]{.title-ref}) and **Germany - Certification for
    Point of Sale of type restaurant**
    ([l10n_de_pos_res_cert]{.title-ref}) modules.

    :::: tip
    ::: title
    Tip
    :::

    If these modules are not listed,
    `update the app list <general/install>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"}.
    ::::

![Upgrading Odoo Point of Sale from the Apps dashboard](germany/pos-upgrade.png){.align-center}

#### Register your company at the financial authority

To register your company, go to
`Settings --> General Settings --> Companies -->
Update Info`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}, fill out the
following fields and *Save*.

- **Company name**
- Valid **address**
- **VAT** number
- **St.-Nr** (Steuernummer): this number is assigned by the tax office
  to every taxable natural or legal person. (e.g.,
  [2893081508152]{.title-ref})
- **W-IdNr** (Wirtschafts-Identifikationsnummer): this number is used as
  a permanent identification number for economically active persons.

You can then **register your company through fiskaly** by opening the
*fiskaly* tab and clicking on the *fiskaly Registration* button.

![Button to register a company through fiskaly in Odoo](germany/fiskaly-registration.png){.align-center}

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

If you do not see the *fiskaly Registration* button, make sure that you
*saved* your company details and are not in *editing mode* anymore.
::::

Once the registration has been finalized, new fields appear:

- **fiskaly organization ID** refers to the ID of your company at the
  fiskaly side.
- **fiskaly API key** and **secret** are the credentials the system uses
  to access the services offered by fiskaly.

![fiskaly keys as displayed on Odoo](germany/fiskaly-keys.png){.align-center}

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

It is possible to request new credentials if there is any issue with the
current ones.
::::

#### Create and link a Technical Security System to your PoS

![Create TSS option from a point of sale](germany/create-tss.png){.align-right}

To use your point of sale in Germany, you first have to create a
`TSS (Technical Security
System)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} for it.

To do so, go to
`Point of Sale --> Configuration --> Point of Sale`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, open the point of sale you want to edit, then
check the box next to **Create TSS** and *Save*.

![Example of TSS ID and Client ID from fiskaly in Odoo Point of Sale](germany/tss-ids.png){.align-right}

Once the creation of the TSS is successful, you can find your **TSS ID**
and **Client ID** under the *fiskaly API* section.

- **TSS ID** refers to the ID of your TSS at fiskaly\'s side.
- **Client ID** refers to your PoS but at fiskaly\'s side.

### DSFinV-K

![Menu to export DSFinV-K](germany/dsfinv-k-export.png){.align-right}

Whenever you close a PoS session, the orders\' details are sent to the
`DSFinV-K (Digitale
Schnittstelle der Finanzverwaltung fÃ¼r Kassensysteme)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} service of fiskaly.

In case of an audit, you can export the data sent to DSFinV-K by going
to `Point of
Sale --> Orders --> DSFinV-k exports`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}.

These fields are mandatory:

- **Name**
- **Start Datetime** (export data with dates larger than or equal to the
  given start date)
- **End Datetime** (export data with dates smaller than or equal to the
  given end date)

Leave the **Point of Sale** field blank if you want to export the data
of all your points of sale. Specify a Point of Sale if you want to
export this specific PoS\' data only.

The creation of a DSFinV-K export triggers on export at fiskaly\'s side.

![Pending DSFinV-K export on Odoo](germany/dsfinv-k-export-fields.png){.align-center}

As you can see, the **State** is *Pending*. This means that the export
has been successfully triggered and is being processed. You have to
click on *Refresh State* to check if it is ready.

## German Tax Accounting Standards: Odoo\'s guide to GoBD Compliance {#germany/gobd}

**GoBD** stands for *GrundsÃ¤tze zur ordnungsmÃ¤ÃŸigen FÃ¼hrung und
Aufbewahrung von BÃ¼chern, Aufzeichnungen und Unterlagen in
elektronischer Form sowie zum Datenzugriff*. In short, it is a
**guideline for the proper management and storage of books, records, and
documents in electronic form, as well as for data access**, that is
relevant for the German tax authority, tax declaration, and balance
sheet.

These principles have been written and published by the Federal Ministry
of Finance (BMF) in November 2014. Since January 2015, **they have
become the norm** and replace previously accepted practices linked to
computer-based accounting. Several changes have been made by the BMF in
2019 and January 2020 to specify some of the content and due to the
development of digital solutions (cloud hosting, paperless companies,
etc.).

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

Odoo gives you **the means to be compliant with GoBD**.
::::

### What do you need to know about GoBD when relying on accounting software?

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

If you can, the best way to understand GoBD is to Read the [Official
GoBD
text](https://ao.bundesfinanzministerium.de/ao/2021/Anhaenge/BMF-Schreiben-und-gleichlautende-Laendererlasse/Anhang-64/anhang-64.html).
It is a bit long but quite readable for non-experts. But in short, here
is what to expect:
::::

The **GoBD is binding for companies that have to present accounts, which
includes SMEs, freelancers, and entrepreneurs, to the financial
authorities**. As such, **the taxpayer himself is the sole responsible**
for the complete and exhaustive keeping of fiscal-relevant data
(above-mentioned financial and related data).

Apart from software requirements, the user is required to ensure
Internal control systems (*in accordance with sec. 146 of the Fiscal
Code*):

- Access rights control;
- Segregation of Duties, Functional separating;
- Entry controls (error notifications, plausibility checks);
- Reconciliation checks at data entry;
- Processing controls;
- Measures to prevent intentional or unintentional manipulation of
  software, data, or documents.

The user must distribute tasks within its organization to the relevant
positions (*control*) and verify that the tasks are properly and
completely performed (*supervision*). The result of these controls must
be recorded (*documentation*), and should errors be found during these
controls, appropriate measures to correct the situation should be put
into place (*prevention*).

### What about data security?

**The taxpayer must secure the system against any data loss due to
deletion, removal, or theft of any data**. If the entries are not
sufficiently secured, the bookkeeping will be regarded as not in
accordance with the GoBD guidelines.

Once bookings have been finally posted, they can no longer be changed or
deleted via the application.

- If Odoo is used in the cloud, regular backups are part of the Odoo
  Online service. In addition, regular backups can be downloaded and
  backed up on external systems.

  ::: seealso
  [Odoo Cloud Hosting - Service Level
  Agreement](https://www.odooo.com/cloud-sla)
  :::

- If the server is operated locally, it is the responsibility of the
  user to create the necessary backup infrastructure.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

In some cases, data has to be kept for ten years or more, so always have
backups saved. It is even more important if you decide to change
software provider.
::::

### Responsibility of the software editor

Considering GoBD only applies between the taxpayer and the financial
authority, **the software editor can by no means be held responsible for
the accurate and compliant documentation of financial transactional data
of their users**. It can merely provide the necessary tools for the user
to respect the software related guidelines described in the GoBD.

### How can Odoo help you achieve Compliance?

The key words, when it comes to GoBD, are: **traceable, verifiable,
true, clear, and continuous**. In short, you need to have audit-proof
archiving in place and Odoo provides you with the means to achieve all
of these objectives:

1.  | **Traceability and verifiability**
    | Each record in Odoo is stamped with the creator of the document,
      the creation date, the modification date, and who modified it. In
      addition, relevant fields are tracked thus it can be seen which
      value was changed by whom in the chatter of the relevant object.

2.  | **Completeness**
    | All financial data must be recorded in the system, and there can
      be no gaps. Odoo ensures that there is no gap in the numbering of
      the financial transactions. It is the responsibility of the user
      to encode all financial data in the system. As most financial data
      in Odoo is generated automatically, it remains the responsibility
      of the user to encode all vendor bills and miscellaneous
      operations completely.

3.  | **Accuracy**
    | Odoo ensures with the correct configuration that the correct
      accounts are used. In addition, the control mechanisms between
      purchase orders and sales orders and their respective invoices
      reflect the business reality. It is the responsibility of the user
      to scan and attach the paper-based vendor bill to the respective
      record in Odoo. *Odoo Document helps you automate this task*.

4.  | **Timely booking and record-keeping**
    | As most financial data in Odoo is generated by the transactional
      objects (for example, the invoice is booked at confirmation), Odoo
      ensures out-of-the-box timely record-keeping. It is the
      responsibility of the user to encode all incoming vendor bills in
      a timely manner, as well as the miscellaneous operations.

5.  | **Order**
    | Financial data stored in Odoo is per definition ordered and can be
      reordered according to most fields present in the model. A
      specific ordering is not enforced by the GoBD, but the system must
      ensure that a given financial transaction can be quickly found by
      a third-party expert. Odoo ensures this out-of-the-box.

6.  | **Inalterability**
    | With the German Odoo localization, Odoo is in standard configured
      in such a way that the inalterability clause can be adhered to
      without any further customization.

### Do you need a GoBD-Export?

In the case of fiscal control, the fiscal authority can request three
levels of access to the accounting system (Z1, Z2, Z3). These levels
vary from direct access to the interface to the handover of the
financial data on a storage device.

In case of a handover of the financial data on a storage device, the
format is **not** enforced by the GoBD. It can be, for example, in XLS,
CSV, XML, Lotus 123, SAP-format, AS/400-format, or else. Odoo supports
the CSV and XLS-export of financial data out-of-the-box. The GoBD
**recommends** the export in a specific XML-based GoBD-format (see
\"ErgÃ¤nzende Informationen zur DatennttrÃ¤gerÃ¼berlassung\" Â§3) but it is
not binding.

### What is the role and meaning of the compliance certification?

The GoBD clearly states that due to the nature of a state of the art
accounting software, their configuration possibilities, changing nature,
and various forms of use, **no legally binding certification can be
given**, nor can the software be made liable towards a public authority.
Third-party certificates can indeed have **an informative value** for
customers to make software buying decisions but are by no means legally
binding or of any other legal value (A. 12, Â§ 181).

A GoBD certificate states nothing more than that if you use the software
according to its guidelines, the software will not refrain you from
respecting the GoBD. These certifications are very expensive in terms of
time and cost, and their value is very relative. Thus we focus our
efforts on ensuring GoBD compliance rather than pay for a marketing tool
which does not, however, offer our customer any legal certainty.

:::::: important
::: title
Important
:::

The BMF actually states the following in the [Official GoBD
text](https://ao.bundesfinanzministerium.de/ao/2021/Anhaenge/BMF-Schreiben-und-gleichlautende-Laendererlasse/Anhang-64/anhang-64.html):

- 180\. Positive attestations on the correctness of the bookkeeping -
  and thus on the correctness of IT-based bookkeeping systems - are not
  issued either in the context of a tax field audit or in the context of
  binding information.
- 181\. \"Certificates\" or \"attestations\" from third parties can
  serve as a decision criterion for the company when selecting a
  software product, but develop from the in margin no. 179 is not
  binding on the tax authorities.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The previous content was [automatically translated from German with

# India

## Installation {#india/installation}

`Install <general/install>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} the following
modules to get all the features of the Indian localization:

  Name                                                               Technical name                       Description
  ------------------------------------------------------------------ ------------------------------------ -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  `Indian - Accounting`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}           [l10n_in]{.title-ref}                Default `fiscal localization package <fiscal_localizations/packages>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
  `Indian E-invoicing`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}            [l10n_in_edi]{.title-ref}            `Indian e-invoicing integration <india/e-invoicing>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
  `Indian E-waybill`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}              [l10n_in_edi_ewaybill]{.title-ref}   `Indian E-way bill integration <india/e-waybill>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
  `Indian - GSTR India eFiling`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}   [l10n_in_reports_gstr]{.title-ref}   `Indian GST Return filing <india/gstr>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
  `Indian - Accounting Reports`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}   [l10n_in_reports]{.title-ref}        `Indian tax reports <india/gstr_reports>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}

![Indian localization modules](india/india-modules.png)

## e-Invoice system {#india/e-invoicing}

Odoo is compliant with the **Indian Goods and Services Tax (GST)
e-Invoice system** requirements.

### Setup

#### NIC e-Invoice registration {#india/e-invoicing-api}

You must register on the
`NIC (National Informatics Centre)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
e-Invoice portal to get your **API credentials**. You need these
credentials to `configure your Odoo Accounting app
<india/e-invoicing-configuration>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}.

1.  Log in to the [NIC e-Invoice portal](https://einvoice1.gst.gov.in/)
    by clicking `Login`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and entering
    your `Username`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
    `Password`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"};

    :::: note
    ::: title
    Note
    :::

    If you are already registered on the NIC portal, you can use the
    same login credentials.
    ::::

    ![Register Odoo ERP system on e-invoice web portal](india/e-invoice-system-login.png)

2.  From the dashboard, go to
    `API Registration --> User Credentials --> Create API
    User`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"};

3.  After that, you should receive an
    `OTP (one-time password)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} code on
    your registered mobile number. Enter the OTP code and click
    `Verify OTP`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"};

4.  Select `Through GSP`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} for the API
    interface, set `Tera Software Limited`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} as GSP, and type in a `Username`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} and `Password`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
    for your API. Once it is done, click `Submit`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}.

    ![Submit API specific Username and Password](india/submit-api-registration-details.png)

#### Configuration in Odoo {#india/e-invoicing-configuration}

To enable the e-Invoice service in Odoo, go to
`Accounting --> Configuration -->
Settings --> Indian Electronic Invoicing`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, and enter the `Username`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} and `Password`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
previously set for the API.

![Setup e-invoice service](india/e-invoice-setup.png)

##### Journals {#india/e-invoicing-journals}

To automatically send e-Invoices to the NIC e-Invoice portal, you must
first configure your *sales* journal by going to
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Journals`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, opening your *sales* journal, and in the
`Advanced Settings`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab, under
`Electronic Data
Interchange`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, enable
`E-Invoice (IN)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and save.

### Workflow {#india/e-invoicing-workflow}

#### Invoice validation {#india/invoice-validation}

Once an invoice is validated, a confirmation message is displayed at the
top. Odoo automatically uploads the JSON-signed file of validated
invoices to the NIC e-Invoice portal after some time. If you want to
process the invoice immediately, click `Process now`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}.

![Indian e-invoicing confirmation message](india/e-invoice-process.png)

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

\- You can find the JSON-signed file in the attached files in the
chatter. - You can check the document\'s
`EDI (electronic data interchange)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
status under the `EDI Document`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab
or the `Electronic invoicing`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field
of the invoice.
::::

#### Invoice PDF report {#india/invoice-pdf-report}

Once an invoice is validated and submitted, the invoice PDF report can
be printed. The report includes the
`IRN (Invoice Reference Number)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"},
`Ack. No`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} (acknowledgment number) and
`Ack. Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} (acknowledgment date),
and QR code. These certify that the invoice is a valid fiscal document.

![IRN and QR code](india/invoice-report.png)

#### e-Invoice cancellation {#india/edi-cancellation}

If you want to cancel an e-Invoice, go to the
`Other info`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab of the invoice and
fill out the `Cancel reason`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`Cancel remarks`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} fields. Then, click
`Request
EDI cancellation`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. The status of the
`Electronic invoicing`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field changes
to `To
Cancel`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

Doing so cancels both the
`e-Invoice <india/e-invoicing>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} and the
`E-Way bill
<india/e-waybill>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}.
::::

![cancel reason and remarks](india/e-invoice-cancellation.png)

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

\- If you want to abort the cancellation before processing the invoice,
then click `Call
Off EDI Cancellation`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. - Once you
request to cancel the e-Invoice, Odoo automatically submits the
JSON-signed file to the NIC e-Invoice portal. You can click
`Process now`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} if you want to process
the invoice immediately.
::::

#### GST e-Invoice verification {#india/verify-e-invoice}

After submitting an e-Invoice, you can verify if the invoice is signed
from the GST e-Invoice system website itself.

1.  Download the JSON file from the attached files. It can be found in
    the chatter of the related invoice;

2.  Open the [NIC e-Invoice portal](https://einvoice1.gst.gov.in/) and
    go to `Search --> Verify Signed Invoice`{.interpreted-text
    role="menuselection"};

3.  Select the JSON file and submit it;

    ![select the JSON file for verify invoice](india/verify-invoice.png)

    If the file is signed, a confirmation message is displayed.

    ![verified e-invoice](india/signed-invoice.png)

## E-Way bill {#india/e-waybill}

### Setup

Odoo is compliant with the **Indian Goods and Services Tax (GST)
E-waybill system** requirements.

#### API registration on NIC E-Way bill {#india/e-waybill-api}

You must register on the
`NIC (National Informatics Centre)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} E-Way
bill portal to create your **API credentials**. You need these
credentials to `configure your Odoo Accounting app
<india/e-waybill-configuration>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}.

1.  Log in to the [NIC E-Way bill portal](https://ewaybillgst.gov.in/)
    by clicking `Login`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and entering
    your `Username`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
    `Password`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"};

2.  From your dashboard, go to
    `Registration --> For GSP`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"};

3.  Click `Send OTP`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Once you have
    received the code on your registered mobile number, enter it and
    click `Verify OTP`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"};

4.  Check if `Tera Software Limited`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
    is already on the registered GSP/ERP list. If so, use the username
    and password used to log in to the NIC portal. Otherwise, follow the
    next steps;

    ![E-Way bill list of registered GSP/ERP](india/e-waybill-gsp-list.png)

5.  Select `Add/New`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, select
    `Tera Software Limited`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} as your
    GSP Name, create a `Username`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
    a `Password`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} for your API, and
    click `Add`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

    ![Submit GSP API registration details](india/e-waybill-registration-details.png)

#### Configuration in Odoo {#india/e-waybill-configuration}

To set up the E-Way bill service, go to
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Settings
--> Indian Electronic WayBill --> Setup E-Way bill`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, and enter your `Username`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} and `Password`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

![E-way bill setup odoo](india/e-waybill-configuration.png)

### Workflow {#india/e-waybill-workflow}

#### Send an E-Way bill {#india/e-waybill-send}

You can manually send an E-Way bill by clicking
`Send E-Way bill`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. To send the E-Way
bill automatically when an invoice or a bill is confirmed, enable
`E-Way bill (IN)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in your
`Sales or Purchase journal <india/e-invoicing-journals>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}.

![Send E-waybill button on invoices](india/e-waybill-send-button.png)

#### Invoice validation {#india/invoice-validation-e-way}

Once an invoice has been issued and sent via
`Send E-Way bill`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, a confirmation
message is displayed.

![Indian e-Way bill confirmation message](india/e-waybill-process.png)

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

\- You can find the JSON-signed file in the attached files in the
chatter. - Odoo automatically uploads the JSON-signed file to the
government portal after some time. Click `Process now`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} if you want to process the invoice immediately.
::::

#### Invoice PDF report

You can print the invoice PDF report once you have submitted the E-Way
bill. The report includes the **E-Way bill number** and the **E-Way bill
validity date**.

![E-way bill acknowledgment number and date](india/e-waybill-invoice-report.png)

#### E-Way bill cancellation {#india/e-waybill-cancellation}

If you want to cancel an E-Way bill, go to the
`E-Way bill`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab of the related
invoice and fill out the `Cancel reason`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} and `Cancel remarks`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
fields. Then, click `Request EDI Cancellation`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

Doing so cancels both the
`e-Invoice <india/e-invoicing>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} (if
applicable) and the `E-Way bill <india/e-waybill>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}.
::::

![Cancel reason and remarks](india/e-waybill-cancellation.png)

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

\- If you want to abort the cancellation before processing the invoice,
click `Call Off
EDI Cancellation`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. - Once you request
to cancel the E-Way bill, Odoo automatically submits the JSON-signed
file to the government portal. You can click
`Process Now`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} if you want to process
the invoice immediately.
::::

## Indian GST Return filing {#india/gstr}

### Enable API access {#india/gstr_api}

To file GST Returns in Odoo, you must first enable API access on the GST
portal.

1.  Log into the [GST
    portal](https://services.gst.gov.in/services/login) by entering your
    `Username`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
    `Password`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and go to
    `My Profile`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} on your **profile
    menu**;

    ![Click On the My Profile from profile](india/gst-portal-my-profile.png)

2.  Select `Manage API Access`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
    click `Yes`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to enable API access;

    ![Click Yes](india/gst-portal-api-yes.png)

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

It is recommended to set the `Duration`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} to `30 days`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to
avoid the need for frequent token reauthentication.
::::

1.  Doing so enables a `Duration`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
    drop-down menu. Select the `Duration`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} of your preference, and click
    `Confirm`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

### Indian GST Service In Odoo {#india/gstr_configuration}

Once you have enabled the
`API access <india/gstr_api>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} on the GST
portal, you can set up the `Indian GST Service`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} in Odoo.

Go to
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Settings --> Indian GST Service`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} and enter the `GST Username`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}. Click `Send OTP`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
enter the code, and finally, `Validate`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}.

> ![Please enter your GST portal Username as Username](india/gst-setup.png)

### File-in GST Return {#india/gstr_workflow}

When the `Indian GST Service`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is
configured, you can file your GST return. Go to
`Accounting --> Reporting --> India --> GST Return periods`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} and create a new **GST Return Period** if it does
not exist. GST Return file-in is done in **three steps** in Odoo:

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

**Tax Return Periodicity** can be
`configured <../accounting/reporting/tax_returns>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} according to the user\'s needs.
::::

#### Send GSTR-1 {#india/gstr-1}

1.  The user can verify the
    `GSTR-1 <india/gstr-1_report>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} report
    before uploading it to the **GST portal** by clicking
    `GSTR-1 Report`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"};

2.  If the **GSTR-1** report is correct, then click
    `Push to GSTN`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to send it to the
    **GST portal**. The status of the `GSTR-1`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} report changes to `Sending`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"};

    ![GSTR-1 in the Sending Status](india/gst-gstr-1-sending.png)

3.  After a few seconds, the status of the **GSTR-1** report changes to
    `Waiting for
    Status`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. It means that the
    **GSTR-1** report has been sent to the
    `GST Portal`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and is being
    verified on the `GST Portal`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"};

    ![GSTR-1 in the Waiting for Status](india/gst-gstr-1-waiting.png)

4.  Once more, after a few seconds, the status either changes to
    `Sent`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or `Error
    in Invoice`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. The status
    `Error in Invoice`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} indicates that
    some of the invoices are not correctly filled out to be validated by
    the **GST portal**;

    - If the state of the **GSTR-1** is `Sent`{.interpreted-text
      role="guilabel"}, it means your **GSTR-1** report is ready to be
      filed on the **GST portal**.

      ![GSTR-1 Sent](india/gst-gstr-1-sent.png)

    - If the state of the **GSTR-1** is
      `Error in Invoice`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, invoices
      can be checked for errors in the `Log Note`{.interpreted-text
      role="guilabel"}. Once issues have been resolved, the user can
      click `Push to GSTN`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to submit
      the file again on the **GST portal**.

      ![GSTR-1 Error in Invoice](india/gst-gstr-1-error.png)

    ![GSTR-1 Error in Invoice Log](india/gst-gstr-1-error-log.png)

5.  Click `Mark as Filed`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} after
    filing the **GSTR-1** report on the **GST portal**. The status of
    the report changes to `Filed`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in
    **Odoo**.

    ![GSTR-1 in the Filed Status](india/gst-gstr-1-filed.png)

#### Receive GSTR-2B {#india/gstr-2B}

Users can retrieve the **GSTR-2B Report** from the **GST portal**. This
automatically reconciles the **GSTR-2B** report with your Odoo bills;

1.  Click `Fetch GSTR-2B Summary`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to
    retrieve the **GSTR-2B** summary. After a few seconds, the status of
    the report changes to `Waiting for Reception`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}. This means Odoo is trying to receive the
    **GSTR-2B** report from the **GST portal**;

    ![GSTR-2B in Waiting for Reception](india/gst-gstr-2b-waiting.png)

2.  Once more, after a few seconds, the status of the **GSTR-2B**
    changes to the `Being
    Processed`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. It means Odoo is
    reconciling the **GSTR-2B** report with your Odoo bills;

    ![GSTR-2B in Waiting for Reception](india/gst-gstr-2b-processed.png)

3.  Once it is done, the status of the **GSTR-2B** report changes to
    either `Matched`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or
    `Partially Matched`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"};

    - If the status is `Matched`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:

      > ![GSTR-2B Matched](india/gst-gstr-2b-matched.png)

    - If the status is `Partially Matched`{.interpreted-text
      role="guilabel"}, you can make changes in bills by clicking
      `View Reconciled Bills`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Once
      it is done, click `re-match`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

      > ![GSTR-2B Partially Matched](india/gst-gstr-2b-partially.png)
      >
      > ![GSTR-2B Reconciled Bills](india/gst-gstr-2b-reconcile.png)

#### GSTR-3 report {#india/gstr-3}

The `GSTR-3 <india/gstr-3_report>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} report
is a monthly summary of **sales** and **purchases**. This return is
auto-generated by extracting information from **GSTR-1** and **GSTR-2**.

1.  Users can compare the **GSTR-3** report with the **GSTR-3** report
    available on the **GST portal** to verify if they match by clicking
    `GSTR-3 Report`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"};

2.  Once the **GSTR-3** report has been verified by the user and the tax
    amount on the **GST portal** has been paid. Once paid, the report
    can be **closed** by clicking `Closing Entry`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"};

    ![GSTR-3](india/gst-gstr-3.png)

3.  In `Closing Entry`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, add the tax
    amount paid on the **GST portal** using challan, and click
    `POST`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to post the
    `Closing Entry`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"};

    ![GSTR-3 Post Entry](india/gst-gstr-3-post.png)

4.  Once posted, the **GSTR-3** report status changes to
    `Filed`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

    ![GSTR-3 Filed](india/gst-gstr-3-filed.png)

## Tax reports {#india/gstr_reports}

### GSTR-1 report {#india/gstr-1_report}

The `GSTR-1`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} report is divided into
sections. It displays the `Base`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
amount, `CGST (Central Goods and Services Tax)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}, `SGST (State Goods and Service Tax)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"},
`IGST (Integrated Goods and Services Tax)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}, and `CESS`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} for each
section.

> ![GSTR-1 Report](india/gst-gstr-1-sale-report.png)

### GSTR-3 report {#india/gstr-3_report}

The `GSTR-3`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} report contains
different sections:

- Details of inward and outward supply subject to a **reverse charge**;

- Eligible `ITC (Income Tax Credit)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"};

- Values of **exempt**, **Nil-rated**, and **non-GST** inward supply;

- Details of inter-state supplies made to **unregistered** persons.

  > ![GSTR-3 Report](india/gst-gstr-3-report.png)




--- SOURCE: finance/fiscal_localizations/indonesia.md ---

# Indonesia

## E-Faktur Module {#localization_indonesia/e-faktur}

The **E-Faktur Module** is installed by default with the Indonesian
localization module. It allows one to generate a CSV file for one tax
invoice or for a batch of tax invoices to upload to the **Tax Office
e-Faktur** application.

### NPWP/NIK settings {#localization_indonesia/npwp_nik}

- | **Your Company**
  | This information is used in the FAPR line in the effect file format.
    You need to set a VAT number on the related partner of your Odoo
    company. If you don\'t, it won\'t be possible to create an e-Faktur
    from an invoice.

- | **Your Clients**
  | You need to set the checkbox *ID PKP* to generate e-fakturs for a
    customer. You can use the VAT field on the customer\'s contact to
    set the NPWP needed to generate the e-Faktur file. If your customer
    does not have an NPWP, just enter the NIK in the same VAT field.

  ![image](indonesia/indonesia-partner-nik.png){.align-center}

### Usage {#localization_indonesia/e-faktur_usage}

#### Generate Tax Invoice Serial Number {#localization_indonesia/tax_invoice_sn}

1.  Go to `Accounting --> Customers --> e-Faktur`{.interpreted-text
    role="menuselection"}. In order to be able to export customer
    invoices as e-Faktur for the Indonesian government, you need to put
    here the ranges of numbers you were assigned by the government. When
    you validate an invoice, a number will be assigned based on these
    ranges. Afterwards, you can filter the invoices still to export in
    the invoices list and click on *Action*, then on *Download
    e-Faktur*.

2.  After receiving new serial numbers from the Indonesian Revenue
    Department, you can create a set of tax invoice serial numbers group
    through this list view. You only have to specify the Min and Max of
    each serial numbers\' group and Odoo will format the number
    automatically to a 13-digits number, as requested by the Indonesia
    Tax Revenue Department.

3.  There is a counter to inform you how many unused numbers are left in
    that group.

    ![image](indonesia/indonesia-sn-count.png){.align-center}

#### Generate e-faktur csv for a single invoice or a batch invoices {#localization_indonesia/csv}

1.  Create an invoice from
    `Accounting --> Customers --> Invoices`{.interpreted-text
    role="menuselection"}. If the invoice customer\'s country is
    Indonesia and the customer is set as *ID PKP*, Odoo will allow you
    to create an e-Faktur.

2.  Set a Kode Transaksi for the e-Faktur. There are constraints related
    to the Kode transaksi and the type of VAT applied to invoice lines.

    ![image](indonesia/indonesia-kode-transaksi.png){.align-center}

3.  Odoo will automatically pick the next available serial number from
    the e-Faktur number table (see the
    `section above <localization_indonesia/tax_invoice_sn>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"}) and generate the e-faktur number as a concatenation of
    Kode Transaksi and serial number. You can see this from the invoice
    form view under the page *Extra Info* in the box *Electronic Tax*.

    ![image](indonesia/indonesia-e-faktur-sn.png){.align-center}

4.  Once the invoice is posted, you can generate and download the
    e-Faktur from the *Action* menu item *Download e-faktur*. The
    checkbox *CSV created* will be set.

    ![image](indonesia/indonesia-csv-created.png){.align-center}

5.  You can select multiple invoices in list view and generate a batch
    e-Faktur .csv.

#### Kode Transaksi FP (Transaction Code) {#localization_indonesia/kode_transaksi_fp}

The following codes are available when generating an e-Faktur. - 01
Kepada Pihak yang Bukan Pemungut PPN (Customer Biasa) - 02 Kepada
Pemungut Bendaharawan (Dinas Kepemerintahan) - 03 Kepada Pemungut Selain
Bendaharawan (BUMN) - 04 DPP Nilai Lain (PPN 1%) - 06 Penyerahan Lainnya
(Turis Asing) - 07 Penyerahan yang PPN-nya Tidak Dipungut (Kawasan
Ekonomi Khusus/ Batam) - 08 Penyerahan yang PPN-nya Dibebaskan (Impor
Barang Tertentu) - 09 Penyerahan Aktiva (Pasal 16D UU PPN)

#### Correct an invoice that has been posted and downloaded: Replace Invoice feature {#localization_indonesia/replace_invoice}

1.  Cancel the original wrong invoice in Odoo. For instance, we will
    change the Kode Transakski from 01 to 03 for the INV/2020/0001.
2.  Create a new invoice and set the canceled invoice in the *Replace
    Invoice* field. In this field, we can only select invoices in
    *Cancel* state from the same customer.
3.  As you validate, Odoo will automatically use the same e-Faktur
    serial number as the canceled and replaced invoice replacing the
    third digit of the original serial number with *1* (as requested to
    upload a replacement invoice in the e-Faktur app).

![image](indonesia/indonesia-replace-invoice.png){.align-center}

#### Correct an invoice that has been posted but not downloaded yet: Reset e-Faktur {#localization_indonesia/reset_e-faktur}

1.  Reset the invoice to draft and cancel it.
2.  Click on the button *Reset e-Faktur* on the invoice form view.
3.  The serial number will be unassigned, and we will be able to reset
    the invoice to draft, edit it and re-assign a new serial number.

![image](indonesia/indonesia-e-faktur-reset.png){.align-center}




--- SOURCE: finance/fiscal_localizations/italy.md ---

# Italy

## Configuration {#italy/modules}

`Install <general/install>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} the following
modules to get all the features of the Italian localization:

  Name                         Technical name                          Description
  ---------------------------- --------------------------------------- -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  Italy - Accounting           [l10n_it]{.title-ref}                   Default `fiscal localization package <fiscal_localizations/packages>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
  Italy - E-invoicing          [l10n_it_edi]{.title-ref}               e-invoice implementation
  Italy - E-invoicing          [l10n_it_edi_withholding]{.title-ref}   e-invoice withholding
  Italy - Accounting Reports   [l10n_it_reports]{.title-ref}           Country-specific reports
  Italy - Stock DDT            [l10n_it_stock_ddt]{.title-ref}         Transport documents - Documento di Trasporto (DDT)

![Italian localization modules](italy/italy-modules.png){.align-center}

### Company information

Configuring the company\'s information ensures your Accounting database
is properly set up. To add information, go to
`Settings --> General Settings`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"},
and in the `Companies`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section, click
`Update info`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. From here, fill out
the fields:

- `Address`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: the address of the
  company;
- `VAT`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: VAT of the company;
- `Codice Fiscale`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: the fiscal code
  of the company;
- `Tax System`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: the tax system under
  which the company falls;

![Company information to provide](italy/italy-company.png){.align-center}

### E-invoicing

The `SdI (Sistema di Interscambio)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} is
the electronic invoicing system used in Italy. It enables to send and
receive electronic invoices to and from customers. The documents must be
in XML format and formally validated by the system before being
delivered.

To be able to receive invoices and notifications, the
`SdI (Sistema di Interscambio)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} service
must be notified that the user\'s files are to be sent to **Odoo** and
processed on their behalf. To so, you must set up Odoo\'s
`Codice Destinatario`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} on the
**Agenzia Delle Entrate** portal.

1.  Go to <https://ivaservizi.agenziaentrate.gov.it/portale/> and
    authenticate;
2.  Go to section `Fatture e Corrispettivi`{.interpreted-text
    role="menuselection"};
3.  Set the user as Legal Party for the VAT number you wish to configure
    the electronic address;
4.  In
    `Servizi Disponibili --> Fatturazione Elettronica --> Registrazione
    dellâ€™indirizzo telematico dove ricevere tutte le fatture elettroniche`{.interpreted-text
    role="menuselection"}, insert Odoo\'s
    `Codice Destinatario`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
    [K95IV18]{.title-ref}, and confirm.

#### Electronic Data Interchange (EDI)

Odoo uses the **FatturaPA**
`EDI (Electronic Data Interchange)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
format for the Italian localization and is enabled on the default
journals when installed. When the **file processing authorization** has
been set, all **invoices** and **bills** are automatically sent.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

You can
`enable electronic invoicing for other sales and purchase journals
<e-invoicing/configuration>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} than the
default ones.
::::

You can check the current status of an invoice by the
`Electronic invoicing`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field. The XML
file can be found in the **chatter** of the invoice.

![Electronic invoicing status (waiting for confirmation)](italy/italy-test.png){.align-center}

::: seealso
`../accounting/customer_invoices/electronic_invoicing`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}
:::

### File processing authorization (Odoo)

Since the files are transmitted through Odoo\'s server before being sent
to the `SdI (Sistema
di Interscambio)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} or received by your
database, you need to authorize Odoo to process your files from your
database. To do so, go to `Accounting --> Configuration --> Settings -->
Electronic Document Invoicing`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}.

There are **three** modes available:

`Demo`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}

:   This mode simulates an environment in which invoices are sent to the
    government. In this mode, invoices need to be *manually* downloaded
    as XML files and uploaded to the **Agenzia delle Entrate**\'s
    website.

`Test (experimental)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}

:   This mode sends invoices to a non-production (i.e., test) service
    made available by the **Agenzia delle Entrate**. Saving this change
    directs all companies on the database to use this configuration.

`Official`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}

:   This is a production mode that sends your invoices directly to the
    **Agenzia delle Entrate**.

Once a mode is selected, you need to accept the **terms and conditions**
by ticking `Allow
Odoo to process invoices`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and then
`Save`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. You can now record your
transactions in Odoo Accounting.

:::: warning
::: title
Warning
:::

Selecting either `Test (experimental)`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} or `Official`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is
**irreversible**. Once in `Official`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
mode, it is not possible to select
`Test (experimental)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or
`Demo`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and same for
`Test (experimental)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. We recommend
creating a separate database for testing purposes only.
::::

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

When in `Test (Experimental)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} mode,
all invoices sent *must* have a partner using one of the following fake
`Codice Destinatario`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} given by the
**Agenzia Delle Entrate**: [0803HR0]{.title-ref} -
[N8MIMM9]{.title-ref} - [X9XX79Z]{.title-ref}. Any real production
`Codice Destinario`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} of your customers
will not be recognized as valid by the test service.
::::

![Italy\'s electronic document invoicing options](italy/italy-edi.png){.align-center}

## Taxes configuration

Many of the e-invoicing features are implemented using Odoo\'s tax
system. As such, it is very important that taxes are properly configured
in order to generate invoices correctly and handle other billing use
cases. For example, specific configurations are required for the
**reverse charge** type of taxes. In case of a **reverse charge** tax,
the seller does *not* charge the customer for the VAT but, instead, the
customer pays the VAT *themselves* to their government. There are
**two** main types:

- `external reverse charge <italy/external-reverse>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"};
- `internal reverse charge  <italy/internal-reverse>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}.

### External reverse charge {#italy/external-reverse}

#### Invoices

To make an export invoice, make sure that the invoice lines all use a
tax configured for **reverse charge**. The **Italian** localization
contains an **example** of a reverse charge tax for export in the EU to
be used as reference ([0% EU]{.title-ref}, invoice label
[00eu]{.title-ref}), which can be found under
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Taxes`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. Exports are exempt from VAT, and therefore
**reverse charge** taxes require the
`Has exoneration of tax (Italy)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
option ticked, with both the `Exoneration`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} kind and `Law Reference`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} filled in.

![External reverse charge settings](italy/italy-tax.png){.align-center}

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

If you need to use a different kind of `Exoneration`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, click `Action -->
Duplicate`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"} within the tax menu
to create a copy of an existing similar tax. Then, select another
`Exoneration`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
`Save`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Repeat this process as many
times as you need different kind of `Exoneration`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} taxes.
::::

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

**Rename** your taxes in the `Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
field according to their `Exoneration`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} to differentiate them easily.
::::

On your invoice, select the corresponding tax you need in the
`Taxes`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field. You can find the
following **additional info** by opening the **XML** file of the issued
invoice:

- `SdI address (Codice Destinatario)`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}: must be filled for both **EU** or **non-EU**;
- `Country Id`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: must contain the
  country of the foreign seller in the two-letter ISO (Alpha-2) code
  (ex., [IT]{.title-ref} for \'Italy\');
- `CAP`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: must be filled with
  [00000]{.title-ref};
- `Partita Iva`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} (**VAT number**):
  must contain the **VAT** number for **EU businesses** and
  [OO99999999999]{.title-ref} (double \'O\' **letter**, not \'zero\')
  for **non-EU businesses**. In case of private customers without
  **VAT** number, use [0000000]{.title-ref};
- `Fiscal Code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: for foreign entities
  without an actual **Codice Fiscale**, any recognizable identifier is
  valid.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Odoo does not support sending user-modified XML files.
::::

For **invoices**, multiple configurations are technically identified by
a `Tipo Documento`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} code:

- [TD02]{.title-ref} - Down payments;
- [TDO7]{.title-ref} - Simplified invoice;
- [TD08]{.title-ref} - Simplified credit note;
- [TD09]{.title-ref} - Simplified debit note;
- [TD24]{.title-ref} - Deferred invoice.

:::::::::: tabs
::: tab
[TD02]{.title-ref}

Down payments.

**Down payment** invoices are imported/exported with a different
`Tipo Documento`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} code
[TDO2]{.title-ref} than regular invoices. Upon import of the invoice, it
creates a regular vendor bill.

Odoo exports moves as [TD02]{.title-ref} if the following conditions are
met:

- Is an invoice;

\- All invoice lines are related to **sales order lines** that have the flag [is_downpayment]{.title-ref}

:   set as [True]{.title-ref}.
:::

::::: tab
[TD07]{.title-ref}, [TD08]{.title-ref}, and [TD09]{.title-ref}

Simplified invoices, and credit/debit notes.

Simplified invoices and credit notes can be used to certify **domestic
transactions** under **400 EUR** (VAT included). Its status is the same
as a regular invoice, but with fewer information requirements.

For a **simplified** invoice to be established, it must include:

- `Customer Invoice`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} reference:
  **unique** numbering sequence with **no gaps**;
- `Invoice Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: issue **date** of
  the invoice;
- `Company Info`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: the **seller**\'s
  full credentials (VAT/TIN number, name, full address) under
  `General Settings --> Companies (section)`{.interpreted-text
  role="menuselection"};
- `VAT`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: the **buyer**\'s VAT/TIN
  number (on their profile card);
- `Total`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: the total **amount** (VAT
  included) of the invoice.

In the `EDI (Electronic Data Interchange)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}, Odoo exports invoices as simplified if:

- It is a **domestic** transaction (i.e., the partner is from Italy);
- The buyer\'s data is **insufficient** for a regular invoice;
- The **required fields** for a regular invoice (address, ZIP code,
  city, country) are provided;
- The total amount VAT included is **less** than **400 EUR**.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The 400 EUR threshold was defined in [the decree of the 10th of May 2019
in the Gazzetta
Ufficiale](https://www.gazzettaufficiale.it/eli/id/2019/05/24/19A03271/sg).
We advise you to check the current official value.
::::
:::::

::::: tab
[TD24]{.title-ref}

Deferred invoices.

The **deferred invoice** is an invoice that is **issued at a later
time** than the sale of goods or the provision of services. A **deferred
invoice** has to be issued at the latest within the **15th day** of the
month following the delivery covered by the document.

It usually is a **summary invoice** containing a list of multiple sales
of goods or services, carried out in the month. The business is allowed
to **group** the sales into **one invoice**, generally issued at the
**end of the month** for accounting purposes. Deferred invoices are
default for **wholesaler** having recurrent clients.

If the goods are transported by a **carrier**, every delivery has an
associated **Documento di Transporto (DDT)**, or **Transport Document**.
The deferred invoice **must** indicate the details of all the **DDTs**
information for better tracing.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

E-invoicing of deferred invoices requires the
[l10n_it_stock_ddt]{.title-ref}
`module <italy/modules>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}. In this case, a
dedicated `Tipo Documento`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
[TD24]{.title-ref} is used in the e-invoice.
::::

Odoo exports moves as [TD24]{.title-ref} if the following conditions are
met:

- Is an invoice;
- Is associated to deliveries whose **DDTs** have a **different** date
  than the issuance date of the invoice.
:::::
::::::::::

#### Vendor bills

Italian companies buying goods or services from EU countries (or
services from non-EU countries) must send the information contained
within the bill received to the **Agenzia delle Entrate**. This allows
you to complete tax-related information on your bill, and to send it.
The seller must be set as `Cedente/Prestatore`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, and the buyer as
`Cessionario/Committente`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Contained
within the **XML** document for the vendor bill, the vendor\'s
credentials show as `Cedente/Prestatore`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, and your company\'s credentials as
`Cessionario/Committente`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Self-billing invoices or VAT invoice integrations must be issued and
sent to the tax agency.
::::

When inputting taxes in a vendor bill, it is possible to select
**reverse charge** taxes. These are automatically activated in the
Italian fiscal position. By going to `Accounting -->
Configuration --> Taxes`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}, the
[10%]{.title-ref} and [22%]{.title-ref} `Goods`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} and `Services`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tax
scopes are activated and preconfigured with the correct tax grids. These
are set up automatically to ensure the correct booking of accounting
entries and display of the tax report.

For **vendor bills**, **three** types of configurations are technically
identified by a code called `Tipo Documento`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}:

- [TD17]{.title-ref} - Buying services from **EU** and **non-EU**
  countries;
- [TD18]{.title-ref} - Buying **goods** from **EU**;
- [TD19]{.title-ref} - Buying **goods** from a **foreign** vendor, but
  the **goods** are already in **Italy** in a **VAT deposit**.

:::::: tabs
::: tab
[TD17]{.title-ref}

Buying **services** from **EU** and **non-EU** countries:

The foreign *seller* invoices a service with a **VAT-excluded** price,
as it is not taxable in Italy. The VAT is paid by the *buyer* in Italy;

- Within EU: the *buyer* integrates the invoice received with the **VAT
  information** due in Italy (i.e., **vendor bill tax integration**);
- Non-EU: the *buyer* sends themselves an invoice (i.e.,
  **self-billing**).

Odoo exports a transaction as [TD17]{.title-ref} if the following
conditions are met:

- Is a vendor bill;
- At least one tax on the invoice lines targets the tax grids
  `VJ <italy/grids>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"};
- All invoice lines either have `Services`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} as **products**, or a tax with the
  `Services`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} as **tax scope**.
:::

::: tab
[TD18]{.title-ref}

Buying **goods** from **EU**:

Invoices issued within the EU follow a **standard format**, therefore
only an integration of the existing invoice is required.

Odoo exports a transaction as [TD18]{.title-ref} if the following
conditions are met:

- Is a vendor bill;
- At least one tax on the invoice lines targets the tax grids
  `VJ <italy/grids>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"};
- All invoice lines either have `Consumable`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} as **products**, or a tax with the
  `Goods`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} as **tax scope**.
:::

::: tab
[TD19]{.title-ref}

Buying **goods** from a **foreign** vendor, but the **goods** are
already in **Italy** in a **VAT deposit**:

- From EU: the *buyer* integrates the invoice received with the **VAT
  information** due in Italy (i.e., **vendor bill tax integration**);
- Non-EU: the *buyer* sends an invoice to *themselves* (i.e.,
  **self-billing**).

Odoo exports a move as a [TD19]{.title-ref} if the following conditions
are met:

- Is a vendor bill;
- At least one tax on the invoice lines targets the tax grid
  `VJ3 <italy/grids>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"};
- All invoice lines either have `Consumable`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} products, or a tax with `Goods`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} as tax scope.
:::
::::::

:::: warning
::: title
Warning
:::

Odoo does not offer the [Conservazione
Sostitutiva](https://www.agid.gov.it/index.php/it/piattaforme/conservazione)
requirements. Other providers and **Agenzia delle Entrate** supply free
and certified storage to meet the requested conditions.
::::

### Internal reverse charge {#italy/internal-reverse}

:::: warning
::: title
Warning
:::

Odoo currently does not support domestic **internal reverse charge**
processes.
::::

### \'Reverse Charge\' tax grids {#italy/grids}

The Italian localization has a specific **tax grid** section for
**reverse charge** taxes. These tax grids are identifiable by the
`VJ <italy/grids>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} tag, and can be found
under
`Accounting --> Reporting --> Audit Reports: Tax Report`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}.

![Italian reverse charge tax grids](italy/italy-grids.png){.align-center}

## San Marino

### Invoices

San Marino and Italy have special agreements on e-invoicing operations.
As such, **invoices** follow the regular **reverse charge** rules.
Additional requirements are not enforced by Odoo, however, the user is
requested by the **State** to:

- Select a tax with the option
  `Has exoneration of tax (Italy)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  ticked, and the `Exoneration`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} set
  to [N3.3]{.title-ref};
- Use the generic `SdI (Sistema di Interscambio)`{.interpreted-text
  role="abbr"} `Codice Destinatario`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  [2R4GTO8]{.title-ref}. The invoice is then routed by a dedicated
  office in San Marino to the correct business.

### Bills

When a **paper bill** is received from San Marino, any Italian company
**must** submit that invoice to the **Agenzia delle Entrate** by
indicating the e-invoice\'s `Tipo Documento`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} field with the special value [TD28]{.title-ref}.

:::: tabs
::: tab
[TD28]{.title-ref}

Odoo exports a move as [TD28]{.title-ref} if the following conditions
are met:

- Is a vendor bill;
- At least one tax on the invoice lines targets the tax grids
  `VJ <italy/grids>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"};
- The **country** of the partner is **San Marino**.
:::
::::

## Pubblica amministrazione (B2G)

:::: warning
::: title
Warning
:::

Odoo does **not** send invoices directly to the government as they need
to be signed. If we see that the codice destinatario is 6 digits, then
it is not sent to the PA automatically, but you can download the XML,
sign it with an external program and send it through the portal.
::::

### Digital qualified signature

For invoices and bills intended to the **Pubblica Amministrazione
(B2G)**, a **Digital Qualified Signature** is required for all files
sent through the `SdI (Sistema di Interscambio)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}. The **XML** file must be certified using a certificate
that is either:

- a **smart card**;
- a **USB token**;
- a **Hardware Security Module (HSM)**.

### CIG, CUP, DatiOrdineAcquisto

To ensure the effective traceability of payments by public
administrations, electronic invoices issued to the public
administrations must contain:

- The `CIG (Codice Identificativo Gara)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"},
  except in cases of exclusion from traceability obligations provided by
  law n. 136 of August 13, 2010;
- The `CUP (Codice Unico di Progetto)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"},
  in case of invoices related to public works.

If the **XML** file requires it, the **Agenzia Delle Entrate** can
*only* proceed payments of electronic invoices when the **XML** file
contains a `CIG (Codice Identificativo Gara)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} and `CUP (Codice Unico di Progetto)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}. For each electronic invoice, it is **necessary** to
indicate the `CUU (Codice Univoco Ufficio)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}, which represents the unique identifier code that allows
the `SdI (Sistema di Interscambio)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} to
correctly deliver the electronic invoice to the recipient office.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

\- The `Codice Unico di Progetto)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} and
the `CIG (Codice Identificativo Gara)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
must be included in one of the **2.1.2** (DatiOrdineAcquisto), **2.1.3**
(Dati Contratto), **2.1.4** (DatiConvenzione), **2.1.5** (Date
Ricezione), or **2.1.6** (Dati Fatture Collegate) information blocks.
These correspond to the elements named `CodiceCUP`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} and `CodiceCIG`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} of
the electronic invoice **XML** file, whose table can be found on the
government [website](http://www.fatturapa.gov.it/). - The
`CUU (Codice Univoco Ufficio)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} must be
included in the electronic invoice corresponding to the element
**1.1.4** (`CodiceDestinario`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}).
::::

## Ri.Ba. (Ricevuta Bancaria)

`Ri.Ba. (Ricevuta Bancaria)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} is a payment
method widely used in Italy where vendors request payments through their
bank, which forwards the request to the customer\'s own bank and takes
responsibility for the collection. This enables payment automation and
reduces risks for the vendor.

The vendor generally uploads a fixed-format text file with the list of
payments to the bank\'s web portal.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

\- Ri.Ba. are exclusively for **domestic payments** in Italy. For
recurring international payments, please use [SEPA Direct Debt
(SDD)](../accounting/payments/batch_sdd)
::::

### Configuration

1.  Check that the [l10n_it_riba]{.title-ref} module is
    `installed <general/install>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}.

2.  Go to
    `Settings --> Users & Companies --> Companies`{.interpreted-text
    role="menuselection"} and select the company that will use Ri.Ba.

3.  Fill out the required `SIA Code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

    ![The company\'s SIA code](italy/sia-code.png)

    :::: note
    ::: title
    Note
    :::

    The `SIA Code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} identifies
    businesses within the Italian banking network and is used to receive
    money through specific payment methods. It consists of one letter
    and four digits (e.g., T1234) and can usually be found on the
    bank\'s portal or obtained by contacting the bank.
    ::::

4.  Ensure the Company\'s bank account has an Italian IBAN.

    ::: seealso
    How to configure
    `Bank Accounts <../accounting/bank>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
    :::

### Accept Ri.Ba. for your invoices

Payments of type `Ri.Ba. (Ricevuta Bancaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} can be registered from the `Invoices`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}
(`Accounting --> Customers --> Invoices`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}).

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

Make sure that your invoice involves a Partner that has a bank account
with an Italian IBAN.
::::

Then, all Payments must be grouped in a **Batch Payment**.

::: seealso
\- `Batch Payments <../accounting/payments>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} -
`Create a Batch Payment <../accounting/payments/batch>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}
:::

Once you press the `Validate`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button
for the Batch Payment, the `Ri.Ba. (Ricevuta
Bancaria)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} file is generated and attached
to the Batch Payment, so you can download it and upload it through your
bank\'s web portal.

![The Ri.Ba. file attached](italy/riba-attachment.png)




--- SOURCE: finance/fiscal_localizations/kenya.md ---

# Kenya

## Configuration {#localization/kenya/configuration}

`Install <general/install>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} the following
modules to get all the features of the Kenyan localization:

  Name                                                               Technical name                  Description
  ------------------------------------------------------------------ ------------------------------- -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  `Kenyan - Accounting`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}           [l10n_ke]{.title-ref}           Installing this module grants you access to the list of accounts used in the local GAAP and the list of common taxes (VAT, etc.).
  `Kenyan - Accounting Reports`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}   [l10n_ke_reports]{.title-ref}   Installing this module grants you access to improved accounting reports for Kenya, such as Profit and Loss and Balance Sheets.

You also have to install the **Kenya Tremol Device EDI Integration**
package to be able to report your taxes to the **Kenya Revenue Authority
(KRA)** using the Tremol G03 Control Unit:

  Name                                                                       Technical name                     Description
  -------------------------------------------------------------------------- ---------------------------------- -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  `Kenya Tremol Device EDI Integration`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}   [l10n_ke_edi_tremol]{.title-ref}   Installing this module integrates with the Kenyan G03 Tremol control unit device to report taxes to KRA through TIMS.

![The three modules for the Kenya Fiscal Localization Package on Odoo](kenya/modules.png){.align-center}

## Kenyan TIMS integration

The Kenya Revenue Authority (KRA) has decided to go digital for tax
collection through the **Tax Invoice Management System (TIMS)**. As of
December 1st, 2022, all VAT-registered persons should comply with TIMS.
The goal is to reduce VAT fraud, increase tax revenue, and increase VAT
compliance through standardization, validation, and transmission of
invoices to KRA on a real-time or near real-time basis.

All VAT-registered taxpayers should use a **compliant tax register**.
Odoo decided to develop the integration of the **Tremol G03 Control Unit
(type C)**, which can be run locally through USB. This device validates
invoices to ensure financial documents meet the new regulations and send
the validated tax invoices directly to KRA. Installing a proxy server
that provides a gateway between users and the internet is required.

### Installing the proxy server on a Windows device

Go to [odoo.com/download](https://www.odoo.com/page/download), fill out
the required information and click `Download`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}.

![Install the Proxy Server on a Windows device](kenya/download.png){.align-center}

Once it is loaded on your computer, a wizard opens. You have to read and
agree with the terms of the agreement. On the next page, select the
`type of install: Odoo IoT`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Then,
click `Next`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`Install`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Once completed, click
`Next`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Check the
`Start Odoo`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} box to be redirected to
Odoo automatically, and then click `Finish`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}.

A new page opens, confirming your
`IoT Box <../../general/iot/config/connect>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} is up and running. Connect your physical device **Tremol G03
Control Unit (type C)** to your laptop via USB. In the
`IoT Device`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section, check that your
Tremol G03 Control Unit (type C) appears, confirming the connection
between the device and your computer.

![Your IoT box is up and running](kenya/iot-box.png){.align-center}

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

If the device is not detected, try to plug it in again or click on the
`Restart`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button in the top right
corner.
::::

::: seealso
`Connect an IoT box to your database <../../general/iot/config/connect>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}
:::

### Sending the data to KRA using the Tremol G03 Control Unit

As a pre-requisite, check out that the `Kenyan Accounting modules
<localization/kenya/configuration>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} are
installed on your database. Then, go to
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Settings --> Kenya TIMS Integration section`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, and check that the
`control Unit Proxy Address`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} matches
the address of the IoT box.

To send data to KRA, create a new invoice by going to
`Accounting Dashboard -->
Customer Invoice card`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"} and
clicking `New Invoice`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Upon
confirmation of a new invoice, the
`Send invoice to Fiscal Device`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
button appears. Clicking on it sends the invoice details to the device
and from the device to the government. The
`CU Invoice Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field is now
completed in your invoice, confirming the information has been sent.

The `Tremol G03 Fiscal Device`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab
contains fields that are automatically completed once the invoice is
sent to the government:

- `CU QR Code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Url from the KRA
  portal which reflects a QR code.
- `CU Serial Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: reflects the
  serial number of the device.
- `CU Signing Date and Time`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: The
  date and time when the invoice has been sent to KRA.

If you click on `Send and Print`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, a
.pdf of the invoice is generated. The
`Kenyan Fiscal Device Info`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is
mentioned on the document.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

To verify KRA has received the invoice information, take the
`CU Invoice Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and enter it in
the `Invoice Number Checker`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section
on [Kenya Revenue Authority website](https://itax.kra.go.ke/KRA-Portal).
Click `Validate`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and find the invoice
details.
::::




--- SOURCE: finance/fiscal_localizations/luxembourg.md ---

# Luxembourg

## Configuration

`Install <general/install>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} the following
modules to get all the features of the Luxembourgish localization:

  Name                                                                   Technical name                             Description
  ---------------------------------------------------------------------- ------------------------------------------ -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  `Luxembourg - Accounting`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}           [l10n_lu]{.title-ref}                      Default `fiscal localization package <fiscal_localizations/packages>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
  `Luxembourg - Accounting Reports`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}   [l10n_lu_reports]{.title-ref}              Country-specific reports
  `Luxembourg - Annual VAT Report`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}    [l10n_lu_reports_annual_vat]{.title-ref}   Country-specific reports

![The three modules for the Luxembourgish Fiscal Localization Package on Odoo](luxembourg/modules.png){.align-center}

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

Installing the module
`Luxembourg - Accounting Reports`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
installs all three modules at once.
::::

## Standard Chart of Accounts - PCN 2020

Odoo\'s
`fiscal localization package <fiscal_localizations/packages>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} for Luxembourg includes the current **Standard Chart of
Accounts (PCN 2020)**, effective since January 2020.

## eCDF tax return

Tax returns in Luxembourg require a specific XML file to upload on the
eCDF.

To download it, go to
`Accounting --> Report --> Audit Reports --> Tax Report`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, and click on
`Export eCDF declaration`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

::: seealso
\- `../accounting/reporting/tax_returns`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} -
[Platform for electronic gathering of financial data
(eCDF)](http://www.ecdf.lu)
:::

## Annual tax report

You can generate an XML file to electronically file your annual tax
report with the tax office.

To do so, go to
`Accounting --> Report --> Luxembourg --> Annual Tax Report`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, click on `Create`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, then define the annual period in the
`Year`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field.

The **simplified annual declaration** is automatically generated. You
can manually add values in all the fields to get a **complete annual
declaration**.

![Odoo Accounting (Luxembourg localization) generates an annual tax declaration.](luxembourg/annual-tax-report.png){.align-center}

To help you complete it, you can use the information provided on the
`Tax Report`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. To do so, go to
`Accounting --> Report --> Audit Reports --> Tax Report`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, then click on the `Tax Report`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} dropdown menu and select the type of report you want to
display.

![Dropdown menu to select the type of Tax Report](luxembourg/tax-report-types.png){.align-center}

Finally, click on `Export XML`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to
download the XML file.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

This feature requires the module
`Luxembourg - Annual VAT Report`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to
be installed.
::::

## FAIA (SAF-T)

**FAIA (Fichier d'Audit InformatisÃ© AED)** is a standardized and
structured file that facilitates the exchange of information between the
taxpayers\' accounting system and the tax office. It is the
Luxembourgish version of the OECD-recommended SAF-T (Standard Audit File
for Tax).

Odoo can generate an XML file that contains all the content of an
accounting period according to the rules imposed by the Luxembourg tax
authorities on digital audit files.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

This feature requires the module
`Luxembourg - Accounting Reports`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to
be installed.
::::

### Export FAIA file

Go to
`Accounting --> Reporting --> Audit Reports -->  General Ledger`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, then click on `FAIA`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}.




--- SOURCE: finance/fiscal_localizations/mexico.md ---

# Mexico

## Webinars

A video on the Mexican localization is also available. This video covers
how to implement this localization from scratch, including how to set up
the configurations, how to complete common workflows, and provides an
in-depth look at several specific use cases, as well.

- [Video webinar of a complete
  demo](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5cdogjm0GCI).

## Introduction

The Odoo Mexican localization modules allow for the signing of
electronic invoices, according to the specifications of the
`SAT (Servicio de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} for [version 4.0 of the
CFDI](http://omawww.sat.gob.mx/tramitesyservicios/Paginas/documentos/Anexo_20_Guia_de_llenado_CFDI.pdf),
a legal requirement, as of January 1, 2022. These modules also add
relevant accounting reports (such as: the
`DIOT (DeclaraciÃ³n Informativa de Operaciones con Terceros)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}, enables foreign trade, and the creation of delivery
guides).

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

In order to electronically sign any documents in Odoo, ensure the *Sign*
application is installed.
::::

## Configuration

### Requirements

It is necessary to meet the following requirements before configuring
the Mexican localization modules in Odoo:

::: {#mx-requirements}
1.  Be registered in the
    `SAT (Servicio de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
    role="abbr"}, with a valid
    `RFC (Registro Federal de Contribuyentes)`{.interpreted-text
    role="abbr"}.
2.  Have a [Certificate of Digital
    Seal](https://www.gob.mx/sat/acciones-y-programas/certificado-de-sello-digital)
    (CSD).
3.  Choose a PAC (Proveedor Autorizado de CertificaciÃ³n / Authorized
    Certification Provider). Currently, Odoo works with the following
    `PAC (Proveedor Autorizado de CertificaciÃ³n / Authorized Certification
    Provider)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}s: [SoluciÃ³n
    Factible](https://solucionfactible.com/), [Quadrum (formerly
    Finkok)](https://cfdiquadrum.com.mx/) and [SW Sapien - Smarter
    Web](https://sw.com.mx/).
4.  Have knowledge and experience with billing, sales, and accounting in
    Odoo. This documentation **only** contains the necessary information
    needed to use Odoo.
:::

### Installing modules

`Install <general/install>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} the following
modules to get all the features of the Mexican localization. The
