`Accounting <../accounting>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} and
*Contacts* modules are required to be installed for this configuration:

  -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  Name                                                             Technical name                          Description
  ---------------------------------------------------------------- --------------------------------------- --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  `Mexico - Accounting`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}         [l10n_mx]{.title-ref}                   The default `fiscal localization package <../fiscal_localizations>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"},
                                                                                                           adds accounting characteristics for the Mexican localization, such as: the most common taxes and
                                                                                                           the chart of accounts -- based on [the SAT account grouping
                                                                                                           code](https://www.gob.mx/cms/uploads/attachment/file/151586/codigo_agrupador.pdf).

  `EDI for Mexico`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}              [l10n_mx_edi]{.title-ref}               Includes all the technical and functional requirements to generate and validate
                                                                                                           `Electronics Documents <../accounting/customer_invoices/electronic_invoicing>`{.interpreted-text
                                                                                                           role="doc"} --- based on the technical documentation published by the
                                                                                                           `SAT (Servicio de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}. This allows you to
                                                                                                           send invoices (with or without addedums) and payment complements to the government.

  `EDI v4.0 for Mexico`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}         [l10n_mx_edi_40]{.title-ref}            Necessary to create XML documents with the correct specifications of the CFDI 4.0.

  `Odoo Mexican Localization Reports`{.interpreted-text            [l10n_mx_reports]{.title-ref}           Adapts reports for Mexico\'s Electronic Accounting: Chart of Accounts, Trial Balance, and
  role="guilabel"}                                                                                         `DIOT (DeclaraciÃ³n Informativa de Operaciones con Terceros)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}.

  `Mexico - Localization Reports for Closing`{.interpreted-text    [l10n_mx_reports_closing]{.title-ref}   Necessary to create the Closing Entry (Also known as the *month 13th move*).
  role="guilabel"}                                                                                         

  `Odoo Mexican XML Polizas Export`{.interpreted-text              [l10n_mx_xml_polizas]{.title-ref}       Allows the export of XML files of Journal Entries for a compulsory audit.
  role="guilabel"}                                                                                         

  `Odoo Mexican XML Polizas Export Edi bridge`{.interpreted-text   [l10n_mx_xml_polizas_edi]{.title-ref}   Complements the module [l10n_mx_xml_polizas]{.title-ref}.
  role="guilabel"}                                                                                         
  -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

When installing a database from scratch and selecting
`Mexico`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} as the country, Odoo
automatically installs the following modules:
`Mexico - Accounting`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, `EDI for
Mexico`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
`EDI v4.0 for Mexico`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
::::

The following modules are optional. It\'s recommended to install them
*only* if meeting a specific requirement. Make sure that they are needed
for the business.

  ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  Name                                                                Technical name                          Description
  ------------------------------------------------------------------- --------------------------------------- ------------------------------------
  `EDI for Mexico (Advanced Features)`{.interpreted-text              [l10n_mx_edi_extended]{.title-ref}      Adds the external trade complement
  role="guilabel"}                                                                                            to invoices: A legal requirement for
                                                                                                              selling products to foreign
                                                                                                              countries.

  `EDI v4.0 for Mexico (COMEX)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}    [l10n_mx_edi_extended_40]{.title-ref}   Adapts the module
                                                                                                              [l10n_mx_edi_extended]{.title-ref}
                                                                                                              for CFDI 4.0.

  `Mexico - Electronic Delivery Guide`{.interpreted-text              [l10n_mx_edi_stock]{.title-ref}         Lets you create a *Carta Porte*: A
  role="guilabel"}                                                                                            bill of lading that proves to the
                                                                                                              government you are sending goods
                                                                                                              between A & B with a signed
                                                                                                              electronic document.

  `Electronic Delivery Guide for Mexico CFDI 4.0`{.interpreted-text   [l10n_mx_edi_stock_40]{.title-ref}      Adapts the module
  role="guilabel"}                                                                                            [l10n_mx_edi_stock]{.title-ref} for
                                                                                                              CFDI 4.0

  `Odoo Mexico Localization for Stock/Landing`{.interpreted-text      [l10n_mx_edi_landing]{.title-ref}       Allows managing customs numbers
  role="guilabel"}                                                                                            related to landed costs in
                                                                                                              electronic documents.
  ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

### Configure your company

After installing the correct modules, the next step is to verify that
your company is configured with the correct data. To do so, go to
`Settings --> General Settings --> Companies`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, and select `Update Info`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} under your company name.

Enter the full `Address`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in the
resulting form, including: `ZIP`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
code, `State`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`Country`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
`RFC (Registro Federal de Contribuyentes)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} (`VAT`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} number).

According to the requirements of the CFDI 4.0, the name of the main
company contact **must** coincide with your business name registered in
the `SAT (Servicio de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}, without the legal entity abbreviation.

![Main company contact requirements for a correct invoicing.](mexico/mx-company-info.png){.align-center}

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

From a legal point of view, a Mexican company **must** use the local
currency (MXN). Therefore, Odoo does not provide features to manage an
alternative configuration. If you want to manage another currency, let
MXN be the default currency and use a `pricelist
<../../sales/sales/products_prices/prices/pricing>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}, instead.
::::

Next, go to
`Settings --> Accounting --> Electronic Invoicing (MX) --> Fiscal
Regime`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}, then select the regime
that applies to your company from the drop-down list, and click
`Save`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

![Fiscal regime configuration in the Accounting settings.](mexico/mx-fiscal-regime.png){.align-center}

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

If you want to test the Mexican localization, the company can be
configured with a real address within Mexico (including all fields), and
add [EKU9003173C9]{.title-ref} as the `VAT`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} and [ESCUELA KEMPER URGATE]{.title-ref} as the
`Company Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. For the
`Fiscal Regime`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, use
`General de Ley Personas Morales`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
::::

### Contacts

To create a contact that can be invoiced, go to
`Contacts --> Create`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}. Then,
enter the contact name, full `Address`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} including: `ZIP`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
code, `State`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`Country`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
`RFC (Registro Federal de Contribuyentes)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} (`VAT`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} number).

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

As with your own company, all of your contacts needs to have their
correct business name registered in the
`SAT (Servicio de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}. This also applies to the `Fiscal Regime`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, which needs to be added in the
`MX EDI`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab.
::::

### Taxes

Some additional configurations for factor type and tax objects need to
be added to the sales taxes in order to properly sign invoices.

#### Factor type

The *Factor Type* field is pre-loaded in the default taxes. If new taxes
are created, you need to make sure to configure this field. To do so, go
to `Accounting --> Configuration -->
Taxes`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}, then enable the
`Factor Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field in the
`Advanced Options`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab for all
records, with the `Tax Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} set as
`Sales`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

![Factor Type Sales tax type configuration.](mexico/mx-factor-type.png){.align-center}

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

Mexico manages two different kinds of 0% VAT to accommodate two
scenarios:

- *0% VAT* set the `Factor Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} as
  `Tasa`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- *VAT Exempt* set the `Factor Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  as `Exento`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
::::

#### Tax object

One requirement of the CFDI 4.0 is that the resulting XML file needs (or
does not need) to break down the taxes of the operation. There are three
different possible values that are added in the XML file:

- \`01\`: Not subject to tax - this value is added automatically if your
  invoice line doesn\'t contain any taxes.
- \`02\`: Subject to tax - this is the default configuration of any
  invoice line that contains taxes.
- \`03\`: Subject to tax and not forced to break down - this value can
  be triggered on-demand for certain customers to replace the value 02.

To use the [03]{.title-ref} value, navigate to
`Contacts --> your customer's invoice --> MX EDI
tab`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}, and activate the
`No Tax Breakdown`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} checkbox.

![No Tax Breakdown option on the MX EDI tab of the customer\'s invoice.](mexico/mx-tax-breakdown.png){.align-center}

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

The `No Tax Breakdown`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} value applies
**only** to specific fiscal regimes and/or taxes. Consult your
accountant first to see if it is needed for your business before making
any modification.
::::

#### Other tax configurations

When registering a payment, Odoo will carry out the movement of taxes
from the *Cash Basis Transition Account* to the account set in the
`Definition`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab. For such movement,
a tax base account will be used: ([Base Imponible de Impuestos en Base a
Flujo de Efectivo]{.title-ref}) in the journal entry when reclassifying
taxes. **Do not delete this account**.

If you create a new tax in
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Taxes`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, you need to add the correct
`Tax Grids`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} for it
([IVA]{.title-ref}, [ISR]{.title-ref} or [IEPS]{.title-ref}). Odoo
**only** supports these three groups of taxes.

![Tax accounts available for Odoo.](mexico/mx-taxes-config.png){.align-center}

### Products

To configure products, go to
`Accounting --> Customers --> Products`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, then select a product to configure, or
`Create`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} a new one. In the
`Accounting`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab, and in the
`UNSPSC Product Category`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field,
select the category that represents the product. The process can be done
manually, or through
`a bulk import <../../essentials/export_import_data>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

All products need to have an
`SAT (Servicio de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} code associated with them in order to prevent validation
errors.
::::

### Electronic invoicing

#### PAC credentials

After you have processed your [Private Key
(CSD)](https://www.sat.gob.mx/aplicacion/16660/genera-y-descarga-tus-archivos-a-traves-de-la-aplicacion-certifica)
with the `SAT (Servicio de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}, you **must** register directly with the
`PAC <mx-requirements>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} of your choice
before you start creating invoices from Odoo.

Once you\'ve created your account with any of these providers, go to
`Settings -->
Accounting --> Electronic Invoicing (MX)`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. Under the `MX PAC`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} section, enter the name of your
`PAC (Proveedor Autorizado de CertificaciÃ³n / Authorized Certification
Provider)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} with your credentials
(`PAC username`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`PAC password`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}).

![Configuring PAC credentials from the Accounting settings.](mexico/mx-pac-account.png){.align-center}

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

If you do not have credentials, but want to test the electronic
invoicing, you can activate the
`MX PAC test environment`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} checkbox,
and select `Solucion Factible`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} as the
`PAC (Proveedor Autorizado de CertificaciÃ³n / Authorized Certification
Provider)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}. You do not need to add a
username or password for a test environment.
::::

#### .cer and .key certificates

The [digital certificates of the
company](https://www.gob.mx/tramites/ficha/certificado-de-sello-digital/SAT139)
must be uploaded within the `MX Certificates`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} section. To do so, navigate to `Settings -->
Accounting --> Electronic Invoicing (MX)`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. Under the `MX Certificates`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} section, select `Add a line`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, and a window will open. Click
`Create`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and from there, upload your
digital `Certificate`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
(`.cer`{.interpreted-text role="file"} file), your
`Certificate Key`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
(`.key`{.interpreted-text role="file"} file), and your
`Certificate Password`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. To finish,
click on `Save
& Close`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

![Certificate and key upload inputs.](mexico/mx-certificates.png){.align-center}

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

If you still do not have one of the contracted
`PAC (Proveedor Autorizado de CertificaciÃ³n / Authorized Certification
Provider)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}s and you want to test
electronic invoicing, you can use the following
`SAT (Servicio de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} test certificates:

- `Certificate <mexico/certificate.cer>`{.interpreted-text
  role="download"}
- `Certificate Key <mexico/certificate.key>`{.interpreted-text
  role="download"}
- **Password**: `12345678a`
::::

## Workflows

### Electronic invoicing

The invoicing process in Odoo is based on [Annex
20](http://omawww.sat.gob.mx/tramitesyservicios/Paginas/anexo_20.htm)
version 4.0 of electronic invoicing of the
`SAT (Servicio de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}.

#### Customer invoices

To start invoicing from Odoo, a customer invoice must be created using
the `standard invoicing
flow <../accounting/customer_invoices>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}.

While the document is in draft mode, changes can be made to it (the
correct `Payment Way`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or
`Usage`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} that the customer might
require can be added, for example.)

After you `Confirm`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} the customer
invoice, a blue message appears stating: `The
invoice will be processed asynchronously by the following E-invoicing service: CFDI (4.0)`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}.

Pressing the `Process Now`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button
sends the document to the government so it can be signed. After
receiving the signed document back from the government, the
`Fiscal Folio`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field appears on the
document, and the XML file is attached in the chatter.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

If you click `Retry`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in the
`SAT status`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field on the invoice,
you can confirm if the XML file is valid in the
`SAT (Servicio de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}.

If you are in a testing environment, you will always receive the message
`Not Found`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
::::

To send the signed invoice to your client by mail, you can send both the
XML and PDF files together, directly from Odoo, by clicking the
`Send & Print`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button. You can also
download the PDF file to your computer, by clicking the
`Print`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button, and selecting the
desired print option.

#### Credit notes

While an invoice is a document type \"I\" (Ingreso), a credit note is a
document type \"E\" (Egreso).

The only addition to the `standard flow for credit notes
<../accounting/customer_invoices/credit_notes>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} is that, as a requirement of the
`SAT (Servicio de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}, there has to be a relation between a credit note and an
invoice through the fiscal folio.

Because of this requirement, the field `CFDI Origin`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} adds this relation with a [01\|]{.title-ref}, followed
by the fiscal folio of the original invoice.

![Example CFDI Origin number.](mexico/mx-creating-credit-note.png){.align-center}

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

For the `CFDI Origin`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field to be
automatically added, use the `Add Credit
Note`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button from the invoice,
instead of creating it manually.
::::

#### Payment complements

##### Payment policy

One addition of the Mexican localization is the
`Payment Policy`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field. According to
the SAT documentation, there are two types of payments:

- [PUE]{.title-ref} (Pago en una Sola ExhibiciÃ³n/Payment in a Single
  Exhibition)

- [PPD]{.title-ref} (Pago en Parcialidades o Diferido/Payment in
  Installements or Deferred)

  > ::: seealso
  > `../../inventory_and_mrp/inventory/product_management/inventory_valuation/integrating_landed_costs`{.interpreted-text
  > role="doc"}
  > :::

The difference lies in the *Due Date* or *Payment Terms* of the invoice.

To configure
`PUE (Pago en una Sola ExhibiciÃ³n/Payment in a Single Exhibition)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} invoices, navigate to
`Accounting --> Customers --> Invoices`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, and either select an invoice
`Due Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} within the same month, or
choose a payment term that does not imply changing the due month
(immediate payment, 15 days, 21 days, all falling within the current
month).

![Example of an invoice with the PUE requirements.](mexico/mx-pue-payment.png){.align-center}

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

Some `Payment Terms`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} are already
installed by default, and can be managed from
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Payment Terms`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}.
::::

To configure
`PPD (Pago en Parcialidades o Diferido/Payment in Installements or
Deferred)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} invoices, navigate to
`Accounting --> Customers --> Invoices`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, and select an invoice with a
`Due Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} after the first day of the
following month. This also applies if your
`Payment Term`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is due in the
following month.

![Example of an invoice with the PPD requirements.](mexico/mx-ppd-payment.png){.align-center}

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

Because the
`PPD (Pago en Parcialidades o Diferido/Payment in Installements or
Deferred)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} policy implies that an invoice
is not going to get paid at the moment, the correct
`Payment Way`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} for the
`PPD (Pago en Parcialidades o Diferido/Payment in Installements or
Deferred)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} invoices is
`99 - Por Definir`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} (To define).
::::

##### Payment flow

In both cases, the payment process in Odoo
`is the same <../accounting/customer_invoices>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}, the main difference being payments related to
`PPD (Pago en Parcialidades o Diferido/Payment in Installements or
Deferred)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} invoices trigger the creation
of a document type \"P\" (Pago).

If a payment is related to a
`PUE (Pago en una Sola ExhibiciÃ³n/Payment in a Single Exhibition)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} invoice, it can be registered with the wizard, and be
associated with the corresponding invoice. To do so, navigate to
`Accounting --> Customers -->
Invoices`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}, and select an
invoice. Then, click the `Register Payment`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} button. The invoice status changes to
`In Payment`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, since the payment is
effectively validated when it is bank reconciled.

::: seealso
`../accounting/bank/reconciliation`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
:::

While this process is the same for PPD invoices, the addition of the
creating an `electronic
document <../accounting/customer_invoices/electronic_invoicing>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} means some additional requirements are needed to correctly
send the document to the
`SAT (Servicio de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}.

From an invoice, you need to confirm the specific
`Payment Way`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} where you received the
payment. Because of this, the `Payment Way`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} field **cannot** be set as [99 - Por Definir (To
Define)]{.title-ref}.

If you are going to add a bank account number in the
`Accounting`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab of a customer\'s
contact card, it must have a valid account number.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The exact configurations are in the [Anexo 20 of the
SAT](http://omawww.sat.gob.mx/tramitesyservicios/Paginas/anexo_20.htm).
Usually, the `Bank Account`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} needs to
be 10 or 18 digits for transfers, 16 for credit or debit cards.
::::

If a payment is related to a signed invoice with the
`Payment Policy`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} [PPD]{.title-ref},
Odoo generates the corresponding payment complement automatically, once
you click `Process
Now`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

![CFDI (4.0) E-invoicing service process payment now message.](mexico/mx-signed-complement.png){.align-center}

:::: warning
::: title
Warning
:::

A payment in MXN **cannot** be used to pay multiple invoices in USD.
Instead, the payment should be separated into multiple payments, using
the `Register Payment`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button on the
corresponding invoices.
::::

#### Invoice cancellations

It is possible to cancel the EDI documents sent to the
`SAT (Servicio de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}. According to the [Reforma Fiscal
2022](https://www.sat.gob.mx/consultas/91447/nuevo-esquema-de-cancelacion),
since January 1st, 2022, there are two requirements for this:

- With all cancellation requests, you **must** specify a *cancellation
  reason*.
- After 24 hours have passed since the creation of the invoice, the
  client **must** be asked to accept the cancellation.

There are four different cancellation reasons. In Odoo, you can cancel
invoices with the reasons *01 Invoices sent with errors with a
relation*, and *02 Invoices sent with errors without a relation*.

The following sections break down the process of canceling invoices for
each cancellation reason in Odoo.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

Odoo has certain limitations to canceling invoices in the
`SAT (Servicio de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}: The reasons 03 and 04 (*Operation did not take place* and
*Nominative transactions related to a global invoice*, respectively) are
not currently supported by Odoo. For this, you need to cancel the
invoice directly in the
`SAT (Servicio de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}, and press `Retry`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in
the `SAT Status field`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
::::

##### 01 - invoices sent with errors with a relation

This cancellation reason must be used when a new invoice needs to
substitute the original one, due to an error in any field.

Begin by navigating to
`Accounting --> Customers --> Invoices`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, and select the old invoice. Copy the
`Fiscal Folio`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} from the old invoice.
Then, navigate to the new invoice, and in the
`CFDI Origin`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field, add the value
[04\|]{.title-ref} and paste the `Fiscal Folio`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} of the old invoice after the value. Finally, sign the
new document.

Next, navigate back to the old invoice, and notice the
`Substituted By`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field is now
available. Click the `Request EDI Cancellation`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} button on the old invoice, and then click
`Process Now`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in the blue section
that appears. The invoice status changes to `Canceled`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, and a confirmation is logged in the chatter.

Now, the invoice should be canceled in the
`SAT (Servicio de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} as well. You can confirm this was done correctly, by
pressing `Retry`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in the
`SAT (Servicio de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} status field.

If the document was canceled more than 24 hours after its creation, you
may need to ask the client to accept the cancellation in their "BuzÃ³n
Tributario" directly from the [SAT
website](https://www.sat.gob.mx/home).

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The [04\|]{.title-ref} is only a code that helps Odoo to perform this
process. It has no relation to the method 04 reason for cancellation.
::::

![Old invoice with CFDI Origin.](mexico/mx-01-invoice-cancellation-substitute.png){.align-center}

![Invoice with the Substituted By field referencing the CFDI Origin invoice.](mexico/mx-01-invoice-cancellation.png){.align-center}

##### 02 - invoices sent with errors without a relation

This cancellation reason has to be used when an invoice was sent with an
error in any field, and does not need to be replaced by another one.

For this case, navigate to
`Accounting --> Customers --> Invoices`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, and select the old invoice. From here, the only
requirement is to click the `Request EDI Cancellation`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} button, and then click the
`Process Now`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button.

Because the field `Substituted By`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
does not appear when using this cancellation reason, the
`SAT (Servicio de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} should automatically detect that the cancellation reason is
02.

##### Payment cancellations

It is also possible to cancel *Payment Complements*. For this, go to the
payment, via `Accounting --> Customers --> Payments`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, and select `Request EDI
Cancellation`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. As with invoices, a
blue button will appear. Click `Process now`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, and the document will be sent to the
`SAT (Servicio de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}. After a few seconds, you can click
`Retry`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to confirm the current
`SAT (Servicio de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} status.

Finally, the payment status is moved to `Cancelled`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Just like invoices, when you create a new *Payment Complement*, you can
add the relation of the original document, by adding a
[04\|]{.title-ref} plus the fiscal folio in the
`CFDI Origin`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field.
::::

#### Invoicing special use cases

##### CFDI to public

If the customer you are selling goods or services to does not require an
invoice, a *CFDI to Public* has to be created.

If you use the `Customer`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} name
[PUBLICO EN GENERAL]{.title-ref}, an error will be triggered. This is a
main change in the CFDI 4.0 that requires invoices with that specific
name to need additional fields, which Odoo does not currently support.
So, for a *CFDI to Public* to be created, you need to add any name to
your customer that is **not** [PUBLICO EN GENERAL]{.title-ref}. (For
example: [CLIENTE FINAL]{.title-ref}).

In addition to this, it is required that the `ZIP`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} code of your company is added, the generic
`RFC (Registro Federal de Contribuyentes)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} is set as [XAXX010101000]{.title-ref}, and the
`Fiscal Regime`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} of your customer must
be set as: [Sin obligaciones fiscales]{.title-ref}.

![CFDI to Public Customer field configuration.](mexico/mx-cfdi-to-public.png){.align-center}

##### Multicurrency

The main currency in Mexico is MXN. While this is mandatory for all
Mexican companies, it is possible to send and receive invoices (and
payments) in different currencies. To enable the use of
`multicurrency <../accounting/get_started/multi_currency>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}, navigate to the
`Accounting --> Settings --> Currencies`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, and set `Mexican Bank`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} as the `Service`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in
the `Automatic Currency Rates`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
section. Then, set the `Interval`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
field to the frequency you wish to update the exchange rates.

This way, the XML file of the document will have the correct exchange
rate, and the total amount, in both the foreign currency and in MXN.

It is highly recommended to use `a bank account for each currency
<../accounting/bank/foreign_currency>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The only currencies that automatically update their exchange rate daily
are: USD, EUR, GBP, and JPY.
::::

![Multi-currency configuration in the Accounting settings.](mexico/mx-multicurrency-1.png){.align-center}

##### Down payments

There can be cases where you receive a payment in advance from a
customer that needs to be applied to an invoice later. In order to do
this in Odoo, it is required to properly link invoices to each other
with the `CFDI Origin`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field. To do
so, it is necessary to have the `Sales
<../../sales>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} app installed.

::: seealso
[The official documentation for registration of down payments in
Mexico](http://omawww.sat.gob.mx/tramitesyservicios/Paginas/documentos/Caso_uso_Anticipo.pdf).
:::

First, navigate to the `Sales`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}
app to create a product [Anticipo]{.title-ref} and configure it. The
`Product Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} must be
`Service`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and use the
`UNSPSC Category`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} must be: [84111506
Servicios de facturaciÃ³n]{.title-ref}.

Then, go to
`Sales --> Settings --> Invoicing --> Down Payments`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, and add the *Anticipo* product as the default.

Create a sales order with the total amount, and create a down payment
(either using a percentage or fixed amount). Then, sign the document,
and `Register the Payment`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

When the time comes for the customer to get the final invoice, create it
again from the same sales order. In the
`Create Invoices`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} wizard, select
`Regular Invoice`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and uncheck
`Deduct down payments`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

Then, copy the `Fiscal Folio`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} from
the first invoice, and paste it into the `CDFI Origin`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} of the second invoice, adding the prefix
[07\|]{.title-ref} before the value. Then, sign the document.

After this, create a credit note for the first invoice. Copy the
`Fiscal Folio`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} from the second
invoice, and paste it in the `CFDI Origin`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} of the credit note, adding the prefix
[07\|]{.title-ref}. Then, sign the document.

With this, all electronic documents are linked to each other. The final
step is to fully pay the new invoice. At the bottom of the new invoice,
you can find the credit note in the
`Outstanding credits`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} - add it as
payment. Finally, register the remaining amount with the
`Register Payment`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} wizard.

### External trade

The external trade is a complement to a regular invoice that adds
certain values in both the XML and PDF, to invoices with a foreign
customer according to [SAT
regulations](http://omawww.sat.gob.mx/tramitesyservicios/Paginas/complemento_comercio_exterior.htm),
such as:

- The specific address of the receiver and the sender
- The addition of a `Tariff Fraction`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  that identifies the type of product
- The correct `Incoterm`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  (International Commercial Terms), among others (*certificate of
  origin* and *special units of measure*).

This allows the correct identification of exporters and importers, in
addition to expanding the description of the merchandise sold.

Since January 1, 2018, external trade is a requirement for taxpayers,
who carry export operations of type A1. While the current CFDI is 4.0,
the external trade is currently on version 1.1

In order to use this feature, the modules
`l10n_mx_edi_extended`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`l10n_mx_edi_extended_40`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} have to be
installed.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

Before installing, make sure your business needs to use this feature.
Consult your accountant first, if needed, before installing any modules.
::::

#### Configuration

##### Contacts

To configure your company contact for external trade, navigate to
`Accounting -->
Customers --> Customers`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}, and
select your `Company`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. While the CFDI
4.0 requirements ask you to add a valid `ZIP`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} code in your contact, the external trade complement
adds the requirement that your `City`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
and the `State`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} must also be valid.
All three fields must coincide with the [Official SAT
Catalog](http://omawww.sat.gob.mx/tramitesyservicios/Paginas/catalogos_emision_cfdi_complemento_ce.htm),
or you will receive an error.

:::: warning
::: title
Warning
:::

Add the `City`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`State`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in the company\'s *contact*,
not in the company itself. You can find your company\'s contact in
`Accounting --> Customers -->
Customers`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}.
::::

The fields `Locality`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`Colony Code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} are optional and can be
added in the company directly in
`Settings --> General Settings --> Companies`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. These two fields have to coincide with the data
in the `SAT (Servicio de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}.

![Optional external trade company fields.](mexico/mx-external-trade-rescompany.png){.align-center}

To configure the contact data for a foreign receiving client, navigate
to `Accounting
--> Customers --> Customers`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"},
and select the foreign client\'s contact. The contact must have the
following fields completed to avoid errors:

1.  The entire company `Address`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
    including a valid `ZIP`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} code and
    the foreign `Country`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
2.  The format of the foreign `VAT`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
    (tax identification number, for example: Colombia
    [123456789-1]{.title-ref})
3.  In the `MX EDI`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab, you need to
    address if the customer receives goods for a period of time
    temporarily (`Temporary`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}) or
    permanently (`Definitive`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}).

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

If the new contact was created by duplicating another existing contact
from Mexico, make sure to delete any carried over information from the
`Fiscal Regime`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field. In addition,
do not enable the `No Tax Breakdown`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
option. Selecting this option hides mandatory fields that are required
for external trade contact configuration.
::::

![Required external trade customer fields.](mexico/mx-external-trade-customer-contact.png){.align-center}

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

In the resulting XML and PDF files, the `VAT`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} is automatically replaced by the generic VAT for abroad
transactions: [XEXX010101000]{.title-ref}.
::::

##### Products

All products involved with external trade have four fields that are
required, two of them exclusive to external trade.

1.  The `Internal Reference`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} of the
    product is in the `General Information`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} tab.
2.  The `Weight`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} of the product must
    be more than [0]{.title-ref}.
3.  The
    [correct](https://www.ventanillaunica.gob.mx/vucem/Clasificador.html)
    `Tariff
    Fraction`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} of the product in the
    `Accounting`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab.
4.  The `UMT Aduana`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} corresponds to
    the `Tariff Fraction`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

![Required external trade product fields.](mexico/mx-external-trade-product.png){.align-center}

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

\- If the UoM code of the `Tariff Fraction`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} is [01]{.title-ref}, the correct
`UMT Aduana`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is [kg]{.title-ref}. -
If the UoM code of the `Tariff Fraction`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} is [06]{.title-ref}, the correct
`UMT Aduana`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is [Units]{.title-ref}.
::::

#### Invoicing flow

Before creating an invoice, it is important to take into account that
external trade invoices require to convert the amounts of your product
into USD. Therefore, `multicurrency
<../accounting/get_started/multi_currency>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} **must** be enabled and *USD* **must** be activated in the
`Currencies`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section. The correct
`Service`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to run is `Mexican
Bank`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

Then, with the correct exchange rate set up in
`Accounting --> Settings -->
Currency`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}, the only fields left
are `Incoterm`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and the optional
`Certificate
Source`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in the
`Other Info`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab.

![External trade Other Info tab of a product.](mexico/mx-external-trade-other-info.png){.align-center}

Finally, sign the invoice with the same process as a regular invoice,
and click the `Process Now`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button.

### Delivery guide

A [Carta
Porte](https://www.sat.gob.mx/consultas/68823/complemento-carta-porte-)
is a bill of lading: a document that states the type, quantity, and
destination of goods being carried.

On December 1st, 2021, version 2.0 of this CFDI was implemented for all
transportation providers, intermediaries, and owners of goods. Odoo is
able to generate a document type \"T\" (Traslado), which, unlike other
documents, is created in a delivery order instead of an invoice or
payment.

Odoo can create XML and PDF files with (or without) ground transport,
and can process materials that are treated as *Dangerous Hazards*.

In order to use this feature, the modules
`l10n_mx_edi_extended`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`l10n_mx_edi_extended_40`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`l10n_mx_edi_stock`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`l10n_mx_edi_stock_40`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} have to be
installed.

In addition to this, it is necessary to have the `Inventory
<../../inventory_and_mrp/inventory>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} and
`Sales <../../sales/sales>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} apps
installed, as well.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

Odoo does not support Carta Porte type document type \"I\" (Ingreso),
air, or marine transport. Consult your accountant first if this feature
is needed before doing any modifications.
::::

#### Configuration

Odoo manages two different types of CFDI:

- **No Federal Highways**: Is used when the *Distance to Destination* is
  [less than 30
  KM](http://omawww.sat.gob.mx/cartaporte/Paginas/documentos/PreguntasFrecuentes_Autotransporte.pdf).
- **Federal Transport**: Is used when the *Distance to Destination*
  exceeds 30 KM.

Other than the standard requirements of regular invoicing (The
`RFC (Registro Federal de Contribuyentes)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} of the customer, the UNSPSC code, etc.), if you are using
*No Federal Highways*, no external configuration is needed.

For *Federal Transport*, several configurations have to be added to
contacts, vehicle setups, and products. Those configurations are added
to the XML and PDF files.

##### Contacts and vehicles

Like the external trade feature, the `Address`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} in both the company and the final customer must be
complete. The `ZIP`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} code,
`City`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and `State`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} must coincide with the [Official SAT Catalog for Carta
Porte \<sat-catalog\_\>\_]{.title-ref}.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

The field, `Locality`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, is optional
for both addresses.
::::

![Delivery guide contact configuration.](mexico/mx-delivery-guide-contacts.png){.align-center}

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

The origin address used for the delivery guide is set in `Inventory -->
Configuration --> Warehouses Management --> Warehouses`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. While this is set as the company address by
default, you can change it according to your correct warehouse address.
::::

Another addition to this feature is the
`Vehicle Setups`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} menu found in
`Inventory --> Settings --> Mexico`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. This menu lets you add all the information
related to the vehicle used for the delivery order.

All fields are mandatory to create a correct delivery guide.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

The fields, `Vehicle Plate Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
and `Number Plate`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, must contain
between 5 to 7 characters.
::::

In the `Intermediaries`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section, you
must add the operator of the vehicle. The only mandatory fields for this
contact are the `VAT`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`Operator Licence`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

![Delivery guide vehicle configuration.](mexico/mx-delivery-guide-vehicle.png){.align-center}

##### Products

Similar to regular invoicing, all products must have a
`UNSPSC category`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. In addition to
this, there are two extra configurations for products involved in
delivery guides:

- The `Product Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} must be set as
  `Storable Product`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} for stock
  movements to be created.
- In the `Inventory`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab, the field
  `Weight`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} should have more than
  [0]{.title-ref}.

:::: warning
::: title
Warning
:::

Creating a delivery guide of a product with the value [0]{.title-ref}
will trigger an error. As the `Weight`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} has been already stored in the delivery order, it is
needed to return the products, and create the delivery order (and
delivery guide) again with the correct amounts.
::::

![Delivery guide product configuration.](mexico/mx-delivery-guide-products.png){.align-center}

#### Sales and inventory flow

To create a delivery guide, first, you need to create and confirm a
sales order from `Sales --> Sales Order`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. This generates a `Delivery`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} smart button. Click it, and
`Validate`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} the transfer.

After the status is set to `Done`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
you can edit the transfer, and select the
`Transport Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} (either
`No Federal Highways`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or `Federal
Transport`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}).

If your delivery guide has the type
`No Federal Highways`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, you can save
the transfer, and then click `Generate Delivery Guide`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}. The resulting XML can be found in the chatter.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Other than the `UNSPSC`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in all
products, delivery guides that use `No Federal
Highways`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} do not require any special
configuration to be sent to the government.
::::

If your delivery guide has the type,
`Federal Transport`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, the tab
`MX EDI`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} appears. There, enter a
value in `Distance to Destination (KM)`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} bigger than [0]{.title-ref}, and select the
`Vehicle Setup`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} used for this
delivery.

![Delivery guide MX EDI tab configuration.](mexico/mx-delivery-guide-federal-transport.png){.align-center}

##### Dangerous hazards

Certain values in the `UNSPSC Category`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} are considered in the [official SAT
catalog](http://omawww.sat.gob.mx/tramitesyservicios/Paginas/complemento_carta_porte.htm)
as *dangerous hazards*. These categories need additional considerations
when creating a delivery guide with
`Federal Transport`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

First, select your product from
`Inventory --> Products --> Products`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. Then, in the `Accounting`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} tab, the fields
`Hazardous Material Designation Code (MX)`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} and `Hazardous Packaging (MX)`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} must be filled with the correct code from the
`SAT (Servicio de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} catalog.

![Delivery guide hazardous material product required fields.](mexico/mx-delivery-guide-hazards-designation.png){.align-center}

In
`Inventory --> Settings --> Mexico --> Vehicle Setup`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, the data from the
`Environment Insurer`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`Environment Insurance Policy`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} has to
be filed, as well. After this, continue with the regular process to
create a delivery guide.

![Delivery Guide environment insurer required fields.](mexico/mx-delivery-guide-hazards-environment.png){.align-center}

### Customs numbers

A *customs declaration* (Pedimento Aduanero) is a fiscal document that
certifies that all contributions to the fiscal entity (the
`SAT (Servicio de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}) has been paid for, including the import/export of goods.

According to the [Annex
20](http://omawww.sat.gob.mx/tramitesyservicios/Paginas/anexo_20.htm) of
CFDI 4.0, in documents where the invoiced goods come from a first-hand
import operation, the field, `Customs Number`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, needs to be added to all lines of products involved
with the operation.

To do so, the module `l10n_mx_edi_landing`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} must be installed, in addition to the
`Inventory <../../inventory_and_mrp/inventory>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}, `Purchase
<../../inventory_and_mrp/purchase>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} and
`Sales <../../sales/sales>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} apps.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

Do not confuse this feature with external trade. The customs numbers are
directly related to importing goods, while the external trade complement
is related to exporting. Consult your accountant first if this feature
is needed before doing any modifications.
::::

#### Configuration

In order to track the correct customs number for a specific invoice,
Odoo uses `landed costs
<../../inventory_and_mrp/inventory/product_management/inventory_valuation/integrating_landed_costs>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}. Go to
`Inventory --> Configuration --> Settings --> Valuation`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. Make sure that `Landed Costs`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} is activated.

Begin by creating a *service*-type product called,
[Pedimento]{.title-ref}. In the `Purchase`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} tab, activate `Is a Landed Cost`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, and select a `Default Split Method`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}.

Then, configure the *storable products* that hold the customs numbers.
To do so, create the storable products, and make sure the
`Product Category`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} has the following
configuration.

- `Costing Method`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Either
  `FIFO`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or `AVCO`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}
- `Inventory Valuation`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
  `Automated`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Stock Valuation Account`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
  `115.01.01 Inventario`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Stock Journal`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
  `Inventory Valuation`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Stock Input Account`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
  `115.05.01 MercancÃ­as en trÃ¡nsito`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Stock Output Account`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
  `115.05.01 MercancÃ­as en trÃ¡nsito`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}

![Storable products general configuration.](mexico/mx-landing-configuration.png){.align-center}

![Storable product category configuration.](mexico/mx-landing-configuration-category.png){.align-center}

#### Purchase and sales flow

After you configure your product, follow the standard `purchase flow
<../../inventory_and_mrp/purchase>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}.

Create a purchase order from
`Purchase --> Orders --> Purchase Order`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. Then, confirm the order to display a
`Receipt`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} smart button. Click on the
`Receipt`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} smart button to
`Validate`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} the receipt.

Go to `Inventory --> Operations --> Landed Costs`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, and create a new record. Add the transfer that
you just created, and both: the product [Pedimento]{.title-ref} and
`Customs number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

Optionally, you can add a cost amount. After this, validate the landed
cost. Once `Posted`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, all products
related to that receipt have the customs number assigned.

:::: warning
::: title
Warning
:::

You can only add the *Pedimentos* number **once**, so be careful when
associating the correct number with the transfer(s).
::::

![Customs number on a landed costs Inventory record.](mexico/mx-landing-inventory.png){.align-center}

Now, create a sales order, and confirm it. This should trigger a
`Delivery`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} smart button. Validate it.

Finally, create an invoice from the sales order, and confirm it. The
invoice line related to your product has a customs number in it. This
number should match the customs number added in the *Landed Costs*
record you created earlier.

![Customs number on confirmed sales order product.](mexico/mx-landing-invoice.png){.align-center}

### Electronic accounting

For Mexico, [Electronic
Accounting](https://www.sat.gob.mx/aplicacion/42150/envia-tu-contabilidad-electronica)
refers to the obligation to keep accounting records and entries through
electronic means, and to enter accounting information on a monthly
basis, through the
`SAT (Servicio de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} website.

It consists of three main XML files:

1.  The updated list of the chart of accounts that you are currently
    using.
2.  A monthly trial balance, plus a closing entry report, also known as:
    *Trial Balance Month 13*.
3.  Either optional, or for a compulsory audit, an export of the journal
    entries in your general ledger.

The resulting XML files follow the requirements of the [Anexo TÃ©cnico de
Contabilidad ElectrÃ³nica
1.3](https://www.gob.mx/cms/uploads/attachment/file/151135/Anexo24_05012015.pdf).

In addition to this, you can generate the
[DIOT](https://www.sat.gob.mx/declaracion/74295/presenta-tu-declaracion-informativa-de-operaciones-con-terceros-(diot)-):
A report of vendor\'s journal entries that involve IVA taxes that can be
exported in a `.txt`{.interpreted-text role="file"} file.

In order to use these reports, the modules
`l10n_mx_reports`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`l10n_mx_reports_closing`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`l10n_mx_xml_polizas`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`l10n_mx_xml_polizas_edi`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} have to be
installed, as well as the `Accounting
<../accounting/get_started>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}.

You can find the *Chart of accounts*, *Trial Balance Month 13*, and
*DIOT* reports in
`Accounting --> Reporting --> Mexico`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

The specific characteristics and obligations of the reports that you
send might change according to your fiscal regime. Always contact your
accountant before sending any documents to the government.
::::

#### Chart of accounts {#l10n_mx/chart-of-accounts}

The
`chart of accounts <../accounting/get_started/chart_of_accounts>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} in MÃ©xico follows a specific pattern based on
`SAT (Servicio de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}\'s\' [CÃ³digo agrupador de
cuentas](http://omawww.sat.gob.mx/fichas_tematicas/buzon_tributario/Documents/codigo_agrupador.pdf).

You can create any account, as long as it respects
`SAT (Servicio de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}\'s encoding group: the pattern is [NNN.YY.ZZ]{.title-ref}
or [NNN.YY.ZZZ]{.title-ref}.

::: example
Some examples are [102.01.99]{.title-ref} or [401.01.001]{.title-ref}.
:::

When a new account is created in
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Chart of
Accounts`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}, with the
`SAT (Servicio de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} encoding group pattern, the correct grouping code appears
in `Tags`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and your account appears
in the *COA* report.

Once you create all your accounts, make sure the correct
`Tags`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} are added.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

You cannot use any pattern that ends a section with a 0 (such as
[100.01.01]{.title-ref}, [301.00.003]{.title-ref} or
[604.77.00]{.title-ref}). This triggers errors in the report.
::::

Once everything is set up, you can go to
`Accounting --> Reporting --> Mexico -->
COA`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}, and click the
`SAT (XML)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button to generate an XML
file containing all of your accounts, which will be ready to upload to
the `SAT (Servicio de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} website.

#### Trial balance

The trial balance reports the initial balance, credit, and total balance
of your accounts, provided that you added their correct
`encoding group <l10n_mx/chart-of-accounts>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}.

This report can be generated monthly, and a corresponding XML file is
created, if you go to
`Accounting --> Reporting --> Mexico --> Trial Balance`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, and click the `SAT (XML)`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} button. Select the month you want to download
beforehand.

![Trial balance report.](mexico/mx-reports-trial-balance.png){.align-center}

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Odoo does not generate the *Balanza de ComprobaciÃ³n Complementaria*.
::::

An additional report is the *Month 13*: a closing balance sheet that
shows any adjustments or movements made in the accounting to close the
year.

To generate this XML document, navigate to
`Accounting --> Accounting -->
Miscellaneous --> Journal Entries`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, and create a new document. Here, add all amounts
to modify, and balance the debit and/or credit of each one.

After this is done, click `Mark as Closing Entry`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, and the report found in
`Accounting --> Reporting --> Mexico --> Trial Balance Month 13`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, contains the total amount of the year, plus all
the additions of the journal entry.

The XML file is generated by pressing the `SAT (XML)`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} button.

![Trial Balance Month 13 setup.](mexico/mx-reports-trial-balance-13.png){.align-center}

![Trial Balance Month 13 report.](mexico/mx-reports-trial-balance-13-report.png){.align-center}

#### General ledger

By law, all transactions in Mexico must be recorded digitally. Since
Odoo automatically creates all the underlying journal entries of your
invoicing and payments, you can export your journal entries to comply
with `SAT (Servicio de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}\'s audits and/or tax refunds.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

You can filter by period, or by journal, according to your current
needs.
::::

To create the XML, go to
`Accounting --> Reporting --> Audit Reports --> General
Ledger`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}, and click
`XML (Polizas)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Here, you can select
between four types of `Export`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} types:

- `Tax audit`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Audit certification`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Return of goods`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Compensation`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}

For `Tax audit`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, or
`Audit certification`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, you need to
write the `Order Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} provided by
the `SAT (Servicio de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}. For `Return of goods`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
or `Compensation`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, you need to write
your `Process Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, also provided
by the `SAT (Servicio de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

If you want to see this report without sending it, use
[ABC6987654/99]{.title-ref} for `Order
Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
[AB123451234512]{.title-ref} for `Process Number`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}.
::::

#### DIOT report

The DIOT (DeclaraciÃ³n Informativa de Operaciones con Terceros /
*Informative Declaration of Operations with Third Parties*) is an
additional obligation with the
`SAT (Servicio de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}, where the current status of creditable and non-creditable
payments, withholdings, and refunds of VAT from your vendor bills, are
provided to the
`SAT (Servicio de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}.

Unlike other reports, the
`DIOT (DeclaraciÃ³n Informativa de Operaciones con Terceros)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} is uploaded to a software provided by the
`SAT (Servicio de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} that contains the A-29 form. In Odoo, you can download the
records of your transactions as a `.txt`{.interpreted-text role="file"}
file that can be uploaded to the form, avoiding direct capture of this
data.

The transactions file contains the total amount of your payments
registered in vendor bills, broken down into the corresponding types of
IVA. The `VAT`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`Country`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is mandatory for all
vendors.

To get the
`DIOT (DeclaraciÃ³n Informativa de Operaciones con Terceros)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} report, go to
`Accounting --> Reports --> Mexico --> Transactions
with third parties [DIOT]`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}.
Select the month that suits you, and click
`DIOT (TXT)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to download the
`.txt`{.interpreted-text role="file"} file.

![A Vendor Bill that is In Payment.](mexico/mx-reports-diot-example.png){.align-center}

![DIOT (TXT) download button.](mexico/mx-reports-diot-example-download.png){.align-center}

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

You need to fill the field,
`L10N Mx Type of Operation`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, in the
`Accounting`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab of each one of your
vendors to prevent validation errors. Make sure that your foreign
customers have their country set up for
`L10N Mx Nationality`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to appear
automatically.

![DIOT information on a vendor contact.](mexico/mx-reports-diot-contact.png){.align-center}
::::




--- SOURCE: finance/fiscal_localizations/netherlands.md ---

# Netherlands

## XAF Export

With the Dutch accounting localization installed, you will be able to
export all your accounting entries in XAF format. For this, you have to
go in `Accounting --> Reporting --> General Ledger`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, you define the entries you want to export using
the filters (period, journals, \...) and then you click on the button
**EXPORT (XAF)**.

## Dutch Accounting Reports

If you install the Dutch accounting localization, you will have access
to some reports that are specific to the Netherlands such as :

- Profit & Loss
- Tax Report (Aangifte omzetbelasting)
- Intrastat Report (ICP)




--- SOURCE: finance/fiscal_localizations/peru.md ---

# Peru

## Introduction

The Peruvian localization has been improved and extended, in this
version the next modules are available:

- **l10n_pe**: Adds accounting features for the Peruvian localization,
  which represent the minimal configuration required for a company to
  operate in Peru and under the SUNAT regulations and guidelines. The
  main elements included in this module are: Chart of account, taxes,
  document types.
- **l10n_pe_edi**: includes all technical and functional requirements to
  generate and validate Electronic Invoice, based on the SUNAT
  specification to create and process valid electronic documents, for
  more technical detail you can access the [SUNAT EDI
  specifications](https://cpe.sunat.gob.pe/node/88/), that keeps track
  of new changes and updates. The features of this module are based on
  the resolutions published on the [SUNAT
  Legislation](https://www.sunat.gob.pe/legislacion/general/index.html/).

::: seealso
\- [App Tour - LocalizaciÃ³n de Peru](https://youtu.be/Ic3mGovkf8Y) -
[Smart Tutorial - LocalizaciÃ³n de
Peru](https://www.odoo.com/slides/smart-tutorial-localizacion-de-peru-133)
:::

## Configuration

### Install the Peruvian localization modules

Go to *Apps* and search for Peru, then click Install in the module Peru
EDI. This module has a dependency with *Peru - Accounting*. In case this
last one is not installed, Odoo installs it automatically within EDI.

![The \"Module\" filter is set on \"Peru\"](peru/peru-modules.png){.align-center}

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

When you install a database from scratch selecting Peru as country, Odoo
automatically installs the base module: Peru - Accounting.
::::

#### Configure your company

In addition to the basic information in the Company, we need to set Peru
as the Country, this is essential for the Electronic Invoice to work
properly. The field **Address Type Code** represents the establishment
code assigned by the SUNAT when companies register their RUC (Unique
Contributor Registration):

![Company data for Peru including RUC and Address type code](peru/peru-company.png){.align-center}

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

In case the Address type code is unknown, you can set it as the default
value: 0000. Be aware that if an incorrect value is entered, the
Electronic invoice validation might have errors.
::::

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The NIF should be set following the RUC format.
::::

#### Chart of Account

The chart of accounts is installed by default as part of the set of data
included in the localization module, the accounts are mapped
automatically in:

- Taxes
- Default Account Payable.
- Default Account Receivable

The chart of accounts for Peru is based on the most updated version of
the `PCGE (Plan
Contable General Empresarial)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}, which is
grouped in several categories and is compatible with NIIF accounting.

### Accounting Settings {#peru/accounting-settings}

Once the modules are installed and the basic information of your company
is set, you need to configure the elements required for Electronic
Invoice. For this, go to `Accounting
--> Settings --> Peruvian Localization`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}.

#### Basic Concepts

Here are some terms that are essential on the Peruvian localization:

- **EDI**: Electronic Data Interchange, which in this refers to the
  Electronic Invoice.
- **SUNAT**: is the organization that enforces customs and taxation in
  Peru.
- **OSE**: Electronic Service Operator, [OSE SUNAT\'s
  definition](https://cpe.sunat.gob.pe/aliados/ose#:~:text=El%20Operador%20de%20Servicios%20Electr%C3%B3nicos%20(OSE)%20es%20qui%C3%A9n%20se%20encarga,otro%20documento%20que%20se%20emita).
- **CDR**: Receipt certificate (Constancia de RecepciÃ³n).
- **SOL Credentials**: Sunat Operaciones en LÃ­nea. User and password are
  provided by the SUNAT and grant access to Online Operations systems.

#### Signature Provider

As part of the requirements for Electronic Invoice in Peru, your company
needs to select a Signature Provider that will take care of the document
signing process and manage the SUNAT validation response. Odoo offers
three options:

1.  IAP (Odoo In-App Purchase)
2.  Digiflow
3.  SUNAT

Please refer to the sections below to check the details and
considerations for each option.

##### IAP (Odoo In-App Purchase)

This is the default and the suggested option, considering the digital
ceritificate is included as part of the service.

![IAP option as signature providers](peru/peru-IAP.png){.align-center}

###### What is the IAP?

This is a signature service offered directly by Odoo, the service takes
care of the next process:

1.  Provides the Electronic invoice Certificate, so you do not need to
    acquire one by yourself.
2.  Send the document to the OSE, in this case, Digiflow.
3.  Receive the OSE validation and CDR.

###### How does it work?

The service requires Credits in order to process your electronic
documents. Odoo provides 1000 credits for free in new databases. After
these credits are consumed, you need to buy a Credit Package.

  ---------------
  Credits   EUR
  --------- -----
  1000      22

  5000      110

  10,000    220

  20,000    440
  ---------------

The credits are consumed per each document that is sent to the OSE.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

If you have a validation error and the document needs to be sent one
more time, one additional credit will be charged. Therefore, it is
paramount that you verify all information is correct before sending your
document to the OSE.
::::

###### What do you need to do?

- In Odoo, once your enterprise contract is activated and you start
  working in Production, you need to buy credits once the first 1000 are
  consumed.
- As Digiflow is the OSE used in the IAP, you need to affiliate it as
  the official OSE for your company on the SUNAT website. This is a
  simple process. For more information, please check [OSE Affiliation
  guide](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1BkrMTZIiJyi5XI0lGMi3rbMzHddOL1pa/view?usp=sharing).
- Register Digiflow as the authorized PSE, please check [PSE Affiliation
  guide](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1QZoqWvtQERpS0pqp6LcKmw7EBlm9EroU/view?usp=sharing).

##### Digiflow

This option can be used as an alternative, instead of using the IAP
services you can send your document validation directly to Digiflow. In
this case you need to consider:

- Buy your own digital Certificate: For more detail regarding the
  official vendor list, and the process to acquire it, please refer to
  [SUNAT Digital
  Ceritifcates](https://cpe.sunat.gob.pe/informacion_general/certificados_digitales/).
- Sign a service agreement directly with
  [Digiflow](https://www.digiflow.pe/).
- Provide your SOL credentials.

![Digiflow](peru/peru-Digiflow.png){.align-center}

##### SUNAT

In case your company wants to sign directly with the SUNAT, it is
possible to select this option in your configuration. In this case you
need to consider: - Get the SUNAT Certification process accepted.

- Buy your own digital Certificate: For more detail regarding the
  official vendor list, and the process to acquire it, please refer to
  [SUNAT Digital
  Ceritifcates](https://cpe.sunat.gob.pe/informacion_general/certificados_digitales/).
- Provide you SOL credentials.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

When using direct connection with the SUNAT, the SOL User must be set
with the Company RUT + User Id. Example: `20121888549JOHNSMITH`
::::

#### Testing environment

Odoo provides a testing environment that can be activated before your
company goes into production.

When using the testing environment and the IAP signature, you don't need
to buy testing credits for your transactions as all of them are
validated by default.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

By default the databases are set to work on production, make sure to
enable the testing mode if needed.
::::

#### Certificate

In case you don't use Odoo IAP, in order to generate the electronic
invoice signature, a digital certificate with the extension `.pfx` is
required. Proceed to this section and load your file and password.

![EDI Certificate wizard](peru/peru-Certificate.png){.align-center}

#### Multicurrency

The official currency exchange rate in Peru is provided by the Bank of
Peru. Odoo can connect directly to its services and get the currency
rate either automatically or manually.

![Bank of Peru is displayed in Multicurrency Service option](peru/peru-multicurrency.png){.align-center}

Please refer to the next section in our documentation for more
information about
`multicurrencies <../accounting/get_started/multi_currency>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}.

### Configure Master data {#peru/master_data}

#### Taxes

As part of the localization module the taxes are created automatically
with their related financial account and electronic invoice
configuration.

![List of default taxes](peru/peru-taxes.png){.align-center}

##### EDI Configuration

As part of the taxes configuration, there are three new fields required
for electronic invoice, the taxes created by default have this data
included, but in case you create new taxes make sure you fill in the
fields:

![Taxes EDI data for Peru](peru/peru-taxes-edi.png){.align-center}

#### Fiscal Positions

There are two main fiscal positions included by default when you install
the Peruvian localization.

**Extranjero - ExportaciÃ³n**: Set this fiscal position on customers for
Exportation transactions.

**Local Peru**: Set this fiscal position on local customers.

#### Document Types

In some Latin American countries, including Peru, some accounting
transactions like invoices and vendor bills are classified by document
types, defined by the government fiscal authorities, in this case by the
SUNAT.

Each document type can have a unique sequence per journal where it is
assigned. As part of the localization, the Document Type includes the
country on which the document is applicable;the data is created
automatically when the localization module is installed.

The information required for the document types is included by default
so the user does not need to fill anything on this view:

![Document Type list](peru/peru-document-type.png){.align-center}

:::: warning
::: title
Warning
:::

Currently the documents supported on customer invoices are: Invoice,
Boleta, Debit Note and Credit Note.
::::

#### Journals

When creating Sales Journals, the following information must be filled,
in addition to the standard fields on the Journals:

##### Use Documents

This field is used to define if the journal uses Document Types. It is
only applicable to Purchase and Sales journals, which are the ones that
can be related to the different set of document types available in Peru.
By default, all the sales journals created use documents.

##### Electronic Data Interchange

This section indicates which EDI workflow is used in the invoice, for
Peru we must select "Peru UBL 2.1".

![Journal EDI field](peru/peru-journal-edi.png){.align-center}

:::: warning
::: title
Warning
:::

By default, the value Factur-X (FR) is always displayed, make sure you
can uncheck it manually.
::::

#### Partner

##### Identification Type and VAT

As part of the Peruvian localization, the identification types defined
by the SUNAT are now available on the Partner form, this information is
essential for most transactions either on the sender company and in the
customer, make sure you fill in this information in your records.

![Partner identification type](peru/peru-id-type.png){.align-center}

#### Product

Additional to the basic information in your products, for the Peruvian
localization, the UNSPC Code on the product is a required value to be
configured.

![UNSPC Code on products](peru/peru-unspc-code.png){.align-center}

## Usage and testing

### Customer invoice

#### EDI Elements

Once you have configured your master data, the invoices can be created
from your sales order or manually. Additional to the basic invoice
information described on `our page about the
invoicing process <../accounting/customer_invoices/overview>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}, there are a couple of fields required as part of the Peru
EDI:

- **Document type**: The default value is "Factura Electronica" but you
  can manually change the document type if needed and select Boleta for
  example.

  ![Invoice document type field on invoices](peru/peru-invoice-document-type.png){.align-center}

- **Operation type**: This value is required for Electronic Invoice and
  indicates the transaction type, the default value is "Internal Sale"
  but another value can be selected manually when needed, for example
  Export of Goods.

  ![Invoice operation type field on invoices](peru/peru-operation-type.png){.align-center}

- **EDI Affectation Reason**: In the invoice lines, additional to the
  Tax there is a field "EDI Affectation Reason" that determines the tax
  scope based on the SUNAT list that is displayed. All the taxes loaded
  by default are associated with a default EDI affection reason, if
  needed you can manually select another one when creating the invoice.

  ![Tax affectation reason in invoice line](peru/peru-tax-affectation-reason.png){.align-center}

#### Invoice validation

Once you check all the information in your invoice is correct, you can
proceed to validate it. This action registers the account move and
triggers the Electronic invoice workflow to send it to the OSE and the
SUNAT. The following message is displayed at the top of the invoice:

![Sending of EDI Invoice in blue](peru/peru-posted-invoice.png){.align-center}

Asynchronous means that the document is not sent automatically after the
