To add a new deduction, first navigate to
`Payroll app --> Contracts --> Salary
Attachments`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}. Next, click
`Create`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and a new salary attachment
form loads.

![The salary attachment form with everything filled in for Ronnie Hart\'s child support.](contracts/garnishment.png){.align-center}

Fill out the following fields on the form:

- `Employee`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: using the drop-down
  menu, select the employee the salary attachment applies to.
- `Description`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: enter a short
  description for the salary attachment, such as [Child
  Support]{.title-ref} or [529 Contribution]{.title-ref}.
- `Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: using the drop-down menu,
  select the type of salary attachment being created. Choose from:
  - `Attachment of Salary`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: any
    payments taken out towards something that is *not* child support.
    Typically any garnishments, such as lawsuit payments, payments
    toward taxes owed, etc.
  - `Assignment of Salary`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: any
    deduction that is not required, but voluntary, such as a pre-tax
    allocation to a college savings account.
  - `Child Support`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: any payments
    taken out specifically for child support.
- `Start Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: the date the salary
  attachment starts. Choose a date by clicking on the drop-down menu,
  navigating to the correct month and year by using the
  `fa-chevron-left`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
  `fa-chevron-right`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
  `(arrow)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} icons, then clicking on
  the desired date. This field is **required**.
- `Estimated End Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: this field
  automatically populates after both the
  `Monthly Amount`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
  `Total Amount`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} fields are
  populated. This field is **not** modifiable.
- `Document`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: attach any documents
  relevant to the salary attachment. Click the
  `Upload Your File`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button, navigate
  to the desired document in the file explorer, then click
  `Open`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to select the document, and
  attach it to the form. To change the attached document, click the
  `fa-pencil`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
  `(pencil)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} icon, and select a
  different document. To remove a document, click the
  `fa-trash-o`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
  `(trash can)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} icon.
- `Monthly Amount`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: enter the amount
  to be taken out of the employee\'s paycheck every month for this
  specific salary attachment.
- `Total Amount`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: enter the total
  amount that the employee pays for the salary attachment to be
  completed.




--- SOURCE: hr/payroll/payslips.md ---

# Payslips

Payslips are created either by the employees themselves or their
managers, and are approved by authorized employees (typically managers).
Then, once payslips are approved, employees are issued payslips and are
paid either by check or direct deposit, depending on how their employee
profile is configured.

The `Payslips`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} drop-down header of
the `Payroll`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"} application
consists of three sections: `To Pay`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`All Payslips`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
`Batches`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

These three sections provide all the tools needed to create payslips for
employees, including individual payslips, a batch of payslips, or
commission payslips.

![Payslips menu selection in Payroll.](payslips/payslips.png){.align-center}

## To pay

Click on `Payroll app --> Payslips --> To Pay`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} to see the payslips that need to be paid. On this
page, Odoo displays the payslips that have not been generated yet, and
can be created from this dashboard.

![View all payslips that need to be paid on the Payslips To Pay page.](payslips/all-pay-slips.png){.align-center}

Each payslip will list the `Reference`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} number for the individual payslip, the
`Employee`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} name,
`Batch Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, the
`From`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and `To`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} date range, the `Company`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, the `Basic Wage`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`Net Wage`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and the
`Status`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} of the payslip.

Clicking on an individual payslip entry will show the details for the
individual payslip.

### Create new payslip {#payroll/new-payslip}

A new payslip can be created from the
`Payslips To Pay`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} page (`Payroll app
--> Payslips --> To Pay`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}) or the
`Employee Payslips`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} page
(`Payroll app
--> Payslips --> All Payslips`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}),
by clicking the `Create`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button in
the top-left corner.

Clicking `Create`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} reveals a blank
payslip form, wherein the necessary payslip information can be entered.

#### Required fields

On the blank payslip form, a number of fields are required to be filled
in with the necessary information. These required fields are represented
by **bold** lines.

![The necessary fields for a new payslip.](payslips/new-payslip.png){.align-center}

- `Employee`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Type in the name of an
  employee, or select the desired employee from the drop-down list. Upon
  selecting an employee, several other fields on the payslip form may
  auto-populate. Typically, after making a selection in the
  `Employee`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field, Odoo
  auto-populates the `Contract`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  `Structure`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
  `Payslip Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} fields, but **only**
  if that information is already on that employee\'s form in the
  *Employees* app.
- `Period`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Click the default date to
  reveal a pop-up calendar. On this calendar, use the
  `< (less-than)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
  `> (greater than)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} icons to select
  the desired month, and click on the desired day to select that
  specific date as the start date for the payslip. Repeat this process
  to add an end date for the payslip in the field below.
- `Contract`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Using the drop-down
  menu, select the desired contract for the employee. Only the available
  corresponding contracts for the selected employee appear as options.
- `Structure`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Using the drop-down
  menu, select the salary structure type. Only the available
  corresponding structures for the selected contract for that specific
  employee appear as options.
- `Payslip Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: In the blank field,
  type in the name for the payslip. The name should be short and
  descriptive, such as [April 2023]{.title-ref}.
- `Company`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: In the
  `Accounting Information`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab,
  select the company the payslip applies to from the
  `Company`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} drop-down menu.
- `Salary Journal`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: In the
  `Accounting Information`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab, enter
  the salary journal in which the payment will be reflected, and found
  in the *Accounting* application.

![The necessary fields for a new payslip in the Accounting Information tab.](payslips/new-payslip-tab.png){.align-center}

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

It is recommended to check with the accounting department to ensure
every entry that affects the *Accounting* application is correct.
::::

#### Optional fields

- `Reference`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Any note or reference
  message for the new entry can be entered here.
- `Company Car`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: If applicable,
  select the company car from the drop-down.
- `Worked Days`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: In the
  `Worked Days \& Inputs`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab, the
  entries under `Worked Days`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  (including the `Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  `Description`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  `Number of Days`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  `Number of Hours`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
  `Amount`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}) are automatically filled
  in, based on what was entered for the `Period`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}, `Contract`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
  `Structure`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} fields of the payslip
  form.
- `Salary Computation`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: The
  `Salary Computation`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab is
  automatically filled in after the `Compute Sheet`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} button is clicked. Doing so displays all the wages,
  deductions, taxes, etc. for the entry.
- `Batch Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Located in the
  `Accounting Information`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab,
  select the payslip batch this new payslip should be added to from the
  drop-down menu.
- `Date Account`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Located in the
  `Accounting Information`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab, enter
  the date on which the payslip should be posted, by clicking on the
  drop-down menu, and navigating to the correct month and year using the
  `< > (less-than/greater-than)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  icons in the calendar pop-up window. Then, click on the desired date.
- `Salary Journal`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: This field,
  located in the `Accounting Information`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} tab, represents the journal that the payslip will be
  logged in, and is automatically selected when the
  `Contract`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
  `Structure`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} are entered in the
  payslip form.
- `Accounting Entry`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: This field,
  located in the `Accounting Information`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} tab, is automatically filled in once the payslip is
  confirmed.

#### Save and process new payslip

When all the necessary information on the payslip is entered, click
`Save`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to save the data, or click
`Discard`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to delete the entry.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Saving the entry is not required in order to compute the sheet, although
it is considered best practice to do so. The
`Compute Sheet`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button can be clicked
without first saving the payslip. Doing so will save the entry *and*
compute the sheet.
::::

Click the `Compute Sheet`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button to
register all the information, and have the
`Salary Computation`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab populated.
If any modifications need to be made, click the `Edit`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} button, make the desired changes, then click the
`Recompute Worked Days`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button to
have the changes reflected in the `Worked
Days`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`Salary Computation`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tabs.

To print the payslip, click the `Print`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} button. To cancel the payslip, click the
`Cancel Payslip`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button.

Once everything on the payslip form is correct, click the
`Create Draft Entry`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button to create
the payslip. The chatter is automatically updated to show the email sent
to the employee, along with a PDF copy of the payslip.

![The new payslip is emailed to the employee and the email appears in the chatter.](payslips/payslip-chatter.png){.align-center}

Next, the payment must be sent to the employee. To do this, click the
`Make Payment`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button. Doing so
reveals a pop-up form, in which the desired
`Bank Journal`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} that the payment
should be made against must be selected from a drop-down menu. Then,
click the `Confirm`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button to confirm
the journal, and return to the payslip.

![Click Make Payment to send the payment to the employee.](payslips/make-payment.png){.align-center}

If a payment needs to be cancelled or refunded, click the corresponding
`Refund`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or
`Cancel Payslip`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button, located at
the top of the payslip form.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

In order for a payslip to be paid, the employee *must* have a bank
account entered in their contact information. If there is no bank
information, a payslip cannot be paid, and an error will appear when the
`Make Payment`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button is clicked.
Banking information can be found in the
`Private Information`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab on the
employee\'s card. Edit the employee card, and add banking information,
if it is missing.

![Banking information can be entered in an employee\'s card.](payslips/banking.png){.align-center}
::::

## All payslips

To view all payslips regardless of status, go to
`Payroll app --> Payslips --> All
Payslips`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}. Here, all payslips
are organized by batch (in a default list view).

Click on the `â–¶ (arrow)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} next to the
individual batch name to view all the payslips in that particular batch,
along with all the payslip details. The number of payslips in the batch
is written in parenthesis after the batch name. The
`Status`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} for each individual payslip
appears on the far-right side, indicating if it is in
`Draft Mode`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`Waiting`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, or if it is
`Done`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

\- `Draft`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} indicates the payslip is
created, and there is still time to make edits, since the amounts are
not calculated. - [Waiting]{.title-ref} indicates the payslip has been
calculated and the salary details can be found in the *Salary
Computation* tab. - [Done]{.title-ref} indicates the payslip is
calculated and ready to be paid.
::::

![View all payslips organized by batches. Click on the arrow to expand each batch.](payslips/all-payslips.png){.align-center}

Click on an individual payslip to view the details for that payslip on a
separate page. Using the breadcrumb menu, click
`Employee Payslips`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to go back to the
list view of all payslips.

A new payslip can be created from the
`Employee Payslips`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} page, by clicking
the `Create`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button in the upper-left
corner. Doing so reveals a separate blank payslip form page. On that
blank payslip form page, enter all the necessary information, as
described in the
`Create a new payslip <payroll/new-payslip>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} section.

To print PDF versions of payslips from the
`Payslips to Pay`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or `Employee
Payslips`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} pages, first select the
desired payslips by clicking on the individual checkbox next to each
payslip to be printed. Or, click the box next to
`Reference`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, which selects all
visible payslips on the page. Then, click the `Print`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} button to print the payslips.

![Click on the Print smart button to print payslips to a PDF.](payslips/print.png){.align-center}

Payslips can also be exported to an Excel spreadsheet. When exporting,
all payslips are exported regardless of whether some are selected or
not. Click on the `Export All`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button
(download icon) to export all payslips to an Excel spreadsheet.

![Click on the Export All smart button to export all payslips to an Excel payslip.](payslips/export.png){.align-center}

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Both *To Pay* and *All Payslips* display all the detailed information
for each payslip.
::::

## Batches

To view payslips in batches, navigate to
`Payroll app --> Payslips --> Batches`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} to display all the payslip batches that have been
created. These payslip batches are displayed in a list view, by default.

Each batch displays the `Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`Date From`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`Date To`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} dates, whether it was a
`Credit note`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, its
`Status`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and the
`Company`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

![View displaying all batches created.](payslips/batches.png){.align-center}

Click on an individual batch to view the details for that batch on a
separate page. On this batch detail page, modifications can be made. To
make any modifications to a batch, click the `Edit`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} button. Then, proceed to make any necessary changes.

When all desired changes have been made, click either
`Save`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to save the changes, or
`Discard`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to revert back to the
original data.

After modifications have been saved, click the
`Generate Payslips`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button to reveal
a `Generate Payslips`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} pop-up form, in
which payslips affected by the changes can be created or modified.

All payslips associated with the batch are displayed in the employees
section of the `Generate Payslips`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
pop-up. To filter the results by either the `Salary
Structure`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and/or the
`Department`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, select a salary
structure and/or department from the respective drop-down menus.

Only employees that match the selected
`Salary Structure`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and/or
`Department`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} appear in the employees
list. Click the `Generate`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button at
the bottom of the `Generate Payslips`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
pop-up window to generate the modified payslips, and close the pop-up
window.

![Generate payslips from the edited batch.](payslips/generate-payslips-batch.png){.align-center}

Back on the batch details page, click the
`Create Draft Entry`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} smart button to
create a draft of the payslips.

![Generate payslips from the edited batch.](payslips/draft-from-batch.png){.align-center}

Once the draft payslips are created, the button changes to say
`Make Payment`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Click the
`Make Payment`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button. A pop-up
window appears, in which the bank journal information must be entered.
Select the `Bank Journal`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} from the
drop-down list, and click `Confirm`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
to process the payslips, and pay the employees.

On the batch detail page, the number of payslips in the batch is
accessible via the `Payslips`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} smart
button, located in the top-right corner. Individual payslips for the
batch can be viewed by clicking the `Payslips`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} smart button in the top-right corner.

Use the breadcrumb menu to navigate back to the individual batch detail
page, or back to the list of all batches.

![Click the Payslips smart button to view the individual payslips in the batch.](payslips/payslip-batches.png){.align-center}

### Create a new batch

To create a new batch of payslips from the
`Payslips Batches`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} page
(`Payroll app --> Payslips --> Batches`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}), click the `Create`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} button in the upper-left corner. Doing so reveals a
blank payslip batch form on a separate page.

On the new payslip batch form, enter the `Name`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} for the batch, and select the date range to which the
batch applies, by clicking the `â–¼ (drop-down arrow)`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} icon in the `Period`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
fields, which reveals a calendar pop-up window. From this calendar
pop-up window, navigate to the correct month, and click on the
corresponding day for both the start and end dates.

![Enter the details for the new batch.](payslips/new-batch-details.png){.align-center}

If the batch is a credit note, check the box next to
`Credit Note`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Then, in the
`Generation Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field, select the
date the payslips should be generated from a calendar pop-up window.
This generated date is reflected in the accounting journal entries.

Lastly, in the `Company`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field,
select the company these payslips are written against.

When all the information on the payslip batch form is correct, click the
`Save`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button to save the
information. To delete the entry, click the `Discard`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} button.

To create the payslips for the newly-created batch, click the
`Generate Payslips`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button at the top
of the form.

When clicked, a pop-up window appears showing all the payslips that will
be created. To remove any individual payslips, click the black
`âœ– (x mark)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} icon at the far right of
the payslip line.

If a specific `Salary Structure`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or
`Department`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} needs to be specified
for the batch, select them from the corresponding drop-down menus.

Click the `Generate`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button at the
bottom of the pop-up window to create the payslips for the batch.

![Generate payslips for the new batch.](payslips/generate-payslips.png){.align-center}

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

On the `Generate Payslips`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} pop-up
window, selecting a `Department`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
and/or `Salary Structure`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} only
displays payslips that apply to those specifically-selected parameters.
::::

If there are any errors or issues preventing the payslips from being
generated, an error message appears in the top-right section. This error
box disappears on its own after several seconds, or the
`âœ– (x mark)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} icon can be clicked to
close the alert.

To remedy the issue, make any necessary modifications (e.g. removing any
payslip lines that cannot be processed), then click the
`Generate`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button again.

Once the payslips have been successfully generated, the screen returns
to the payslip batch form.

From here, click the `Generate Draft Entry`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} button to change the payslips\' status from
`Draft`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to `Done`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}.

Once payslips have been generated, click the
`Make Payment`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button to process the
payments. Doing so reveals a pop-up window, in which the proper banking
information must be entered. In this pop-up window, select the
appropriate `Bank Journal`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} from the
drop-down menu, and enter the appropriate file name.

When done, click the `Confirm`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button
to confirm the information, or click `Cancel`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} to discard.

### Generate commission payslips

Commission payslips can be generated directly from the
`Payslips Batches`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} page
(`Payroll app --> Payslips --> Batches`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}). To generate commission payslips from this page,
click on the desired batch (or batches) to create commissions payslips
for, then click the `Generate Commission Payslips`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} button.

Doing so reveals a `Generate Commission Payslip`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} pop-up window, in which the necessary information
**must** be filled out.

![Enter the commission details.](payslips/commission-details.png){.align-center}

On this pop-up window, click on the drop-down menus, located beside the
`Period`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field, to reveal calendar
pop-up windows. On these calendar pop-up windows, select the desired
period for which the payslips are being generated. Using the
`< (left)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`> (right)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} arrows, navigate to the
correct month, and click on the date to select it.

In the `Department`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field, select the
desired department from the drop-down menu.

When a department is selected, the employees listed for that department
appear in the `Employee`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section.

Under the `Employee`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section, enter
the `Commission Amount`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} for each
employee in the appropriate column. To remove an employee, click the
`ðŸ—‘ï¸ (trash)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} icon to remove the line.

Add a new entry by clicking `Add a Line`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, and entering the `Employee`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} and the appropriate
`Commission Amount`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

Click the `Upload Your File`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button
to add a file, if necessary. Any file type is accepted.

Using the drop-down menu beside the `Commission Type`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} field, select either
`Classic Commission`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or
`Warrant`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
`Classic`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is the most typical of
commission, while `Warrant`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is
primarily used for Belgium companies.

Once all the commissions are properly entered, click the
`Generate Payslips`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button to create
the commission payslips.




--- SOURCE: hr/payroll/reporting.md ---

# Reporting

The `Reporting`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section of the
*Payroll* app offers a variety of reports to choose from. The
`Payroll`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`Meal Vouchers`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`Attachment of Salary`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
`DMFA`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} reports are universal and
available for all companies regardless of location. The
`Paid Time Off Allocation`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`273S Sheet`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
`274.XX Sheets`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} reports are specific
to Belgian companies only.

To view a report, go to `Payroll --> Reporting`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} and click on the specific report.

![Report dashboard view.](reporting/reports.png){.align-center}

If a report is unavailable to a company, a user error pops up, stating
[You must be logged in to a Belgian company to use this
feature.]{.title-ref}

At the top of each report, click on `Filters`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} to display the optional filters for the specific
report. Filters show information that matches the specific filter
parameters. For example, when selecting the
`Last 365 Day Payslip`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} filter, only
payslips for the last 365 days appear. All reports have the option to
add a custom filter, and each have different default custom filter
options. Select the parameters, then click the `Apply`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} button.

![Report dashboard view.](reporting/custom-filter.png){.align-center}

Clicking on `Favorites`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} displays
three options: `Save the current search`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, `Add the search to the dashboard`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, or `Insert the search to a Google
spreadsheet`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

![Favorite options for reports.](reporting/favorites.png){.align-center}

## Payroll

Click on `Payroll --> Reporting --> Payroll`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} to display the `Payroll
Analysis`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} report.

![Report dashboard view.](reporting/payroll-report.png){.align-center}

This shows all the payslips generated in the last 365 days. The report
can display metrics for a variety of parameters. Click the
`Measures`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} box to view a drop-down
menu with the various options to display. The options available include:
`# Payslip`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`Basic Wage`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`Basic Wage for Time Off`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`Days of Paid Time Off`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, `Days of
Unforeseen Absence`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`Days of Unpaid Time Off`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`Gross Wage`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, `Net
Wage`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`Number of Days`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`Number of Hours`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`Work Days`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`Work Hours`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
`Count`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

![Report dashboard view.](reporting/measures.png){.align-center}

### Line chart

A line chart is the default view for the *Payroll Analysis* report. If a
different view was selected, click on the `Line Chart`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} icon (middle icon) in the menu bar to change the view
back to a line chart. An option to display the line chart in ascending
or descending order appears at the end of the options.

![Report dashboard view.](reporting/line-chart.png){.align-center}

### Bar chart

To display the data in a bar chart, click on the
`Bar Chart`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} icon (first icon) in the
menu bar.

![Report dashboard view.](reporting/bar-chart.png){.align-center}

Click the `Stacked`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} icon to view the
bar chart in a stacked format (where multiple values appear in each
column). An option to display the columns in ascending or descending
order appears at the end of the options.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

Clicking an option enables it. To disable the option, click it again.
When the option is enabled it appears grey. When it is inactive, it
appears white.
::::

### Pie chart

To display the data in a pie chart, click on the
`Pie Chart`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} icon (last icon) in the
menu bar. There are no additional options available in this view.

![Report dashboard view.](reporting/pie-chart.png){.align-center}

### Pivot table

The bottom half of the `Payroll Analysis`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} dashboard presents a pivot table no matter which type
of chart is selected for the top of the dashboard. The default
information displayed is the number of payslips, net wage, gross wage,
days of paid time off, and days of unpaid time off. The information is
divided by department. To display more information on the report, select
the `Measures`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} drop-down menu, then
click on any other items to display.

![Report dashboard view.](reporting/measures-bottom.png){.align-center}

To sort the entries by a specific column, such as
`Net Wage`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, click on the column name
twice. The first click selects the column, and the second click sorts
the information in descending order.

![To sort information by descending order, click the column head twice.](reporting/net-wage.png){.align-center}

To export the data in an XLSX format, click the
`Download xlsx`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} icon. The information
will be downloaded into an Excel spreadsheet.

![Download an Excel spreadsheet of the data by clicking the download button.](reporting/export.png){.align-center}

The data can be inserted into a spreadsheet by clicking the
`Insert in Spreadsheet`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button. A
pop-up appears asking which spreadsheet to place the information in.
Select an existing spreadsheet or enter the name for a new spreadsheet.
Click the `Confirm`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button to move to
a spreadsheet view with all the information populated.

![Send the data to a spreadsheet.](reporting/spreadsheet.png){.align-center}

Once in the spreadsheet view, click on `File`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, then select `Save`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
to save the data, or `Save as Template`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} to save the setting as a template to use in the future.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The *Documents* application must be installed in order to use the
`Insert in
Spreadsheet`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} option.
::::

## Meal Vouchers

`Meal Vouchers`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} provides an overview
of the meal vouchers used by employees, and can be shown by
`Day`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, `Week`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, `Month`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`Quarter`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, or
`Year`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. The default view is by month.

![Meal voucher](reporting/meal-vouchers.png){.align-center}

To change the displayed view, click on `Total`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}. The data collapses, showing only the count column.
Click on `Total`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} again, then hover
over `Day`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, then click on one of the
other time-period options available.

![Meal voucher](reporting/voucher-day.png){.align-center}

It is possible to compare the current meal voucher report to the one for
the previous time period or the previous year. To view these
comparisons, click on the `Comparison`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} drop-down menu at the top, then select either
`Date: Previous Period`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or
`Date: Previous Year`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

![Meal voucher](reporting/meal-comparison.png){.align-center}

To export the data in an XLSX format, click the
`Download xlsx`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} icon. The information
will be downloaded into an Excel spreadsheet.

![Download an Excel spreadsheet of the data by clicking the download button.](reporting/voucher-download.png){.align-center}

The data can be inserted into a spreadsheet by clicking the
`Insert in Spreadsheet`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button. A
pop-up appears asking which spreadsheet to place the information in.
Select an existing spreadsheet or enter the name for a new spreadsheet.
Click the `Confirm`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button to move to
a spreadsheet view with all the information populated.

Once in the spreadsheet view, click on `File`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, then select `Save`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
to save the data, or `Save as Template`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} to save the settings as a template to use in the
future.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The *Documents* application must be installed in order to use the
`Insert in
Spreadsheet`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} option.
::::

## Attachment of Salary

The `Attachment of Salary`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} report
shows all deductions or allocations per employee, such as child support
payments and wage garnishments.

![View the Attachment of Salary report that shows all salary garnishments.](reporting/attachment-of-salary.png){.align-center}

The employees are listed in the left-side column, while the different
deductions are listed in the top row, organized by month.

The report can be exported as a XLSX file, or inserted into a
spreadsheet, using the corresponding buttons at the top.

Clicking on the `Measures`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button
shows options for how the data is displayed.
`Assignment of salary`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`Attachment of salary`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`Child support`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
`Count`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, can all be selected or
deselected by clicking on the item. If an item has a check mark, it is
displayed.

![Select the options that be displayed in the report.](reporting/attachment-measures.png){.align-center}

The salary attachment report can be compared to the one for the previous
time period or the previous year. To view these comparisons, click on
the on the `Comparison`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} drop-down
menu at the top, then select either
`Payslip End Date: Previous Period`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
or `Payslip End
Date: Previous Year`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.




--- SOURCE: hr/payroll/work_entries.md ---

# Work entries

The *Work Entries* dashboard, which can be found by going to
`Payroll --> Work
Entries --> Work Entries`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"},
provides a visual overview of the individual time sheets of every
employee, with each day split into a morning shift and an afternoon
shift.

![Work Entries dashboard view showing all employee\'s work entries.](work_entries/work-entries-overview.png){.align-center}

To change the view so that only the entries for a single day, week, or
month are shown, click on one of the corresponding links for
`Day`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, `Week`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, or `Month`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, located
at the top of the dashboard.

Use the `â¬…ï¸ (left arrow)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`âž¡ï¸ (right arrow)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} icons on the left
and right side of the `Today`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button
to adjust the displayed dates. The arrows will adjust the date based on
the type of time selected. For example, if month is selected, the arrows
will move one month with each click of the arrow. If week or day is
selected, the time will move by either a week or a day for each click of
the arrow, respectively.

## Adding a new work entry

If a work entry is missing and needs to be added, such as sick time or
time off, click `Add`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to create a new
work entry. A pop-up will appear, with several fields to fill in.

Enter the `Work Entry Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, such as
[Sick Time]{.title-ref} or any other short description. Select the
`Employee`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and the
`Work Entry Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} from the respective
drop-down lists.

![Filling in the work entry Create form in Odoo.](work_entries/create.png){.align-center}

Next, enter the date and time for the work entry in the
`From`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and `To`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} drop-downs. First, select the date by navigating to the
correct month and year using the `â¬…ï¸ (left arrow)`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} and `âž¡ï¸ (right arrow)`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} icons, then click on the specific day.

Then, select the time by clicking on the `â° (clock)`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} icon, and using the `â¬†ï¸ (up
arrow)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`â¬‡ï¸ (down arrow)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} icons for each
section to enter the hour, minute, and second for the time period.

The `Period`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} will display the hours
based on the `To`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`From`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} entries.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

Before clicking either `Save & Close`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
or `Save & New`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, it is good to double
check the `Period`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to ensure the time
stated corresponds to the `To`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`From`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} fields.

![Hours entered in the Period field.](work_entries/period.png){.align-center}
::::

Once the information is entered, click `Save & Close`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} to save the entry and close the pop-up, or
`Save & New`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to save the entry and
create another `Work Entry Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

## Regenerate work entries

After a work entry has been either added or modified, the work entries
need to be regenerated for the affected employee(s). Click on the
`Regenerate Work Entries`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button at
the top of the main dashboard, and a pop-up will appear.

Select the `Employee`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to regenerate
work entries for from the `drop-down menu`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, and adjust the `From`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} and `To`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} fields so
the correct date range is displayed. Click the
`Regenerate Work Entries`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button and
the work entries will be recreated. Once finished, the pop-up will
close.

![Regenerate a work entry for a particular employee.](work_entries/regenerate-details.png){.align-center}

## Conflicts

A conflict appears for any request that has not been approved, such as
sick time or vacation, or if there are any errors on the work entry,
such as required fields being left blank. Conflicts are required to be
resolved before payslips can be generated.

Any work entry that has a conflict to be resolved is indicated on the
main `Work Entry`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} overview dashboard,
located by going to
`Payroll --> Work Entries --> Conflicts`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, where only conflicts needing resolution are
shown.

![Conflicts dashboard view showing all employee\'s conflicts in work entries.](work_entries/conflicts.png){.align-center}

Conflicts are indicated with an orange triangle in the top left corner
of each individual entry. Click on an individual work entry to see the
conflict details in a pop-up.

The conflict is briefly explained in an orange text box.

![Details for a conflict appear in the pop-up.](work_entries/conflict-detail.png){.align-center}

The `Work Entry Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`Employee`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
`Work Entry Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} are listed on the
left side of the pop-up. The `From`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
and `To`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} date range, as well as the
total time requested (in hours), appear in the
`Period`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field on the right side.

If there is a conflict because a time-off request for the same time
already exists in the system, the time-off will be entered in the
`Time Off`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field. Clicking the
`External
Link`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button next to the
`Time Off`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} entry will bring up the
duplicate time-off request.

The details for the time-off request appear in the pop-up. The request
can be modified if needed. Click either the `Validate`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} or `Refuse`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button
to approve or deny the request, then click the `Save`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} button to save the changes.

![Edit and/or validate a duplicate time-off request.](work_entries/validate.png){.align-center}

Once the duplicate time-off request has been approved and saved, the
screen goes back to the conflict. Click
`Refuse Time Off`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or
`Approve Time Off`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} via the buttons in
the top right to either approve or deny the request. Repeat for all
conflicts until there are no conflicts to resolve.

After conflicts have been resolved, work entries must be regenerated for
each employee by clicking the
`Regenerate Work Entries`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button, and
entering the corresponding information for each employee.

![Regenerate Work Entries button on the Work Entries Regeneration form.](work_entries/regenerate-employee.png){.align-center}

## Generating payslips

To generate payslips, navigate to the time period the payslips should be
generated for, either day, week, or month. When the desired pay period
is displayed, click the `Generate Payslips`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} button.

![Generate Payslips button on the Work Entry dashboard.](work_entries/generate-payslips.png){.align-center}

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

If the `Generate Payslips`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button is
not active (appears light turquoise instead of dark turquoise), that
indicates there are conflicts. *Solve conflicts first* will appear as a
warning when `Generate Payslips`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is
moused over. Resolve all conflicts before generating payslips.
::::

A batch entry will appear for the time period selected. The batch name
appears at the top in the `Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
field, typically listing the month and year for the particular batch.

The date range the payslips apply to appears in the
`Period`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field. The company appears
in the `Company`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field, along with an
option to mark the payslips as a credit note. To make changes, click the
`Edit`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button in the top left, make
any changes, then click either `Save`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
to accept the changes or `Discard`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to
revert to the original data.

![Batch information that appears when making a batch.](work_entries/batch.png){.align-center}

Click the `Create Draft Entry`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button
to create the payslips for the batch.

Click on the `Payslips`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button in the
top right to view all the payslips for the batch.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Payslips will have a status of *Waiting* until the
`Create Draft Entry`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button has been
clicked. After, the payslip status will change to *Done*.
::::

Payslips can be printed by clicking the box next to each payslip to
print, or clicking the box next to `Reference`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} to select all the payslips at once. Click the
`Print`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button, and a PDF file will
be created with all the specified payslips.

![Print button for printing the payslips.](work_entries/print-payslips.png){.align-center}

::: seealso
`Configure work entries <payroll/work-entries-config>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}
:::
