# Payroll

Odoo *Payroll* is used to process work entries and create payslips for
employees, including both regular pay and commission. Payroll works in
conjunction with other Odoo apps, such as *Employees*, *Timesheets*,
*Time Off*, and *Attendances*.

The *Payroll* app helps ensure there are no issues or conflicts when
validating work entries, handles country-specific localizations to
ensure that payslips follow local rules and taxes, and allows for salary
assignments. Payroll configuration is critical to ensure accurate and
timely processing of payslips.

## Settings

To access the *Settings*, go to
`Payroll --> Configuration --> Settings`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. Whether or not payslips are posted in accounting,
and whether SEPA payments are created, is selected here.

The `Settings`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} screen is where
localization settings are configured. *Localizations* are
country-specific settings pre-configured in Odoo at the creation of the
database, and account for all taxes, fees, and allowances for that
particular country. The `Localization`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} section of the `Settings`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} includes a detailed view of all benefits provided to
employees.

![Settings available for Payroll.](payroll/payroll-settings.png){.align-center}

Any country-specific localizations are set up in the
`Localization`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section of the
`Settings`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} screen. All localization
items are pre-populated when the country is specified during the
creation of the database. It is not recommended to alter the
localization settings unless specifically required.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Odoo can handle a multi-company configuration. This is generally done
when there is a main company or office location, such as a headquarters,
and there are other offices/branches around the country or globe, that
fall under that main company or headquarters. In Odoo, each company,
including the headquarters, would be setup as their own company/branch
using the multi-company method.

Each individual company can have a different localization setting
configured for that specific company, since company locations can vary
and be located anywhere in the world, where rules and laws differ. For
more information on companies refer to `this documentation
<../general/companies>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} on setting up
companies.
::::

## Work entries {#payroll/work-entries-config}

A *work entry* is an individual record on an employee\'s timesheet. Work
entries can be configured to account for all types of work and time off,
such as `Attendance`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, `Sick Time
Off`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, `Training`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, or `Public Holiday`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}.

::: seealso
`Manage work entries <payroll/work_entries>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}
:::

### Work entry types

When creating a work entry in the *Payroll* application, or when an
employee enters information in the *Timesheets* application, a
`Work Entry Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} needs to be
selected. The list of `Work Entry Types`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} is automatically created based on localization settings
set in the database.

To view the current work entry types available, go to
`Payroll --> Configuration -->
Work Entries --> Work Entry Types`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}.

Each work entry type has a code to aid in the creation of payslips, and
to ensure all taxes and fees are correctly entered.

![List of all work entry types currently available for use, with the payroll code and color.](payroll/work-entry-types.png){.align-center}

#### New work entry type

To create a new `Work Entry Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
click the `New`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button, and enter the
information for the following sections on the form.

##### General information section

- `Work Entry Type Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: The name
  should be short and descriptive, such as [Sick Time]{.title-ref} or
  [Public Holiday]{.title-ref}.
- `Payroll Code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: This code appears
  with the work entry type on timesheets and payslips. Since the code is
  used in conjunction with the *Accounting* application, it is advised
  to check with the accounting department for a code to use.
- `DMFA code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: This code is used to
  identify `DMFA (De Multifunctionele Aangifte)`{.interpreted-text
  role="abbr"} entries on a corresponding DMFA report. The DMFA report
  is a quarterly report that Belgian-based companies are required to
  submit for social security reporting purposes. This report states the
  work done by the employees during the quarter, as well as the salaries
  paid to those employees.
- `External Code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: This code is used
  for exporting data to a third-party payroll service. Check with the
  third-party being used in order to determine the
  `External Code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to enter for the
  new work entry type.
- `SDWorx code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: This code is only
  for companies that use SDWorx, a payroll service provider.
- `Color`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select a color for the
  particular work entry type.

##### Display in payslip section

- `Rounding`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: The rounding method
  selected determines how quantities on timesheet entries are displayed
  on the payslip.
  - `No Rounding`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: A timesheet entry
    is not modified.
  - `Half Day`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: A timesheet entry is
    rounded to the closest half day amount.
  - `Day`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: A timesheet entry is
    rounded to the closest full day amount.

::: example
If the working time is set to an 8-hour work day (40-hour work week),
and an employee enters a time of 5.5 hours on a timesheet, and
`Rounding`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is set to
`No Rounding`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, the entry remains 5.5
hours. If `Rounding`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is set to
`Half Day`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, the entry is changed to 4
hours. If it is set to `Day`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, it is
changed to 8 hours.
:::

##### Unpaid section

- `Unpaid in Structures Types`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: If
  the work entry is for work that is not paid, specify which pay
  structure the unpaid work entry applies to from the drop-down menu.
  Some situations where work would be logged on a timesheet but no
  compensation given would be for unpaid internships, unpaid training,
  or volunteer work.

##### Valid for advantages section

- `Meal Voucher`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: If the work entry
  should count towards a meal voucher, check the box.
- `Representation Fees`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: If the work
  entry should count towards representation fees, check the box.
- `Private Car Reimbursement`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: If the
  work entry should count towards a private car reimbursement, check the
  box.

##### Time off options section

- `Time Off`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Check this box if the
  work entry type can be selected for a time off request or entry in the
  *Time Off* application. If `Time Off`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} is checked, a `Time Off
  Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field appears. This field has
  a drop-down menu to select the specific type of time off, such as
  [Paid Time Off]{.title-ref}, [Sick Time Off]{.title-ref}, or [Extra
  Hours]{.title-ref} for example. A new type of time off can be entered
  in the field if the listed types of time off in the drop-down menu do
  not display the type of time off needed.
- `Keep Time Off Right`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: This is for
  Belgian-specific companies only, and will not appear for other
  localizations. Check this box if the work entry is for time off that
  will affect the time off benefits for the following year. Workers are
  given time off each year according to the government, and in some
  cases, time-off taken during a specific time period can affect how
  much time off the employee will receive or accrue the following year.

##### Reporting section

- `Unforeseen Absence`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: If the work
  entry should be visible on the unforeseen absences report, check this
  box.

![New work entry type form with all fields to be filled in.](payroll/new-work-entry.png){.align-center}

### Working schedules {#payroll/working-times}

To view the currently configured working schedules, go to
`Payroll --> Configuration
--> Work Entries --> Working Schedules`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. The working schedules that are available for an
employee\'s contracts and work entries are found in this list.

Working schedules are company-specific. Each company must identify each
type of working schedule they use.

::: example
An Odoo database containing multiple companies that use a standard
40-hour work week needs to have a separate working schedule entry for
each company that uses the 40-hour standard work week.

A database with five companies that all use a standard 40-hour work week
needs to have five separate 40-hour working schedules configured.
:::

![All working schedules available to use currently set up in the database for the company.](payroll/working-schedules.png){.align-center}

#### New working schedule

To create a new working schedule, click the `New`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} button, and enter the information on the form.

The fields are auto-populated for a regular 40-hour work week but can be
modified. First, change the name of the working time by modifying the
text in the `Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field. Next, make
any adjustments to the days and times that apply to the new working
time.

In the `Working Hours`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab, modify
the `Day of Week`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`Day Period`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
`Work Entry Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} selections by
clicking on the drop-down menus in each column and making the desired
selection. The `Work From`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`Work To`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} columns are modified by
typing in the time.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The `Work From`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`Work To`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} times must be in a 24-hour
format. For example, [2:00 PM]{.title-ref} would be entered as
[14:00]{.title-ref}.
::::

If the working time should be in a two-week configuration, click the
`Switch to 2 weeks
calendar`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button in the top left.
This creates entries for an `Even week`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} and an `Odd week`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

![New working schedule form.](payroll/new-working-schedule.png){.align-center}

## Salary

### Structure types {#payroll/structure-types}

In Odoo, an employee\'s payslip is based on *structures* and *structure
types*, which both affect how an employee enters timesheets. Each
structure type is an individual set of rules for processing a timesheet
entry, which consists of different structures nested within it.
Structure types define how often an employee gets paid, the working
hours, and if wages are based on a salary (fixed) or how many hours the
employee worked (varied).

For example, a structure type could be [Employee]{.title-ref}, and that
structure type could have two different structures in it: a [Regular
Pay]{.title-ref} structure which includes all the separate rules for
processing regular pay, as well as a structure for an [End of Year
Bonus]{.title-ref} which includes the rules only for the end of year
bonus. Both the [Regular Pay]{.title-ref} structure and [End of Year
Bonus]{.title-ref} structure are structures within the
[Employee]{.title-ref} structure type.

The different structure types can be seen by going to
`Payroll --> Configuration -->
Salary --> Structure Types`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}.

There are two default structure types configured in Odoo: *Employee* and
*Worker*. Typically, *Employee* is used for salaried employees, which is
why the wage type is *Monthly Fixed Wage*, and *Worker* is typically
used for employees paid by the hour, so the wage type is *Hourly Wage*.

![List of all currently configured structure types available to use.](payroll/structure-type.png){.align-center}

### New structure type

To make a new structure type, click the `New`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} button and a structure type form appears. Enter the
information in the fields. Most fields are pre-populated, but all the
fields can be modified.

- `Structure Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter the name
  for the new structure type, such as \'Employee\' or \'Worker\'.
- `Country`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select the country that
  the new structure type applies to from the drop-down menu.
- `Wage Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select what type of
  wage the new structure type will use, either
  `Monthly Fixed Wage`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or
  `Hourly Wage`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. If the wage type is
  going to be used for salaried employees who receive the same wage
  every pay period, select `Monthly Fixed
  Wage`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. If the wage type is going to
  be used for employees who receive wages based on how many hours they
  worked during a pay period, select `Hourly Wage`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}.
- `Default Scheduled Pay`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select the
  typical pay schedule for the new structure type from the drop-down
  menu. Options are `Monthly`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  `Quarterly`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  `Semi-annually`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  `Annually`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  `Weekly`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  `Bi-weekly`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  `Bi-monthly`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. This indicates how
  often this type of structure type is paid out.
- `Default Working Hours`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select the
  default working hours for the new structure type from the drop-down
  menu. All available working hours for the currently selected company
  appear in the drop-down menu. The default working hours that are
  pre-configured in Odoo is the
  `Standard 40 hours/week`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} option. If
  the needed working hours do not appear in the list, a
  `new set of default working hours can be created <new-default-working-hours>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}.
- `Regular Pay Structure`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Type in
  the name for the regular pay structure.
- `Default Work Entry Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select
  the default type of work entry the new structure type will fall under
  from the drop-down menu. Options include
  `Attendance`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  `Overtime Hours`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  `Generic Time Off`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  `Compensatory Time Off`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  `Home Working`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  `Unpaid`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  `Sick Time Off`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, `Paid Time
  Off`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
  `Out Of Contract`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

![New structure type form to fill out when creating a new structure type.](payroll/new-structure.png){.align-center}

#### New default working hours

To make new default working hours, type the name for the new working
hours in the `Default
Working Hours`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field on the new
structure type form. Click `Create and edit`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}. A default working hours form will pop up. The default
working hours form has two sections, a general information section and a
tab listing out all the individual working hours by day and time. When
the form is filled out, click `Save & Close`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}.

- `Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Type in the name for the
  new default working hours. This should be descriptive and clear to
  understand, such as [Standard 20 Hours/Week]{.title-ref}.

- `Company`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select the company that
  can use these new default working hours from the drop-down menu. Keep
  in mind, working hours are company-specific and cannot be shard
  between companies. Each company needs to have their own working hours
  set.

- `Average Hour Per Day`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: The average
  hours per day field will be auto-populated based on the working hours
  configured in the *Working Hours* tab. This entry affects resource
  planning, since the average daily hours affect what resources can be
  used, and in what quantity, per work day.

- `Timezone`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select the timezone
  that the new default working hours will be used for from the drop-down
  menu.

- `Company Full Time`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter the
  number of hours per week an employee would need to work in order to be
  considered a full-time employee. Typically, this is approximately 40
  hours, and this number affects what types of benefits an employee can
  receive based on their employment status (full-time vs part-time).

- `Work Time rate`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: This percentage
  is auto-generated based on the entry for the
  `Company Full Time`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and the working
  hours configured in the *Working Hours* tab. This number should be
  between [0.00%]{.title-ref} and [100%]{.title-ref}, so if the
  percentage is above [100%]{.title-ref}, it is an indication that the
  working times and/or `Company Full Time`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} hours need adjustment.

- `Working Hours`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} Tab: This tab is
  where each day\'s specific working hours are listed. When a new
  default working hour form is created, the working hours tab is
  pre-populated with a default 40-hour week, with each day divided into
  three timed sections. Every day has morning (8:00-12:00), lunch
  (12:00-13:00), and evening (13:00-17:00) hours configured using a 24
  hour time format. To adjust any of these hours, click on the specific
  field to adjust, and make the adjustment using the drop-down menus, or
  in the specific case of the times, type in the desired time.

  :::: note
  ::: title
  Note
  :::

  If the working hours are not consistent each week, and the hours are
  on a bi-weekly schedule instead, click the
  `Switch to 2 week calendar`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button
  at the top of the new default working hours form. This will change the
  working hours tab to display two weeks of working times that can be
  adjusted.
  ::::

### Structures

*Salary structures* are the different ways an employee gets paid within
a specific *structure*, and are specifically defined by various rules.

The amount of structures a company needs for each structure type depends
on how many different ways employees are paid, and how their pay is
calculated. For example, a common structure that could be useful to add
may be a [Bonus]{.title-ref}.

To view all the various structures for each structure type, go to
`Payroll -->
Configuration --> Salary --> Structures`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}.

Each `structure type <payroll/structure-types>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} lists the various structures associated with it. Each
structure contains a set of rules that define it.

![All available salary structures.](payroll/salary-structure.png){.align-center}

Click on a structure to view its `Salary Rules`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}. These rules are what calculate the payslip for the
employee.

![Salary structure details for Regular Pay, listing all the specific Salary Rules.](payroll/structure-regular-pay-rules.png){.align-center}

### Rules

Each structure has a set of *salary rules* to follow for accounting
purposes. These rules are configured by the localization, and affect
actions in the *Accounting* application, so modifications to the default
rules, or the creation of new rules, should only be done when necessary.

To view all the rules, go to
`Payroll app --> Configuration --> Salary --> Rules`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. Click on a structure (such as
`Regular Pay`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}) to view all the rules.

To make a new rule, click `New`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. A
new rule form appears. Enter the information in the fields.

The required fields for a rule are:

- `Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter a name for the rule.
- `Category`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select a category the
  rule applies to from the drop-down menu, or enter a new one.
- `Code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter a code to be used for
  this new rule. It is recommended to coordinate with the accounting
  department for a code to use as this will affect accounting reports
  and payroll processing.
- `Salary Structure`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select a salary
  structure the rule applies to from the drop-down menu, or enter a new
  one.
- `Condition Based on`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: In the
  `General`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab, select from the
  drop-down menu whether the rule is `Always True`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} (always applies), a `Range`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} (applies to a specific range, which is entered
  beneath the selection), or a `Python Expression`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} (the code is entered beneath the selection).
- `Amount Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: In the
  `General`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab, select from the
  drop-down menu whether the amount is a
  `Fixed Amount`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, a
  `Percentage (%)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, or a `Python
  Code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Depending on what is
  selected, the fixed amount, percentage, or Python code needs to be
  entered next.

![Enter the information for the new rule on the new rule form.](payroll/new-rule.png){.align-center}

### Rule parameters

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Currently, the `Rule Parameters`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
feature found inside the `Payroll app
--> Configuration --> Salary --> Rule Parameters`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} menu is still in development and only serves a
specific use case for Belgian markets. The documentation will be updated
when this section has matured to more markets.
::::

### Other input types

When creating payslips, it is sometimes necessary to add other entries
for specific circumstances, like expenses, reimbursements, or
deductions. These other inputs can be configured by going to
`Payroll --> Configuration --> Salary --> Other Input Types`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}.

![A list of other input types for payroll that can be selected when creating a new entry for
a payslip.](payroll/other-input.png){.align-center}

To create a new input type, click the `New`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} button. Enter the `Description`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, the `Code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
which structure it applies to in the
`Availability in Structure`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

The `Code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is used in the salary
rules to compute payslips. If the
`Availability in Structure`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field is
left blank, it indicates that the new input type is available for all
payslips and is not exclusive to a specific structure.
::::

![Create a new Input Type.](payroll/input-type-new.png){.align-center}

## Salary package configurator

The various options under the
`Salary Package Configurator`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section
of the
`Payroll --> Configuration --> Salary Package Configurator`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} menu all affect an employee\'s potential salary.
These sections (`Advantages`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`Personal Info`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`Resume`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
`Offers`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}) specify what benefits can
be offered to an employee in their salary package.

Depending on what information an employee enters (such as deductions,
dependents, etc.), their salary is adjusted accordingly. When an
applicant applies for a job on the company website, the sections under
`Salary Package Configurator`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
directly affect what the applicant sees, and what is populated as the
applicant enters information.

### Advantages

When offering potential employees a position, there can be certain
*advantages* or benefits set in Odoo in addition to the salary to make
an offer more appealing (such as extra time off, the use of a company
car, reimbursement for a phone or internet, etc.).

To see the advantages, go to
`Payroll --> Configuration --> Salary Package
Configurator --> Advantages`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}.
Advantages are grouped by `Structure type`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, and the advantage listed for a particular structure
type is only available for that specific structure.

![A list view of all the advantages or benefits that is available for each structure type.](payroll/advantages.png){.align-center}

::: example
A company has two structure types, one labeled
`Employee`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and anther labeled
`Intern`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. The
`Employee`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} structure type contains an
advantage of using a company car, while the `Intern`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} structure type does not. Instead, the
`Intern`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} structure type has a meal
voucher advantage available, while the `Employee`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} structure type does not.

A person hired under the `Employee`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
structure type can use a company car, but cannot have meal vouchers. The
opposite is true for someone hired under the `Intern`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} structure type. They would have meal vouchers available
to them, not the use of a company car.
:::

To make a new advantage, click the `New`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} button, and enter the information in the fields. The
required fields for an advantage are:

- `Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter the name for the
  advantage.
- `Advantage Field`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select from the
  drop-down menu what field in the payslip this advantage appears under.
- `Advantage Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select from the
  drop-down menu what type of advantage the benefit is. Select from
  `Monthly Benefit in Kind`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  `Monthly Advantages in Net`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  `Monthly Advantages in Cash`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, or
  `Yearly Advantages in Cash`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
- `Salary Structure Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select
  from the drop-down menu which salary structure type this advantage
  applies to.
- `Display Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select from the
  drop-down menu how this advantage is displayed.

![List of advantages employee\'s can have.](payroll/new-advantage.png){.align-center}

### Personal info

Every employee in Odoo has an *employee card* which is created when a
candidate becomes an employee. This card includes all of their personal
information, resume, work information, and documents.

The personal information is gathered from the salary package
configurator section that a candidate fills out after being offered a
position. This personal information is then transferred to the employee
card when they are hired.

To view an employee\'s card, go to the main
`Employees`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"} app dashboard, and
click on the employee\'s card.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

An employee card can be thought of as an employee personnel file.
::::

The *Personal Information* section lists all of the fields that are
available to enter on the employee\'s card. To access this section, go
to `Payroll --> Configuration --> Salary
Package Configurator  --> Personal Info`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}.

![A list of all the personal information that appears on employee card to enter.](payroll/personal-info.png){.align-center}

To edit a personal info entry, select the entry from the list, and
modify the personal info. To create a new personal info entry, click the
`New`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button.

The required fields, aside from entering the
`Information`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} name, are `Related
Model`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`Related Field`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
`Category`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Select a
`Related Model`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} from the drop-down
menu. `Employee`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} populates the field
by default, but the `Bank
Account`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} option is also available if
the information is related to a bank account instead. Select a
`Related Field`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} from the drop-down
menu that best describes what kind of personal information this entry
is, and where it is going to be stored in the backed. Then, select a
`Category`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} from the drop-down menu
that the personal information should be under, such as
`Address`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or
`Personal Documents`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

The two most important fields on the personal info form are
`Is Required`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`Display Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Checking the
`Is Required`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} box makes the field
mandatory on the employee\'s card. The `Display Type`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} drop-down menu allows for the information to be entered
in a variety of ways, from a `Text`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
box, to a customizable `Radio`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
button, a `Checkbox`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, a
`Document`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and more.

![New personal information entry.](payroll/personal-new.png){.align-center}

### Resume

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Currently, the `Resume`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} feature found
inside the `Payroll app -->
Configuration --> Salary Package Configurator --> Resume`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} menu is still in development and only serves a
specific use case for Belgian markets. The documentation will be updated
when this section has matured to more markets.
::::

### Offers

When a candidate is offered a position, there are several items that
need to be tracked in order for a business to stay organized, such as
where in the offer process the candidate is, how long the offer is valid
for, as well as all the offer details. These details are all stored in
each *offers* record.

To view all offers, go to
`Payroll --> Configuration --> Salary Package Configurator
--> Offers`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}. All offers that
have been sent to either potential candidates or current employees
appears in this list. The status, offer start date and expiration date,
amount of the contract, and more, can all be found in this list. Offers
sent via the `Recruitment`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
application appear here, but there is an option to create a new offer
from the `Payroll`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} application as
well.

![A list of all offers given to a current employee or potential candidate along with the
status of the offer.](payroll/offers.png){.align-center}

To create a new offer, click the `New`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} button. The two required fields are the
`Contract Template`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and the
`Company`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Select the
`Contract Template`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`Company`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} from the drop-down menus.
Fill in any other details for the offer, such as the
`Job Title`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`Department`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, the
`Contract Start Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and the
`Offer Validity Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

::: {.toctree titlesonly=""}
payroll/contracts payroll/payslips payroll/work_entries
payroll/reporting
:::




--- SOURCE: hr/recruitment/new_job.md ---

# Job positions

In the default `Recruitment`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}
dashboard view, all job positions are shown, regardless of status.
Current published positions with active applicants are shown, as well as
job positions that have been created but have not yet been published.

Each job position is shown in an individual kanban card. If the job
position is active and candidates can apply, then a
`Published`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} banner will appear in the
top-right corner of the card.

View submitted applications by clicking anywhere on a job position card.

![Main dashboard view of Recruitment showing all job positions.](new_job/jobs.png){.align-center}

## Create a new job position

Create a new job position from the main Recruitment dashboard by
clicking the `New`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button in the
top-left corner.

Then, a `Create a Job Position`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
pop-up window will appear. From here, enter the name of the position
(such as [Sales Manager]{.title-ref}, [Mechanical Engineer]{.title-ref},
etc.). When complete, click the `Create`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} button to save the entry, or the
`Discard`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button to delete it.

![Create a new job position.](new_job/job-title.png){.align-center}

Once the job position has been created, it will appear as a card in the
kanban view on the main `Recruitment`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
dashboard.

### Edit a new job position

After the job position is created, it\'s time to enter the details for
the position. Click on the `â‹® (three dots)`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} icon in the upper-right corner of the relevant card to
reveal several options, and then click `Configuration`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} to edit the details.

![Edit the job position card.](new_job/edit-job.png){.align-center}

Enter the job description in the `Job Summary`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} tab. This information is what is visible to potential
applicants when searching for available jobs.

#### Recruitment

All the basic information about the job position is listed under the
`Recruitment`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab. None of the fields
are required, but it is a good idea to provide at least a few details,
such as where the job is located.

The fields can be filled out as follows:

- `Department`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: select the relevant
  department for the job position.
- `Job Location`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: select the physical
  address for the job.
- `Employment Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: select what type
  of position the job is, such as `Full-Time`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}, `Part-Time`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, etc.
- `Company`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: select the company the
  job is for.
- `Target`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: enter the number of
  employees to be hired for this position.
- `Is Published`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: activate this
  option to publish the job online.
- `Website`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: select the website where
  the job will be published.
- `Recruiter`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: select the person who
  will be doing the recruiting for this role.
- `Interviewers`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: select who should
  perform the interview(s). Multiple people can be selected.
- `Interview Form`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: select an
  `Interview form <interview>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} that
  applicants will fill out prior to their interview.
- `Contract Template`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: select a
  contract template that will be used when offering the job to a
  candidate.
- `Process Details`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section: this
  section contains information that is displayed online for the job
  position. This informs the applicants of the timeline and steps for
  the recruitment process, so they know when to expect a reply.
  - `Time to Answer`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: enter the
    number of days before the applicant is contacted.
  - `Process`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: enter the various
    stages the candidate will go through during the recruitment process.
  - `Days to get an Offer`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: enter the
    number of days before the applicant should expect an offer after the
    recruitment process has ended.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The `Process Details`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section is a
text field. All answers are typed in rather than selected from a
drop-down menu. The text is displayed on the website exactly as it
appears in this tab.
::::

![Enter job information details in the recruitment tab.](new_job/recruitment-tab.png){.align-center}

### Create interview form {#interview}

An *Interview Form* is used to determine if a candidate is a good fit
for a job position. Interview forms can be as specific or general as
desired, and can take the form of a certification, an exam, or a general
questionnaire. Interview forms are determined by the recruitment team.

All interview forms must be created, there are no pre-configured forms
in Odoo. To create an interview form, start from the recruitment tab of
the `Job Position`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} form. In the
`Interview Form`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field, enter a name
for the new interview form. As the name is typed, several options
populate beneath the entry,
`Create (interview form name)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`View all`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
`Create and edit...`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Click
`Create and edit...`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. and a
`Create Interview Form`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} pop-up window
appears.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The option `View all`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} only appears if
there are any interview forms already created. If no interview forms
exist, the only options available are `Create (interview form
name)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
`Create and edit...`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
::::

First, enter a name for the form in the `Name`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} field. This should be indicative of when the form
should be used. For example, is the form specific to a job position, or
is it a general form that can be used for all recruitment scenarios?

Next, select what kind of interview form is being created. The default
is `Custom`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, which is pre-selected.
The various options are `Survey`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`Live session`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`Assessment`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`Custom`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
`Appraisal`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

Then select the person responsible for the form from the drop-down menu
for the `Responsible`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field.

If desired, an image can be added to the interview form. Mouse over the
camera icon on the far right and a `âœï¸ (pencil)`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} icon appears. Click the `âœï¸ (pencil)`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} icon and a file explorer window appears. Navigate to
the desired image file, then click `Open`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} to select it.

![The top portion of the new interview form with everything filled out and selected.](new_job/create-interview-form.png){.align-center}

#### Questions

In the `Questions`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab, click on
`Add a section`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to add a section to
the form. A line appears, and a section heading can be entered. When
complete, click off the line, or press enter to lock in the new section
on the form.

Next, click `Add a question`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to add a
question to the section. A `Create
Sections and Questions`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} pop-up window
appears where the question details are entered. Type out the question in
the top line.

There are several `Question Types`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to
choose from:

- `Multiple choice: only one answer`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
  a multiple choice question that only allows the candidate to select
  one answer
- `Multiple choice: multiple answers allowed`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}: a multiple choice question that allows the candidate
  to select multiple answers
- `Multiple Lines Text Box`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: allows
  the applicant to enter several lines of text
- `Single Line Text Box`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: limits the
  applicant to only a single line of text
- `Numerical Value`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: only allows a
  number to be entered
- `Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: a calendar module is
  presented to select a date
- `Datetime`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: a calendar module and a
  clock icon is presented to select a date and time
- `Matrix`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: a customizable table that
  allows the candidate to choose an answer for each row

After selecting a question type, a sample question appears in gray. This
represents how the question will be displayed to applicants.

![Add a new question to the interview form.](new_job/questions.png){.align-center}

Questions and sections can be reorganized. Move them by clicking and
dragging individual section headings or question lines to their desired
position(s).

Sections are indicated by a gray background, while questions have a
white background.

![A sample of categories and questions for a candidate.](new_job/questions-matrix.png){.align-center}

##### Answers

If `Multiple choice: only one answer`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, `Multiple choice: multiple answers
allowed`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`Single Line Text Box`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, or
`Matrix`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is selected for the
`Question Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, an
`Answers`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab appears beneath the
question. If another question type is selected, the
`Answers`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab remains hidden from
view.

:::::: tabs
::: tab
Multiple choice

For both the `Multiple choice: only one answer`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} and `Multiple choice:
multiple answers allowed`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} question
type, the answers are populated in the same way.

First, in the `Answers`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab, click
`Add a line`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. A line appears, and an
answer can be entered. After typing in the answer, click off the line,
or press enter to lock in the new answer on the form and have another
answer line appear.

If desired, an image can be attached to the answer. Click on a line to
select it, and an `Upload your file`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
button appears on the right side. Click the `Upload
your file`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button and a file explorer
window appears. Navigate to the image file, select it, then click
`Open`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to select it.

Repeat this for all the answers to be added for the multiple choice
question. The answers can be rearranged in any order. To move an answer,
click on the six small squares on the far left of each answer line, and
drag the answer to the desired position. The order the answers appear in
the form is the order the answers will appear online.

To delete a line, click on the `ðŸ—‘ï¸ (trash can)`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} icon on the far right side of the answer line.

![Answers to a multiple choice question, where each line has a different answer listed.](new_job/multi-answers.png){.align-center}
:::

::: tab
Single Line Text Box

If the `Single Line Text Box`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
question type is selected, only two checkboxes appear in the
`Answers`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab:

- `Input must be an email`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: activate
  this option if the answer must be in the format of an email address.
  - `Save as user email?`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: this
    option appears if `Input must be an email`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} is selected. This saves the email entered on the
    form as the user\'s email, and will be used anytime Odoo contacts
    the user via email.
- `Save as user nickname?`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: activate
  this option to populate the answer as the user\'s nickname. This is
  stored and used anywhere Odoo uses a nickname.

![The three possible checkboxes that can appear if a single line of text is selected
for the question type.](new_job/single-line.png){.align-center}
:::

::: tab
Matrix

Sometimes, a question is asked that does not fit a standard answer
format, and is best suited for a matrix. For example, asking an
applicant what is their availability to work compared to the various
shifts is a perfect question for a matrix format. In this example, an
applicant can click on all the shifts they are available to work.

For a `Matrix`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} question type, there
are two sets of data that need to be input. The rows and columns must
both be configured. The columns are represented by the
`Choices`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section, while the rows are
configured in the `Rows`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section.

The method for populating both sections is the same. In the
`Answers`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab, click
`Add a line`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in either the
`Choices`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or `Row`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} section. A line appears, and an answer can be entered.
After typing in the answer, click off the line, or press enter to lock
in the new answer on the form and have another answer line appear.
Repeat this for all answers for both the `Choices`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} and `Rows`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} sections.

<figure class="align-center">
<img src="new_job/matrix.png"
alt="This is an example matrix that asks an applicant what shifts they are available to work on Saturdays and Sundays, either morning, afternoon, or evening." />
<figcaption aria-hidden="true">This is an example matrix that asks an
applicant what shifts they are available to work on Saturdays and
Sundays, either morning, afternoon, or evening.</figcaption>
</figure>
:::
::::::

##### Description

Enter any information that may be helpful to an applicant. This
description will appear for this specific question only, and therefore
should be question-specific and not generalized.

##### Options

To view the options that are available to set for a question, click on
the `Options`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab. The
`Layout`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`Constraints`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
`Live Sessions`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} sections are
universal for all `Question Types`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
while the `Answers`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab is specific
to the `Question Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} selected, and
changes based on the selection.

###### Answers

- `Multiple choice: only one answer`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  and `Multiple choice: multiple answers
  allowed`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: a
  `Show Comments Field`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} option
  appears. Activate the option to allow the applicant to answer the
  question by typing in an answer (or comment). A `Comment
  Message`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
  `Comment is an answer`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field appear
  if activated. Enter the text to appear in the
  `Comment Message`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field. This
  should be helpful to the applicant, such as [If other, please
  specify]{.title-ref}. Last, if the comment should be logged as the
  applicant\'s answer, activate the box.
- `Multiple Lines Text Box`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: a
  `Placeholder`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field appears. Enter
  any text that should appear with the question to help clarify how the
  applicant should answer.
- `Single Line Text Box`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
  `Numerical Value`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: a
  `Validate entry`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} option appears.
  Activate this option if what the applicant enters must be a numerical
  value, *and* needs to be verified. The answer can *only* be verified
  if it is a numerical entry. When activated, several other options
  appear. Enter the values for the `Min/Max Limits`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} in the two fields. Next, enter the text that appears
  when the answer given does not fit within the designated minimum and
  maximum parameters. Last, enter any text in the
  `Placeholder`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field to provide any
  additional information or directions to assist the applicant.
- `Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
  `Datetime`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: a
  `Validate entry`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} option appears.
  Activate this option if the applicant\'s answer needs to be verified.
  When activated, several other options appear. Enter the date ranges
  for the `Min/Max Limits`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in the two
  fields. Click on a field, either the `minimum`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} or `maximum`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
  a calendar appears. Select the dates for the corresponding fields.
  Next, enter the text that appears when the answer given does not fit
  within the designated minimum and maximum dates. Last, enter any text
  in the `Placeholder`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field to
  provide any additional information or directions to assist the
  applicant.
- `Matrix`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: the first option that
  appears is `Matrix Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Select
  either `One choice per row`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or
  `Multiple choices per row`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} using
  the drop-down menu. The next option is
  `Show Comments Field`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Activate the
  option if there should be a comment displayed to the applicant. If
  activated, a `Comment Message`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
  `Comment is an answer`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field
  appear. Enter the text to appear in the `Comment
  Message`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field. This should be an
  instruction helpful to the applicant, such as [If other, please
  specify]{.title-ref}. Last, if the comment should be logged as the
  applicant\'s answer, activate the box.

###### Constraints

If the question is required to be answered by the applicant, activate
the box next to `Mandatory Answer`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
An `Error message`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field appears,
with some example text in gray (*This question requires an answer*).
Enter the message that should appear if the applicant attempts to move
on to the next question without answering this required one. The text
should explain that the question must be answered.

###### Layout

If the question should only appear if a previous question is answered in
a specific way, activate the `Conditional Display`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} option. A new `Triggering Question`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} field appears. Using the drop-down menu, select the
previous question this new question is linked to. Once a previous
question is selected, a `Triggering Answer`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} field appears. Select the answer that must be selected
in order for the new question to appear.

::: example
To further illustrate a triggering question, the following is an example
that is applicable to recruitment. The question, [Do you have experience
with managing a sales team?]{.title-ref} is already added. A new
question is then added, [How many years of experience?]{.title-ref}.
This question should *only* appear if the applicant selected
[Yes]{.title-ref} to the question [Do you have prior experience managing
a sales team?]{.title-ref}.

To properly configure this example, activate the
`Conditional Display`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} option. Then,
select [Do you have experience with managing a sales team?]{.title-ref}
as the `Triggering
Question`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Then, select
`Yes`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} for the triggering answer.

![The layout field when properly configured for a conditional question.](new_job/layout.png){.align-center}
:::

###### Live Sessions

If the question is for a live session, activate the
`Question Time Limit`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} option. A
`seconds`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field appears. Enter the
amount of time allotted for the applicant to enter the answer, in
seconds.

#### Options

Next, configure the various options for the interview form. Click the
`Options`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab to view all the options
to configure, by category.

##### Questions

- `Pagination`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: choose how the
  questions should be displayed.
  - `One page per question`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: display
    a single question on each page.
  - `One page per section`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: display
    each section with the corresponding questions on an individual page.
  - `One page with all the questions`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}: display all sections and questions at the same
    time.
- `Display Progress as`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: choose how
  to display the percentage of questions remaining to answer. This
  option only appears if either
  `One page per question`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or `One
  page per section`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is selected for
  `Pagination`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
  - `Percentage left`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: display the
    remaining amount in a percentage (%).
  - `Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: display the remaining
    amount in a numerical value.
- `Question Selection`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: choose which
  questions are presented.
  - `All questions`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: display the
    entire form, with all questions form all sections.
  - `Randomized per Section`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: display
    only a random selection of questions from each section.
- `Back Button`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: activate this option
  if the applicant is able to click a back button to go back to previous
  questions.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Although it is a selectable option, the
`Randomized per section`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} option
should only be used if receiving partial information/an incomplete
survey from every applicant is acceptable to the business.
::::

##### Time & Scoring

- `Survey Time Limit`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: activate this
  option to limit the time allowed to complete the form. When selected,
  a field to enter the minutes appears next to the checked box. Enter
  the time (using an XX:XX minute/second format) in the field.
- `Scoring`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: choose how the questions
  should be scored.
  - `No scoring`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: select this option
    to not score the form.
  - `Scoring with answers at the end`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}: select this option to score the form and display
    the correct answers for the candidate when they are finished with
    the form.
  - `Scoring without answers at the end`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}: select this option to score the form but not
    display the answers to the candidate.
- `Required Score (%)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: this option
  appears if one of the scoring options was selected. Enter the
  percentage the candidate needs to pass the exam (example, 80.00%). The
  entry should be written in an "XX.XX" format.
- `Is a Certification`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: activate this
  option if the form is a certification exam. When activated, a
  drop-down menu appears next to the checkbox. Select one of the default
  formats for the PDF certificate that will be sent to the candidate
  after completing the certification exam. Click the
  `Preview`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button to view an example
  of the PDF certificate.
- `Certified Email Template`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: if the
  `Is a Certification`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} box is
  activated, a `Certified Email Template`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} appears. Select the email template from the drop-down
  menu that is to be used when the applicant passes the test. Click the
  `External Link`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} icon to the right
  of the email template to preview the email.

##### Participants

- `Access Mode`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: specify who can
  access the exam. Either `Anyone with the link`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} or `Invited people only`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}.
- `Require Login`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: activate this
  option to require candidates to log in before taking the exam, whether
  they have a valid token or not.
- `Limit Attempts`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: if there is a
  limit to how many times the exam can be taken, activate this box, then
  enter the maximum attempt number in the field next to it.

##### Live Session

- `Session Code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: enter the access
  code that will allow the viewers into the live exam session.
- `Session Link`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: the link appears in
  a box next to the `Session Link`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  option. Click the `Copy`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button to
  copy the link.
- `Reward quick answers`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: if the exam
  is to be taken live, activate this option to award more points to
  participants who answer quickly.

After all fields have been entered, click the `Save`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} button to save the changes, or click
`Discard`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to delete the changes.

![Various options to configure for the interview form.](new_job/options.png){.align-center}

#### Description

When the applicant begins the survey, the text entered in this tab
appears at the top of the survey page. Enter any information or
descriptions that would be helpful to the applicant.

#### End Message

After the survey is complete, the message entered in this tab is
displayed for the applicant.
